Reviews.Title: “Business Stay in London”
Reviews.Author: Patrick R
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant experience during my business stay in London during March 2012. I was greatly impressed with the friendliness and professionalism of the lobby staff at check-in and check-out and immediately took notice how well kept this hotel is from a cleanliness standpoint. Something I appreciated after a long flight! My room was small, but comfortable, had great lighting, nice bathroom that had an awesome shower, and decent sized flat-screen tv. The king-sized bed I had was comforable and the hotel really makes a point to be green-friendly, something I find admirable. I ate breakfast and dinner in the restaurant and found the quality of the food as well as the price to be very good. It had a nice Italian-themed bar which had a wide selection of wine, beer and cocktails. I got a big kick out of the staff there, they were extremely friendly, professional and good natured, which was a good reason to patronize my new friends downstairs. My colleagues and I also used a small conference room which was small, but we only had eight of us, so we were pleased with the accommodations. Again the staff was top notch providing refreshments throughout the day. Location-wise, the Radisson Bloomsbury is centrally located between the Bloomsbury and Soho neighborhoods, so a diverse dining, socializing and close proximity to the theatre district await you. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in West End”
Reviews.Author: Bournemouthlady
Reviews.Content: We recently made our second visit to this hotel. We were just as impressed as we had been the first time. The location is great. You can easily walk to all the West End theatres (the farthest is about 10 mins) , SOHO, Trafalgar Square, National Gallery and even the Millenium Wheel if you like a bit of a walk. Loads of great, reasonably priced restaurants in SOHO. The staff at this hotel cannot do enough to be helpful and are very polite. The Breakfast is very good also, with a help yourself hot buffet as well as all the usual continental selection. You can can also have the wait staff bring your cooked breakfast or pancakes or Eggs Benedict (there was a small extra charge for the Eggs Benedict). The room was a litte small, but then they always are in London. But quite big enough for 2 people. Nice bathroom. The weekend package which includes breakfast and the in-house movie package is great. We really enjoyed the opportunity to have a little 'down-time' with a good movie. Overall, very nice and would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “just brilliant”
Reviews.Author: lesley1944
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in this wonderful hotel for two nights, in two fabulous rooms...The comfort of the bed plus superb bathroom was one of the best we have stayed, in London....The staff were all most obliging, courteous and friendly, food at breakfast and in the bar, excellent.Two perfect nights sleep completed the whole experience...we will be back...soon. Situation for the sights too, couldnt be better..short walk to the british museum and theatres....

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Pecks_9
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fantastic location and quality of the accomodation is second to none. Being in a central location comes at a price though and the noise of traffic in a first floor room overlooking the road is incessant. If you are a light sleeper ask for a different room or take ear plugs! Also take care at check in. We asked for a newspaper and were advised it was now pushed under the door and we would receive it by 8am. It was never ordered! We were also advised that when we used the £15 drinks voucher that came with the room the waitress would try and include a service charge and to advise her not to. We did this but still had to have a 5 minute conversation at check out a £3 charge before they accepted our explanation that we left a £1 to cover drinks that came to £16 and had not agreed to the service charge. None of this spolied the experience but it is not what you expect from a hotel of this quality

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Lolly19
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, 5 minutes walking from Oxford Street and the centre of London. Spacious and clean rooms with every comfort, like mini-bar, safe , iron and iron board, large shower, toiletries etc .. . It is not cheap, but it is ideal for a short stay in London. Nice and polite staff. Check-in upon arrival and they store your luggage for the day.

Reviews.Title: “All the reviews are true - this is a fantastic place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: im666_1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights recently at this Radisson over a weekend. The location speaks for itself - British Museum, tube stops, rail stations, Oxford st - all in the proximity of the hotel and add to its draw. Our room was on the 2nd floor facing the side street - was very very quiet. A bit on the smaller side, but still good enough. The room was clean, bed comfortable and bath luxurious. We had the buffet breakfast, which was also excellent. The staff were courteous and very helpful to us (we were travelling with a baby). My only point of feedback is on the shower - the walls dont extend as much and if you are a big person (6 ft +), you may have water outside the stall - which can be mopped up. All in all, this was a great find. Thanks to previous TA reviewers. I give it a 5 star rating and would return in a heartbeat to this hotel or other Radisson Edwardian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for West End”
Reviews.Author: MTBJay
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel via laterooms.com but would have happily paid more. The room was amazing and the staff were friendly and helpful. They even allowed us to leave our bags there after we had checked out. It's ideally located for the west end and is 2 minutes walk from the British Museum. Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels Experiences!”
Reviews.Author: Bacsusa
Reviews.Content: Left this review months go, it did not post. So here goes..... Our Concierge was exceptional (JL). We had a fifth floor corner suite that was truly spacious, comfortable, and modern. This hotel is 100 yards away from the British Museum, which is also a must see. The Bloomsbury is located in a great part of London, friendly and inviting. We will absolutely return to this wonderful property.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: CIDGRID
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel as it was rated 56 on tripadvisor. From the onset we received great friendly warm, service. Our first encounter, was with Joe (Joseph) on reception, He had great patience when we were trying to preallocate all our party into there rooms amongst confusion and tiredness. The room was compact, modern and comfortable. The location ideal and very central. It was nice to see that all staff sang from the same hymn sheet, All were friendly, attentive and very professional. I have been to many hotels around the world and in comparison this hotel is now in my top 5. Thank you to all the staff for contributing to our fantastic memories of our stay in London for our wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel/Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Amethyst2802
Reviews.Content: Stopped in one of the suites which was amazing. Great location for sight-seeing etc Reception staff were very polite and helpful. Bar prices were expensive but presume in-line with London prices. Would certainly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “good room, but on noisy road”
Reviews.Author: cat29
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel a rating of 4 based on the room, which was smart, clean and had a comfortable bed, nice bathroom and good lighting. Overall it was let down by the noise- I realised when booking that the hotel is very central, and its position is great- but it is on a noisy road with loud traffic all night. The double glazing did give a good noise reduction- but the room was rather stuffy and I had to choose between open window with traffic noise, and air conditioning which was also quite noisy and not very efficient. Even the bathroom fan seemed to be on all the time, even with light off and door closed. I got a good deal at the last minute but would not have liked to pay full price for the night's sleep I got. But for location, it's great and staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, pretty good”
Reviews.Author: BrianMPowell
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for most things in London. Right opposite the British Museum, just off Oxford street, close to theatres and the sights that tourists would want. A little expensive, but not overly, and it's central London after all. Free wifi, clean and safe just a very expensive lobby bar!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Sandison100
Reviews.Content: I couldn't rate our experience at this hotel highly enough. We decided to upgrade to a deluxe room and it was well worth it. Hotel rooms in London can be small, but our room was anything but, the bathroom was massive too, with a large walk in shower. The entire hotel was immaculate and the service we received from everyone was superb. I always like to stay in Bloomsbury when visiting London as it's such a great location. This is the first time I've stayed at the Radisson Bloomsbury but based on our last visit, it won't be the last time. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: Nick T
Reviews.Content: Very central hotel walking distance to most attractions and London nightlife. Service and staff are excellent. Free wifi and just a 2 minute stroll the Oxford Street shopping precinct. Nearest tube station is Tottenham Crt Rd just around the corner. Covent garden is a 10 minute walk as is the theatre district of Leicester Square. The only gripe is that breakfast is expensive but there are lots of alternative places just down the road. I would stay here again for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: MCtraveler1200
Reviews.Content: As a first time London visitor I was not sure where to stay or what to expect from our visit. Several people familiar with the city suggested Russell Sq as a good area to stay in. I investigated multiple B&Bs, but saw so many negative reviews that I decided to pay more and stay at a full service hotel. The Radisson on Bloomsbury was highly recommended by a business colleague of mine. I went with his recommendation and was delighted with my experience. The hotel is in a perfect location for getting around the city. We took the Tube from Heathrow to Holborn and had a 10 min walk to the hotel. We stayed in a 2nd floor room facing Bloomsbury St - I was initially concerned about possible street noise, but the person we spoke to when checking in said they have never had any complaints - and they were correct. We ended up with a very nice street view from our room - there was some street noise in the morning, but nothing that bothered us or disturbed our sleep. The British Museum is 2 blks away. We walked to Piccadilly (15 min) - saw the Hockney show (fantastic!) at the Royal Academy, continued to Trafalgar Sq (10 min further) just enjoying being part of the crowds on the streets. The next day we walked to St James Park (25 min) and on to Westminster Abby, Big Ben, across the Waterloo Bridge to the Hayward Gallery. By late afternoon we had walked enough and took a bus back to Tottenham Court Rd, a few blocks from the hotel. Riding on the top level of a double-decker bus is another great way to get a good view and 'feel' for the city. The hotel was a great experience - EVERY person on the staff was helpful, cordial and well informed! The lounge was a great place to unwind after a day of walking - reasonably priced (for London...) snacks and drinks with a contemporary, casual (but not obnoxiously hip) atmosphere. Our room was very comfortable with a contemporary decor. If you are used to US-sized rooms, be advised that the rooms are similar to those in New York - not cramped, but noticeably smaller. We hope to return to London for another visit in the near future and look forward to staying at the Radisson again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: ejseymour
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just love this hotel. We've stayed four or five times now over the years, and we have enjoyed really exceptional service from several members of staff. It's got all the great stuff you'd expect in a Radisson, in an amazing location (perfect for shopping, eating and drinking, theatre etc). We love the bar, and the lobby and the whole atmosphere of the hotel. We owe special thanks to Kumar, the front office manager, who is an absolute star, and really has helped to make this hotel even more special for us. Go for as luxury a room as you can, and enjoy all that this hotel and central London have to offer!

Reviews.Title: “London Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Margaret R
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this very clean and welcoming hotel. Well equipped bedrooms with internet access, mini bar, tea,coffee and kettle. Wonderful en suite with walk in power shower. Good location for Shaftesbury Avenue, theatres and Oxford Steet shops. Comfortable lounge bar area with an excellent variety of cocktails to choose from. All staff friendly, helpful and informative. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and comfortable hotel - well situated for West End”
Reviews.Author: John and Susan L
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here for my wife's birthday. Receptionist very polite and helpful. Had access to room at 1.00pm - 2 hours before official time. Room modern, clean and comfortable with nice bathroom and good shower. Traffic noise at night only problem, despite being on 4th floor - but next to busy road and traffic lights, with polie and ambulance sirens through the night, so mpretty inevitable. Didn't bother (somewhat deaf) me, but light-sleeping birthday girl disturbed by noise. (Have had e-mail from hotel just 4 days after our return promising a quieter room - v efficient) Did not eat breakfast at hotel as expensive (this is London) and we were going out to lunch each day - but very reasonable cafe/snack bar straight opposite and Pret a Manger just round the corner. However did have afternoon tea on first day, which was wonderful - had to eat it all - felt completely stuffed ! - and then had to stagger out to evening theatre (Blood Brothers at the Pheonix - brilliant).

Reviews.Title: “Good location and a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JJJLeightonBuzzard
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here last week as a post Christmas treat-- we had theatres and exhibitions booked and found the location excellent. From check in to check out we had a very pleasant stay--- we had a lovely room that was spacious ,warm and comfortable. We found the staff here to be first class--helpful, friendly and very welcoming . Will definitely make this our first choice of London hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for theatres”
Reviews.Author: CLB1968
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband last weekend. We checked in and were supposed to be upgraded as he is a Platinum member (ie stays in Radissons for almost a fifth of his life!). So when we got to our room we were a bit surprised. It was the tiniest double I'd ever seen and the wardrobe door was jammed. If you're on business OK, you're never in your room, but this was our child free weekend away! We went downstairs for a drink, and I persuaded my husband to go and have a quiet word at reception. Fortunately for us the Guest Services Manager Luke, was behind the concierge desk. He couldn't do enough for us, he was efficient, courteous, and made our trip. The staff are all (except the check in girl we had!) excellent. They are friendly without being overwhelming and incredibly efficient. The housekeeping staff all treat you to a friendly smile. We were given a bigger room with a bigger bed, and a bottle of wine for the hassle of moving. This was on the fifth floor overlooking some flats. The decor in all the rooms is exceptional. I really liked the breakfast buffet. And even just having a drink in the bar was enjoyable. Some of the ornaments and pictures are fab. We stayed in the Mayfair last year, and I prefer this. It's smaller but benefits from that I think. The restaurant was good in the evening, it was one of the coldest nights of the year and we just didn't want to walk anywhere. We went to the theatre and it was a ten minute walk down to the theatres on Shaftesbury. If we hadn't had the hassle to begin with I'd have given this five stars, as our trip would have been perfect. I'd love to know what scent they use in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: Kay_Z_DE
Reviews.Content: I already stayed at the Radisson Bloomsbury several times and I would always come back. The rooms always smell good, are clean and have a size that is o.k. (some might be small-ish, but if you travel for business you don't spend too much time in your room anyway). What makes this hotel great is its helpful stuff. I have never had to deal with unfriendly/unhelpful staff in this hotel - which is not granted even in 4-5 star hotels. I can fully recommend this hotel for business trips due to its good service and central location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but service isn't what it used to be.”
Reviews.Author: Trondheim10
Reviews.Content: This is my 3. (or 4. I don't remember) visit at this hotel. Nice hotel with nice design all over. Standard rooms are small so this time I booked a Deluxe room. The reason why I booked a deluxe is that I got a almost £100 off (or just to get me to book the room fast?) the roomrate (for 2 nights) because I booked early at Radisson.com (but I could not cancel the reservation at this price, if I did I would not get any money back). So I payed £355 for 2 nights but still I think it was a little expensive. I will not book it again for this price. I think it's not worth it. And is the normal price for deluxe room really £450 for 2 nights? I don't think so! Room was good size and nice designed. Bed was great! And I got a room with view of the courtyard. So it was a quiet room. And I could open window, so I used it as refrigerator for my water and beer as it was no space left in the minibar due to the automatic system in it (remove 1 item and put it back but you still have to pay for it). And minibar was not so cold either. I didn't like that the tv was so high up. And the picturequality was not good. Reading light on the bed was bad, and the light switches next to bed was far away so I have to almost get out of bed to switch the lights off. There is free WiFi at this hotel. But it was very very slow. And it didn't work several times. And it didn't work at all for many hours (3.30pm to 8pm!). I called reception. They could not do anything but advice me to buy internet via cable (!). This costs £14! Of course I didn't. Free WiFi is great but it isn't when it's not working. It worked later but is was very very slow. And often it just disconnected. Bad! I wonder why internet with cable is so expensive, oh of course it's working and it's faster! I ordered a dish from roomservice. Lamb with mash. Mash was made from only 2 potatos so it was very little. Little meat too. And price was £22!! So it was very expensive and little food. But it was good. (+): room size and design bathroom design bed design of hotel 1 free bottle of water every day in room (-): cold bathroom tv high up and bad picture quality Wifi is very very slow and many times it disconnected and not working for many hours and staff didn't do anything about it! Just said: "Try the cable!" (and pay £14) Expensive room even at discounted price (or "discounted"...) Expensive room service and little food £14 for internet via cable reading light, light switch next to bed ugly "refrigerator" tv-stand loud noise from heater no desk very narrow bathroom door (why?) if I turned off the lights with master switch next to bed still 1 light next to outsidedoor was on (!) I am a little dissapointed. Next time I will book other hotel in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Minniemouse75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street for three nights in December 2011. The room was very comfortable. Can't really fault anything - even the heating and showers were working perfectly which is not always so in Britain. The staff was extremely helpful and the breakfast pretty good, too. The only minor complaint was the room service food that I did not really like when I had it one evening. The location is central but all I ever went to was the office nearby.

Reviews.Title: “!st Class”
Reviews.Author: Bumpking
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my neice. Location was spot on for the theater and Oxford street shopping. The staff were excelent. We did change rooms as the first was small. I had booked a deluxe and I didn't feel this room was. It was no problem they gave us drinks whilst we waited. The next room was a lovely size. Bathroom superb too. We said we would definately stay there again this was the 3rd Radisson we had stayed in London. Breakfast was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Simple luxe for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: jeanoo
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was recommended by fellow colleagues. Indeed it was an enjoyable stay. The hotel had good WIFI throughout which to me was really important so I can connect with my iphone/laptop easily. It was very convenient as it was just 5 mins away from Tottenham Court station. Oxford Street was also within the vicinity for a quick run to the shops after work. The bedroom seemed a bit small at first but that was because there was sufficient space for the toilet/shower area. I only wished that they would provide complementary water everyday without request and they'd be perfect. Water was however quickly provided once I made a request. I was able to stay here for a stretch of 11 days comfortably which means this was really a gem of a place.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: 22KiwiTraveller22
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to find this oasis of luxury in the heart of London. Our room was truly spacious, with a large comfortable bed. The bathroom was beautiful, all clean and new looking. The staff at breakfast were friendly and personable, but not intrusive. The location was great, just around the corner from the British Museum, and easy walking distance to shows. There's also a nice little second hand book store just across the road, a great place to trade books for something different.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for weekend West-end getaway”
Reviews.Author: Business-Ireland
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2-night weekend stay with breakfast and all aspects were great, from the greeter at the door, to the well-equipped room (though there was a little street noise) and the sumptuous breakfast. I haven't stayed there since 1986 but it is more modern now. What a brilliant location right in the heart of the West End. Also we used the city bike scheme outside to wander the streets and parks. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Dianna B
Reviews.Content: Quick check in, room ready on arrival and staff very friendly and efficient. Would happily recommend

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: GeekyH
Reviews.Content: I had a standard double bed room for four nights which was kind of small but it was enough for me. The room and the bathroom were really clean. All the staff were so friendly and helpful. Haven't had the chance to try the hotel breakfast. The hotel location is just perfect. Being in the center of London it was really close to where I was doing business and many major attractions. Around 15 minutes walk to most of them. My stay was pleasant and quiet and that means a lot to me.

Reviews.Title: “Bad response to complaint about being poorly after eating in restaurant”
Reviews.Author: SoapBoxStar
Reviews.Content: Two colleagues and I stayed here on Monday 9th Jan 2012. We ate in the Restaurant but from the bar menu and two of us shared a plate of the fish and chips. Within two hours, we were both very poorly - vomiting and dizziness. We had been fine all day up until this point and the only thing we had both eaten was the meal at the Radisson. When we complained about this to the Receptionist the next morning, the Restaurant Manager was called and my colleague let him know about our experience. At the time he tried to brush it off and said that it would not have happened that quickly if it were food poisoning. We needed to leave the hotel as the three of us were running an event in London that day, so we asked for the problem to be followed up and they would get back to us. By the Tuesday of the following week, we had heard nothing, so I rang the hotel and spoke to a Duty Manager who said he would look into it and get back to me. He took all the details regarding the incident. By Thursday 19th, again, I had heard nothing, so called again. I left a message with a different Duty Manager and a few hours later the Restaurant Manager, who we had seen the day after, called me back. He seemed surprised to hear from me, and said he had not been informed that I had called the week before, and also said that he felt the matter had been dealt with when he spoke with my college. I told him that I disagreed and that a complaint of that nature should be taken seriously and looked into and that we were expecting some feedback from what he uncovered. To cut a long story short, he was in denial that our sickness was anything to do with what we had eaten and was not prepared to accept any liability for this nor take it any further. When I pursued the point, he said that he felt that if we had been poorly due to fish poisoning, we would have been hospitalised. When I asked him to explain what his sources were for that position, he could, or would, not. So, not only had they failed to follow up on a serious complaint, they had apparently not even taken any measures to investigate any likelihood that our sickness was caused by the fish, nor done anything to mitigate any further problems if we were right. He just kept saying, "what do you want me to do?" He was very unsympathetic, quite abrasive and not at all understanding of why I might have expected a different reaction from him or the hotel. Apart from that, I found the hotel very dark, oppressive and overly-priced. My room (a deluxe double) had a long corridor once inside the door, however was very small. The bathroom was hard-edged and not comfortable to spend time in. I will not, needless to say, be staying here again, nor recommending it to anyone else. A real disappointment considering the image the web site creates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Limeonade
Reviews.Content: We had a standard room which was small but more than adequate. The room was clean, quiet and in a good state, all the staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast plentiful. The location is very convenient. Definetly recommend the hotel if you like to be in the walking distance of major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free room upgrade & great hotel restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MattD_76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked two rooms (one for friends and one for us). Upon arrival, they upgraded our room for free! The upgraded room was very large and had a walk-in shower. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant a couple of times and it was very good. The lamb and steak and fries dishes in particular were quite tasty. The rest of our stay went smoothly. The rooms were clean, the beds were very comfortable, and outdoor noise was low, except for sirens from the occasional emergency vehicle. The only issues we had were: 1) We had to wait 2 hours after the stated check-in time to get our room, because it wasn't cleaned yet. Very annoying at first, but was more than made up for by the room upgrade. 2) After we got back home, there was an erroneous additional charge on our credit card. This took about a week to clear up and we got a free room upgrade at a Radisson the next time we are in London. All in all, we would definitely recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “staff were excellent!”
Reviews.Author: amanah w
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel as a last minute choice. i read some awful reviews which worried be a lot! once i got to the hotel i was greeted by two beautiful young ladies they helped me with my luggage before entering the hotel, they stored them while i checked in. After checking in they also offered to take my luggage up to my room which was more than appreiciated! They really did make me smile and make me change my mind completely about the service. The following afternoon i was greeted by the same smiles and they helped me on where to go shopping and how to get to the meseum. I just felt really 'at home' I will definately be coming back and hope to be greeted warmly by them.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ayaz A
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Bloomsbury Street Radisson Edwardian Hotel on vacation with my wife and 4 year old daughter. I was a bit sceptical about the size of the room considering that we were a family of 3 but was pleasantly surprised when we checked into our room. We were greeted in a most friendly manner by Mr Ankit Singh of the hotel staff and he ensured that the check-in was a breeze. The hotel has a nice location near Tottenham Court Road tube station and is just a 2 minutes walk away. The room was very clean, hotel has free wi-fi, we were given a complimetary water bottle upon arrival and the hotel staff was very courteous at all times especially Mr Joseph, Mr Manish and Ms Kim who were all smiles when it came to any request and ensured our stay was pleasant. It was great experience and I would definitely choose this hotel on my next trip to London!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed with service”
Reviews.Author: napa4
Reviews.Content: My husband & I booked this hotel as a Theatre break package through superbreak. We were celabrating a special occasion, so did not mind spending a bit more for a good hotel. After doing our research we chose the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury hotel due to been rated high on customer service.The location also suited us for the Theatre.The hotel were offering a complimentary late check out room & free movies when we booked. When we arrived at reception to check in the receptionist couldn't find our reservation on the system. We were asked to leave our bags & come back later & they would have to put our details on to their system. I was asked for my confirmation at this time,which I had to leave with them.On our return we were advised everything was sorted out & given our door card.I asked if they had the late check out room on the system. The receptionist asked me if I had paid for this & I again showed it on my confirmation. He said that it was o.k.The next problem was the door card did not work,so my husband had to go back to recepton for another card. That night after returning from the Theatre we tried to get a movie but could only get T.v chanels. In the morning we went to get breakfast that was booked in the package & was queried about this as they only had us down for one breakfast? We were beggining to feel like outcasts. We decided to go shopping & come back later in the afternoon as we had the late check out room. I had a feeling there was going to be a problem & when we returned we couldn,t use our door card! We again had to go to reception & explain we had a late check out. At 4pm we went to reception to hand in the door card & were asked to pay extra for the late check out room. I must say by this stage I couldn't wait to leave the hotel.We were made to feel unwelcome throughout our stay. I was asked to show proof that we had this & again show my confirmation. We wasn't asked if we had had a nice time & no apology for all the inconvenience caused. This was a special weekend that was spoiled by our stay at this hotel. We are very unhappy with the service we recieved & would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Definitely will stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnitaBJ
Reviews.Content: Accomodations: Pretty good hotel of course the rooms are small but you have an elevator and it works, minibar, windows to open, towels (small plus big one), tissues, safe (if your laptop is small size it will fit in otherwise not, but you can leave it in the hotel it's save), a hairdryer, big TV, phone, iron plus ironboard, you can print in the hotel and they have a computer (small business center), W-Lan is free - that's really great!!! The hotel staff: is very nice and helpful, gave us a map the first day and on the last day ordered a shuttle (mercedes) back to the airport it's cheaper and more convenient than a taxi.The cleaning staff is very nice and good, too. Area: is good you have everything from starbucks, small coffee shops, pharmacy shop, mc donalds, Subway sandwiches, supermarket saintsburry, restaurants, shopping stores, Bars, across from the Hotel is a free money change. Subway: is pretty close Tottenham Court, and there are also Bus Stations. Hotel Guests: All in all a pretty good hotel for a business trip, you get in all areas pretty quickly and it's good for young people to business people and elderly sightseeing people. So all kinds of but nice one's.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: swjlim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, nice and in a great location (really near the British Museum and near the tube). I stayed in a double room which consisted of a double bed, table, tv, wardrobe, and bathroom. Though all the furniture was nice and the bathroom was really modern (with nice amenities), the room was tiny! And I mean small... you had just about enough room to climb into bed. For one person, it was fine. But, if you're planning on fitting two people in here... just be aware that it's not going to be as roomy. However, all that said, it was definitely a good find in London, where hotels are so expensive! I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Patricia P
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel with my daughter over Xmas..it was a lovely hotel. Staff made it excellent in their friendliness, couldn't,t do enough to make the stay enjoyable...particular attention to the "bar" staff for the interaction and attention at all times..the wealth and variety of differing cultures serving together was second to none..food excellent with a very varied menu , good wines and cocktails enjoyed...would highly recommend this hotel to any discerning visitors .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lairdy5452
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, in which i stayed in a suite, the room was very well presented and was well kitted out, especially the bath in the bedroom. Had a fantastic stay and the food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in suite but a few buts...”
Reviews.Author: troublenstrife
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay - booked a suite (room 4014) as special treat & it was worth the £600 for two nights but a few small things let it down. I was promised a drink voucher & free film but did not receive this. I could have chased this up but I should not have had to as they had telephoned me the day before to finalise details. The suite was well furnished with fantastic multi aspect turret style windows, large bed and fancy bath in bedroom, seperate living room with dining table (but only one dining chair) large sofa,TV & fancy coffee maker and seperate bathroom with lots of towels and gilchrist & soames toiletries. No sink plug in basin which was one of the small things (like the stale smell of vomit in the hall outside the room, small stain on sofa, bath was not cleaned daily and a dead silverfish on the bottom of the glass they served me in the restaurant) that again I wasnt going to waste my time complaining about but now I list them against what I paid I wish I had!! Dont let my review put you off as I would def return as it was a very enjoyable stay. Food (dinner/breakfast) good in the restaurant and the birthday card and complimentary chocolate dipped strawberrys sent to the room were very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Hair raising!!!”
Reviews.Author: Albertrose
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a theatre break. Beware the rooms shown in photos are not the ones provided as part of such a break, it was the size of a shoe box. The main problem we had was that when drying my hair, the hotel hair dryer over heated melting my hairbrush which had my hair wrapped around it, I lost a lot of hair from the route. The customer service was dreadful, the manager and maintenance jan cam to the room, admit jokes about them having no hair I was initially told thati shouldn't have had the hair dryer on the hi setting as it was overheating! We missed our pre theatre meal and were late and "frazzled" when arriving at the show. We were told by a manager the following morning - when we had to complain again- that they would write to us. That was in November! So beware !

Reviews.Title: “great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: aoife_37
Reviews.Content: Second stay here. Will be back. Brilliant location within walking distance of British Museum and Covent Garden. Room clean and comfortable. Reception was extremely helpful and courteous. Called a few minutes after we were in the room to see if we wanted anything else. Didn't eat in the restaurant or use the bar this time - but the last time we did both were excellent. Didn't bother with breakfast in hotel so can't comment on that. Lovely corner room with some slight street noise but nothing too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: EVGI57
Reviews.Content: You cant beat the location of this hotel! We stayed there for 5 nights and did EVERYTHING on foot. I took the bus only once,just to "try". Beautiful Mayfair and Marylebone are just across the street. It's situated on the busy Oxford street, but there are so many great restaurants and cafes to eat whenever you are hungry! We had a deluxe room that was really spacious and had a huge bed. But there are currently works held at the Bond Street Metro and it was kind of nosy early in the morning (around 6am). That might be the only drawback I can find (though it's not the fault of the hotel). I will absolutely go back to this great central London hotel again and will advise it to anyone willing to discover this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore all of London”
Reviews.Author: hotchef1967
Reviews.Content: Greeting by reception on both arrival and departure was faultless. We were treated as if we were the only guests they had checked in or out that day - makes you feel like a valued customer. We were greatful for the un-prompted room upgrade when we arrived. The room was fine for our purposes and was better than expected. What was noticeable was that our room was "quiet", in that outside noises from traffic etc did not disturb us. - unlike the usual loud tourists who seem to think corridors are for holding loud discussions! People.....go into you rooms to shout each other!! Perhaps the maid could have replenished the complimentary water bottle without having wait for it to be completely empty! Everything was very clean and well maintained - a lot better than some London establishments. The hotels location gives you very easy access to Covent Garden, Leicester Square and is on the doorstep to the British Museum, whilst being only minutes from Tottenham Court Road tube station. 1 crticism - music too loud in th lobby / reception area. Would whole heartedly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, closet-like room”
Reviews.Author: Napoleon61
Reviews.Content: The best thing with this hotel is its location. Right by the British Museum, around the corner from the subway, buses right outside, plenty of restaurants and so on. Walking distance to all of Oxford Street and the theater district. As many previously noted, the weird perfume in the lobby area is very strange, and way too strong! We stayed for three nights in September 2011, had a standard room, which was more like your standard closet. You could hardly even stand next to the bed. Bathroom, on the other hand, quite large, but very cold floors. With the prices charged you would expect more from the rooms, but I guess the hotel solely relies on its location, and room size doesn't matter. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend have just come back from a 5 night stay at the hotel. The location of this hotel is excellent, within walking distance of Oxford Street, Covent Garden and some nice restaurants. Our room was a standard room and was very small so if booking I would suggest upgrading your choice of room, we had a decent size bathroom and apart from the room size were very happy with the hotel's facilities. The staff were pleasant and helpful and we enjoyed a few cocktails in the hotel bar which is great for before or after drinks. All in all I would recommend staying in this hotel and plan to return before the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Twins instead of Queen”
Reviews.Author: DJM01
Reviews.Content: We booked a queen bed in a superior room and when we turned up we were told that we had to stay in a standard room, twin beds, awful traffic noise outside. We were then offered an upgrade but at a considerable difference in price. Very disappointing that original booking was not honoured.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel over Christmas and had an amazing time. The location was excellent, putting you close to the British Museum, the theatres and Covent Garden. Although we arrived hours before the rooms were stated as ready, the staff were excellent in checking us in. Our bags were taken care of and we were able to go out and explore the sights and upon our return to the hotel the bags were brought to our room. Our room was amazing, a very high standard with a huge bed, a luxury in most other London hotels. I would most definitely return to this hotel again! In fact we already making plans to do so. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Small!”
Reviews.Author: Daph8
Reviews.Content: We booked via Last Minute so was unaware of which hotel we would be staying in until after payment. Our standard room was small and the bed was also small (queen) which we did not expect given the star rating of the hotel. We were on the first floor and heard traffic noise throughout the night. All staff encountered were professional and polite but not one had english as a first language. Bar prices were high but expected. The location was ideal for our evening out in Covent Garden but I would not stay again unless upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: amadeu1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I we stayed at the Radisson Edwardian Hotel Bloomsbury Street in November 2011. We were upgraded to a suite and that was great. Newly renovated, just perfect. So i cant really say how the normal rooms are. The location however is great if you want to go out at night. Near to Covent garden and many restaurants. I could not give it a 5 stars because the rooms are renovated but not like new.

Reviews.Title: “Would we stay here again - Definitely!”
Reviews.Author: TicandToc
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of it's location on the map and it suited the purpose of our trip which was just Christmas shopping etc in London. We paid a little extra to upgrade from a standard room to a superior room with a Queen bed. On arrival our room wasn't ready so we dumped the bags and hits the shops, 10 minute stroll and we were in the thick of Covent Garden. The lady on check-in was friendly, polite and chatty. All the staff we bumped into either in the hallways, lifts, restrooms, concierge etc were polite and friendly too. We stayed in room 6018 - it was really nice, two large windows with fair views to the nearby area. The room was furnished in a simple and elegant comtemporary style and was VERY clean! The bathroom was spacious and had complimentary organic products - lovely. The air con was very effective so we were never stifled or stuffy. Oh and for all you girlies out there, there was a REAL hairdyer in the drawer right behind the wardrobe mirror, none of the usual bathroom wall, coily rubbish. As regular visitors to London we have our fav places to eat so we didn't eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food. Checking out was simple and accurate (how often do you have to challenge something on your bill??) and Diego was very friendly. Hope all goes well on your trip back home to Italy Diego! We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Going the extra mile!”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary G
Reviews.Content: My son and I chose this particular hotel for a special weekend i.e. proposing to his girlfriend. The location of the hotel was excellent it being close to the tube and Covent Garden/Oxford Street. To make the occasion special he enlisted the help of Luke Jozef Francois, Guest Relations Manager and his team who pulled out all the stops to ensure the weekend was a success. The co operation and help they gave him was 'going the extra mile' and the meal/service in the restaurant was first class. His girlfriend accepted and he tells me they will certainly look forward to returning, maybe on their anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Derek Z
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Radisson Edwardian on Bloomsbury Street for the first part of our honeymoon. The staff was very attentive, the price right for a decent-sized room in London, and the location was excellent. I don't think I would have paid for the breakfast were it not included with our reservation, but it was very tasty. The only drawback is the smell in the lobby. I don't know who decided that it was a good idea to spray a gallon of cologne in the lobby, but it got to a point where my wife and I would not breathe until we got into the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Well looked after”
Reviews.Author: RichyVacance
Reviews.Content: I booked my parents into the Bloomsbury Street hotel to celebrate a special birthday. My parents loved their stay in one of the suites, it really was a memorable experience. I congratulate the Guest Relations Manager and his team for close attention to detail and the professionalism with which they conduct themselves. Nothing was too much trouble and they did their best to please. I mentioned that it was my mother's birthday and the staff went out of their way to make it special.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you can get a special offer”
Reviews.Author: SDUinLondon
Reviews.Content: My room was tiny, really small, like a cupboard with some spare furniture in it. My breakfast was overpriced and I left a watch at the hotel and they refused to return it to me. I have chased them since September. Not impressed. I don't live in London but they refused to post it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel room, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jmaylandster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty average when it comes to the rooms. They are clean and welcoming, small and with a nice bathroom. They offer the kind of hotel room you need when the hotel room is nothing more but a place to sleep. The reception staff is very friendly, offering af very good service The full English Breakfast is highly recommendable, offering everything you want in the morning. Also the restaurant staff is super friendly. The hotel's location is very good; you can start your sightseeing right outside the door! When I stayed here, I spent no money on buses or the subway because everything is close by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a good business hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Yaoji G
Reviews.Content: Cool Location, good service, & nice equipment! Well the 1st room (4005) I used is quite big and special, but with very bad WIFI, but when i change to other room, the WIFI is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Prestigious & Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Renata M
Reviews.Content: Located within easy reach of key attractions... Cozy interior... Friendly staff... Unique dining experience... Truly memorable stay... Great value for money... To be very recommended!!! We became addicted to REBS :-) We travel a lot but never had time to write feedback - for you we found it! Thank you & see you soon!!! Best wishes for upcoming holidays!!! Walter & Renata (October 2011)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, but very noisy location so not a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty N
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautifully appointed, the room amazing, well appointed and very clean, the staff helpful and friendly and the food wonderful. On these factors I would strongly recommend the hotel. We could not hear a peep from any of the other guests on our floor Sadly the noise from the busy street outside kept waking us up and the double glazing was nowhere near good enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Radisson Edwardian Hotel - Bloomsbury Street”
Reviews.Author: Chad B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in London for 2 weeks on business at the Radisson Edwardian Hotel off Bloomsbury Street. The hotel was located in a bustling part of the city with easy access to shopping, theaters, the tube/subway, and restuarants. The staff at the hotel went out of their way to be very helpful with accomodations and provided helpful tips on the city. The rooms were large and very clean with the maid service providing an extra cleaning each evening. Finally the additional amenities of a gym, inside restuarant/bar, and free newspapers made you feel at home. Luke, the hotel service manager, was a plus to ensure your stay meets your expectations. My only knock on the hotel is watch-out for the cost on long-distance telephone calls and a downside of watching British channels to get your US sport fix. Overall great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service but very disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatiH83
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, this hotel looks (and even smells) amazing! The interior decor throughout is stunning and the staff were exactly as you would expect, extremely courteous and efficient. The disappointment came in the details - we had a tiny room and both had difficulty moving around it at the same time. We both have countless painful bruises from bashing our legs on the bedframe from trying to walk around the bed. There was only one chair in the room so when room service arrived one of us had to eat on the bed, less than ideal. The bathroom was beautiful but again impractical - the towel rail was on the opposite side of the room from the sink and the bath. The bath was very shallow and although long just wasn't a place for a luxurious soak. The soap dispensers were bolted to the wall and so trying to run a bubble bath was a mission in physics - trying to exert enough pressure on the dispenser so that the shower gel leapt far enough to avoid trickling down the side of the container but not so far as to miss the bath entirely. Overall it was quite a comical stay, an absolutely beautiful hotel but lacking in common sense!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: PriscilaO
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here! This hotel is located in a very good area just a few steps from the British Museum and Tottenham Court Road Station. It is stylish, very comfortable and the staff is very friendly. We've even got an upgrade to a better room (a big one, difficult thing to find in London). And we didn't find it noisy as I read in a previous review.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: zach333
Reviews.Content: The staff in the reception is really great, and the rooms are very nice decorated and comfort. But - the walls are so thin so you can hear everything that happens on the coridor, especially the house keeping ladies that insist making noise beofre 8am or to speak loudly when we wanted to have our afternoon nap. Those were the most awful 6 nights I had in London. So although all the benefits of this hotel - don't go there if you want to have a good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Hilary W
Reviews.Content: Excellent all round: efficient and friendly reception, the concierge was helpful with directions, every member of staff I encountered smiled and greeted me. The room was very quiet- always a bonus when in London on a work trip. Breakfast was an extensive buffet and staff were attentive withou being intrusive. I shall definitely ask my booking agency to send me there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely to be back!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyKel
Reviews.Content: Returned to this wonderful 'hotel of our choice' for the 4th time. As always the staff were welcoming, efficient and helpful (even when I could not remember my credit card PIN number!), the room was immaculate, the food wonderful and the atmosphere calming and relaxing after a busy day shopping. The location is excellent for a shopping trip to Oxford Street as it is just a short walk away and was also ideal for our evening visit to the Theatre in Soho. The tasteful Christmas decorations and the beautiful Christmas tree all added to the atmosphere and provided a memorable couple of days to start our festive celebrations. We will definately be back again on our next visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel , Friendly Staff , Fab Location !”
Reviews.Author: Marc C
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel as part of a birthday surprise for my wife as part of a theatre trip and night out in town and was extremely pleased with my choice ! Upon arriving at the hotel , we were greeted by very friendly front desk staff who took care of us quickly and politely. The Hotel was decorated for Christmas and looked superb. There was also a gorgeous aroma wherever you went - seemed like it was pumped through the aircon system. The feeling was of cleanliness and luxury. Stepping out of the lift on the 6th floor , the surrounds were very plush - we felt like VIP's - really luxurious decor and ambient lighting gave a great sense of decadence. Once we got to our room , it was exactly as described - admittedly , the superior room was a little small - but I already expected that as you are in central london and it clearly told you the room size when you booked. The room was spotless , the bathroom was immaculately clean and the room felt very cosy and homely. We popped to the bar for a quick spot of lunch and a drink before we went out - the bar felt intimate , clean and inviting. Nice comfy sofas if you were lucky enough to grab them ! The bar staff were really friendly and the food was just what we needed. The location of the Hotel is perfect for theatreland - We went to the Shaftesbury Theatre which was literally a 3-4 minute walk from the Hotel - Perfect ! We came back later after seeing fab show and a great meal at the Savoy and again , relaxed in the bar and enjoyed a nightcap - or two - on the super comfy sofas ! After one of the best nights sleep I have ever had (the bed is soooooo comfortable !) , we checked out and had a nice chat with all of the front desk staff who were all keen to find out about our stay , we talked about Christmas etc and we left the Hotel feeling like valued customers - Would I stay there again ? You bet ! Already looking to book another Theatre night again soon and will be back at the Radisson Edwardian again !

Reviews.Title: “its ok”
Reviews.Author: I_like_2_travel008
Reviews.Content: Hotels in London are just too expensive and this one was no better.... Had to be in London for business the Radisson Edwardian seemed ok so we stayed. The room was small and we were told that we had a bigger room than most so the rooms here must be very small. The furnishing, bed etc were all ok. The shower difficult to work out how to turn on and get the right temperature of water and we found it difficult everytime even after originally understanding it :-) The staff all seemed very nice and the service was fine. The bar and restaurant were expensive but again.....hotels in London!!! overall it was a decent stay had no real problems or issues with it...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great people!”
Reviews.Author: Argiro F
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 3 weeks being on a business trip in London. I was very worried since it was a company trip and it would be that long. I like being comfy something not usual in city hotels. To be honest I felt almost like home. The room was very clean, new sheets and towels every day, great bathroom and a comfy bed. The people were very nice, always with a smile and willing to help with everything. Breakfast was really nice. I would like some cake selection though as I have a sweet tooth in the morning. I don't usually eat eggs and ham but the breakfast was overall great and could fill you up until lunch time. I will stay there again as the location of the hotel is great and the service is amazing! A.F

Reviews.Title: “overbooked”
Reviews.Author: madprofessor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for almost a week. It's very convenient. Modern design, oriental decoration, clean room, etc. The only problem is overbooking. I had read the same problem from previous reviews but didn't think that we would encounter the same situation. It's a serious problem especially in the summer peak season, I guess. But why we never had this problem with other hotels (all over the world)? There must be something wrong with their management. Though they apologized, we had to move to another hotel for a night and returned the next morning. It's so very annoying and tiring when you travel long distance to London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Peter B
Reviews.Content: Made to feel at home all the way Great time in a great hotel in a great city Bar staff especially attentive throughout our stay Many Thanks Pete and Charlotte

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GC-Poole
Reviews.Content: Staff were 'top class'. Extremely polite and very attentive and friendly. Room was excellent and the bed comfortable. Breakfast and Dinner were both very good. Highly recommended and we will certainly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Always nice”
Reviews.Author: monkeyFUZ
Reviews.Content: This is our "go to" hotel in London. Staff is great. Room is comfortable, clean, bed is comfy. Location is perfect, easy to get anywhere you want to go. We always have a fun time at the bar when having a nightcap after along day. I would recommend The Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wow factor”
Reviews.Author: fussymadame
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise . After far too long trawling the net searching for hotels for a weekend in London decided to give this a go . Wanted something special and was worried we would be disappointed . The service from an early email re parking to arriving at the hotel was wonderful . Professional and friendly and genuinely wanting to help . Had read previous reviews where people said the service was awful so didn't know what to expect . Went up to our suite and opened the door and was shocked by how fantastic it was . Spotlessly clean , funky feel and really special . Large lounge with rich fabrics and great views. The bedroom had a fantastic free standing bath under the window and the room was perfect . The bed was fantastic and we slept beautifully. The bathroom was great with a superb shower and again fantastically clean. Breakfast the first day was great but the second not so good . But to be honest we didn't care . We had a late checkout Sunday and thought as hotels go it was not a rip off. Decent champagne for £42 ish and drinks not silly priced . We had a brilliant time and could have stayed a week . If you want something special and are looking to splash out definately better value than some of others we nearly booked where we would have been lucky to get just a room .

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience at the Radisson Edwardian”
Reviews.Author: Paula G
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, we didnt bother to get the tube as we could walk to the places we wanted to visit. Every member of staff was most helpful and seemed very happy in their work, something of a novelty these days! The restaurant was full on the Saturday evening we were accomadated in the sister hotel across the road, again excellent service and excellent food too. Would book this hotel again, and would recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Way above average service, Lovely rooms and very good food”
Reviews.Author: Diane H
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff on the desk and following through into the bar and restaurant. Arrived late in the evening and had a super welcome. The food in the radisson is as great as always and the girls in the bar are vey welcoming. Great location and lovely staff ...very lovely staff. Rooms are a little small unless on the 7th floor bit this is a trade off for central location. Beautiful decor by the way!!

Reviews.Title: “Is a good night´s sleep too much to expect...?”
Reviews.Author: UKJA
Reviews.Content: I like Radisson hotels and I am probably being harsh in giving this one such a low rating. However, Radisson do set a high standard and in one detail, this hotel let me down very badly: This was the loud, banging doors. The disturbance went on well past midnight and resumed again very early in the morning. I simply do not understand how a hotel that pays so much attention to the detail of the comfort of its guests, can be incapable of putting in doors that close quietly. Perhaps the genius in the Radisson marketing department who came up with the idea of putting a little card on every bed with the obviously user-experience-enhancing message of " a good nights sleep needn´t cost the earth" could apply their undoubted talents to putting a little insulating foam around the door-frames...

Reviews.Title: “A haven in Central London”
Reviews.Author: WorksWithWords
Reviews.Content: The hardest part of booking hotels in London is often you have to choose between a convenient location or a good night's sleep. London is a 24hr city and that can mean the noise levels are pretty high. Thankfully this hotel is tucked away and whilst there is still traffic noise, it is pretty bearable. However, that is not the only plus point. The hotel is beautifully designed and maintained. The rooms are relaxing and luxurious. But best of all are the staff who are consistently helpful, friendly and warm. You are never made to feel like a customer, always a guest. It's not cheap, but it is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - customer service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: DerbyLass18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a friends hen do. Nice rooms with good amenities. Apart from the hair-dryer blowing up in my hand when getting ready on the Saturday evening. I called housekeeping and expressed my urgency in getting a replacement to me as we had a restaurant booked in Mayfair for 8:30pm. It took 30 mins for someone to come and 'view' the broken hair-dryer (no replacement!) I said I needed a new one asap, which she ran down the corridor and said she would get one for me, this never appeared! What a shame and a let down on such a trivial matter - please don't make promises and not deliver!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajboyce
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit. Excellent service which starts as soon as one walks in the door. Pleasant, well equipped room with everything needed for an enjoyable stay. Very good breakfast in a spacious dining room overlooking the street but protected by efficient sound-proofing. Highly recommended. Particularly convenient for the British Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant midweek break”
Reviews.Author: ElaineandBob
Reviews.Content: We went to celebrate my wife's birthday, and we have never been treated so well in a hotel. The staff were all very welcoming, particularly Rajni, who remembered our name and who went out of her way to be helpful. The concierge was also very courteous and helpful. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a king size room and also a complimentary bottle of wine - an excellent gesture. The room was well designed, well equipped and well decorated. The hotel facilities were also good, creating a buzzy and enjoyable atmosphere. Well done, Radisson!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great location!”
Reviews.Author: TheAussieNewlyweds
Reviews.Content: Rooms were a little small and very low ceilings. Great service-everyone happy to help. Great location close to all the major streets. Must try Pizza Express across the road and down the street.......amazing Pizza!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, a few quibbles though”
Reviews.Author: GundamWing101
Reviews.Content: Overall, I did enjoy my prolongated weekend (four nights) here very much. I asked for and got a very quiet room, just the TV from the neighboring room could be heard, but fortunately it wasn't a person who watched TV in the middle of the night. The bed was comfortable, so I slept really well. Everything was very clean. The breakfast was very good, the buffet covered most of the wishes, but I did also order one day Eggs Benedict which was on their menu. It was really delicious! The person in charge of the breakfast room is very nice and efficient and does an excellent job. As does the rest of the staff, they were all very helpful. The hotel was very well located for me, as I was back from the opera after just a short ten minutes walk. The British museum is also just a bit down the street. A few minor quibbles: Taking a bath is not possible - the bath tub is too shallow. As I love taking bathes, this bothered me quite a bit. There were no towel to put on the bath room floor which gave me cold feet. The soap dispenser was directly above the little tray with goodies, so they got wet from the dripping hand under the soap dispenser. So, it really was a good stay, but it could still be better.

Reviews.Title: “Proposing to my girlfriend”
Reviews.Author: trevor g
Reviews.Content: Over the past few months I have been thinking about ways in which I could propose to my gorgeous girlfriend when the idea of a surprise trip to London came to mind. Following fantastic stays at some of the international Radisson hotels I decided to have a look at what they had to offer in London and was not disappointed. I soon contacted the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street hotel and booked myself into their amazing King Deluxe Suite, the idea was that upon arrival to our suite my girlfriend would find a bouquet of 50 red roses, petals on the bed, Champaign and a card which read “will you marry me?” But how to organize all of this? After my booking I emailed Guest Relations Manager Mr.. Luke Jozef Francois to see if he could make this possible and later that same day I received a call from him. Luke was extremely helpful and excited about the surprise which I had in mind, we discussed the idea in length and Luke kept in contact right up to the date. Upon arrival at the Radisson Bloomsbury my Girlfriend and I were struck by the decor of the hotel, it really was a beautiful place full with fantastic artwork with a real lavish feeling. By this time was I getting rather nervous, however I had already received a text from Luke letting me know that the suite was ready so nerves were settled a little. Luke actually checked us into the hotel and showed us up to our suite, the Kings Deluxe Suite was simply breath taking to say the least, every little detail of the front room was perfect and then of course to top it off my girlfriend opened the door and walked into the bedroom. Dimmed lights, romantic music, rose petals on the bed, bouquet, campaign, rose petals in the bath it really was something special. Her face was so happy as she opened the card which read “will you marry me?”, as she looked around I was on one knee with the ring and she said yes. I would just like to thank the Radisson Bloomsbury Hotel for the most amazing weekend, I honestly cannot recommend your hotel enough it was fantastic. With once more a brief thank you to Luke for the extra effort he clearly put into my surprise - hope to see you all next year. Kindest regards, Trevor Gretsinger

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street recently, I can only say it was fantastic, From the minute we arrived it felt right, the staff were excellent, the best I have ever met and nothing to much trouble. I have never before thought a hotel was worthy of a review but had to write something this time. To be honest I did not think you could still get such good service in London. Well done

Reviews.Title: “*****Best London hotel yet *****”
Reviews.Author: hexaminer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel two nights with work. I cannot fault the service I received from reception to check out everything was first class. Nice contemporary clean and functional rooms of a decent size for London. The breakfast was of a high standard with freshly squeezed orange juice. Nice communal areas. The hotel is very close to Tottenham court tube and within walking distance of Covent garden and the West end. Plenty of restaurants in surrounding streets. Well worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing service and extremely friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Helena H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at quite a few hotels in London and this is absolutely the best one. The service is amazing and you feel very well taken care of. Had to work night shifts during my stay and ususally this is a problem with the cleaning part but this time no one disturbed me during the day and the room was nicely cleaned when i got back to the hotel in the mornings. One staff member personally arranged for a taxi and escorted myself and my colleagues to the taxi when the road was closed off (5 min walk).The hotel is centrally located, 15-20 minute walk to Oxford Circus. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: adrian c
Reviews.Content: We stayed last week for 4 days during our buiness trip. Rooms are fantastic, in house restaurant offers good food, but may be over priced. i guess this is the going rate for london. other than that, it was an overall pleasant hotel and would definately would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: Elisa H
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times when on business trip and everything's been excellent here. Rooms are spacious, stylish, clean and comfortable. Service is excellent! The staff even called me to check that all is good. Location is perfect. 10-15min walk to Picaddilly Circus, Oxford Street is basically across the corner and there's a great whiskey store next to the hotel. Only two things on the negative side: the scent on the lobby is really strong and causes headache and the bathrobe wasn't soft at all. So nothing much to complain about :)

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: bdorgan
Reviews.Content: The no.1 best thing about this hotel is its location, it is absolutel perfect for a sightseeing trip to London. 5 minutes walk to Covent Garden / Soho/Oxford Street. The hotel itself is a bit expensive €220 per night but you save a lot of money as you don't need to spend any money on tubes or taxis. The room was nice and modern, very clean (but as with all city centre hotels the room was small). Staff were very friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A nice find”
Reviews.Author: TravelGav
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Bloomsbury St came by chance as I had originally made a reservation at the sister hotel opposite, the Kenilworth. At check in I was informed that they had no single rooms left but could accommodate me at The Bloomsbury St. So I was accompanied by a very polite man from reception at the Kenilworth across the road to The Bloomsbury St, where he checked me in upgrading me to a standard double so I was quite pleased. I remember the hotel from when it was called The Marlborough and was quite chintzy. There is now no chintz in sight, anywhere. It's undergone a complete transformation into a sleek (and dark) contemporary hotel. It's lost a bit of character though and now looks much like many other 4* modern hotels. The room itself was small, but more than ample for one person. Two people would be fine. As it faced an inner courtyard / rooftops, it was quiet but there was some noise from the corridor which was not helped by a sizeable gap beneath the door. I did not appreciate being woken by the chambermaid at 8:30 on Saturday morning in order to clean the room; my fault for not switching on the do not disturb light the previous night. A nice bathroom with an excellent shower. I was pleased to see a full-size window in both the bedroom and bathroom as so often hotel bathrooms have no natural light. The room was decorated in muted, dark colours but it felt as though they had forgotten to hang several more pictures as many of the walls were blank. The bed was comfortable with good linen and spare pillows in the wardrobe. A few biscuits would have been nice to see with the tea/coffee set up but at least there was complimentary wi-fi in the room. Check out the following morning was also professional yet even at 10:30 people were already checking in and storing luggage so with only 2 people at reception there was a slight wait. I would have no hesitation to stay at The Bloomsbury St again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, central london location”
Reviews.Author: cmrushton
Reviews.Content: High quality hotel within easy reach of Oxford St and London theatres by tube or on foot. Bedroom felt like an upgrade but was just a standard room. Spacious, immaculately clean, comfy king-size bed and fab bathroom. Staff very helpful and friendly, especially on Reception desk. We were able to check in at 12 noon and then leave our bag at the hotel for most of the next day. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TyneandWearDylanfan
Reviews.Content: Room was well equipped with very comfortable bed. Staff very helpful. Requested an early check in so was able to go straight to room without hanging around. Easy check in. We will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: Great greeting and attention throughout my stay - i often stay in hotels on business around the country. I frequently arrive late in the day and tired so hassle free checking in and assistance is what I'm after. The staff are great, the rooms are perfect and the feel of the place was really welcoming. I'll definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BBDDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in London. Stayed here as thought it would be central and it was. We arrived at 10am and were expecting to wait for our rooms but they let us check in immediately. Rooms are lovely, very modern, a bit small but were expecting that. We had booked 3 superior rooms and one of them wasnt a superior so we rang reception and they moved us to a superior room straight away. The staff on reception were very helpful and couldnt do enough for us.Tea/coffee in room, ironing board, hairdryer, safe, fridge/mini bar and flat screen tv. We didnt have breakfast booked but there are lots of little cafes around for breakfast. There is a lovely cafe 'Munchkins' around the corner on Great Russel St about 3 mins walk. Food was lovely. We had dinner in 'Il Casteletto' Italian restaurant just a bit further down this road too. Beautiful dinners. There is a cafe directly opposite this hotel (beside the newsagents) but DONT go there. Staff not friendly at all and food not great. Give this a miss.! Bar staff in the hotel are great too. We had late drinks here on the 3 nights we stayed and even had a sing song one of the nights and we were never asked to be quiet or drink up. The concierge is very helpful so ask him for directions or recommendations for restaurants etc. All in all we would recommend this hotel to anyone. There were 6 of us travelling aged between 18 and 77 and each one of us loved this hotel. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with first class location”
Reviews.Author: Retired_Stockevik
Reviews.Content: Spotless hotel. Less than ten minutes walk to Covent Garden or the far end of Oxford Street. British Museum across the road. Tube and a zillion buses right outside. Taxi from Paddington about £15. Well worth the extra cost. World's largest selection of food within 10 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel with Personal Touch”
Reviews.Author: limkjmy
Reviews.Content: I stayed with the hotel between 28-31 Oct and 1-5 Nov 2011. I was touched by how friendly the hotel staffs are and they go extra mile to make us felt welcome. The room is spacious for a hotel so near to the Oxford Street and we are happy with the room cleaniless. I especially want to thank the front desk staff by the name Rajni who has been very friendly and made us feel at home throughout our stay and even bring us a glass of water while we were waiting for our taxi to the airport. I stay in many hotels before, this is the first time I experience such personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Filming”
Reviews.Author: Topoftheblock
Reviews.Content: We recently filmed here for a new tv series. We filmed in the lobby and in one of the suites. The location suited are needs perfectly, we received friendly and flexible service from all the staff especially the manager Luke who helped make the day run smoothly. Only down sides: If filming was to take place at any point in a corridor, lighting is a must. But for our requirements, the room was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “So many people can't be wrong”
Reviews.Author: MCLandCWJ
Reviews.Content: Yes - that's why I booked this hotel, and that's why I'd recommend it. From arrival to departure, it was a pleasure staying here. The staff are friendly and pleasant beyond most hotels I've stayed in, and the hotel is clean, tidy and contemporary. The fragrance in the lobby is divine! The room itself (twin) was spacious and clean, with a very comfy chair too! The bathroom had a good range of toiletries, and full dispensers of soap and body lotion. To be critical, the sink didn't have a plug, but we didn't find this too inconvenient (and the staff were very apologetic about this). Great location for Covent Garden. The hotel could do with more than 2 lifts, as we had to wait at times to get to our room, however, all in all this was a very good hotel, and one I'll be back to - well done to the Management and the Team, and thank you for such a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “So Friendly”
Reviews.Author: redpeter_10
Reviews.Content: I have generally avoided staying in central London hotels recently, because of poor previous experiences. However I accompanied someone on a business trip and was booked into this hotel. What a pleasant surprise, so different to other London hotels I have stayed in.
