Modern, clean, spacious room with a large bathroom. Almost next door to the British Museum, Oxford Street, theatres, restaurants etc., very nearby, but the biggest surprise- the staff. So pleasant, friendly, and helpful - how refreshing. A little expensive but I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned, technical issues”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: This is a well positioned 4 star hotel with reasonable rates, super attendant staff and good small conference facilities. Our room had a king sized bed, large open ward robe and big bathroom. Tips: for people staying Taxi etc can not stop on Bloomsbury St so pulled into a lane. No car park. If you are PD may be an issue. Close to Tottenham Court Road tube - but Northern line is closed for pre 2012 repair and so this is crowded and chaotic at present. The street is noisy - ask for higher floor. There are still electrical and other issues after the refit of the building - electrical cable sticking out and inability to make direct outside phone call. Despite this, enjoyed the stay and would condor again.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel, but not coming back”
Reviews.Author: anaiiis
Reviews.Content: The rooms are modern, but slightly small (even when considering this is London and you can't expect much bigger). The bathroom, on the other hand, was spacious and even had a bathtub. Showering produced water on the floor, so you need to use a towel to get rid of it. Light switches at bedside did not work. There was a tea boiler provider with a selection of black and chamomile tea and variety of coffee and sweeteners. If you are lucky, there is no noise from the hall, but it is very easy to hear people passing (talking, even quietly). Of course, the hotel has good location. They are a bit over-obsessed with self evaluation and I was asked 4 times if I enjoy my stay (which was 1 night). At the check out, I was slightly in a hurry, which probably encouraged the personnel to charge me in my local currency without asking me. I would like to urge you travelers to be extra careful when receiving a hotel bill and openly ask to be charged in pounds! The hotel rates are, as we all know, never as good as the ones from your bank. I was asked to "sign three copies of the bill", but one of them, the last one, of course, turned out to be the rate from pounds to local currency. I realized that when I already signed it. I was an easy victim this time, but I guess we all learn. I hope they are happy with extra 20 pounds they earned on me doing this.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaynie111
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, reasonable priced (for London anyway) at the weekend - we stayed Saturday and Sunday nights, then transferred to another hotel for the Monday night as the Radisson price went up by approximately £100 for weekday stays. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of Covent Garden, Soho and the West End. We saw Phantom whilst there and it was about a 15 minute walk. The area leading back to the hotel from the theatre district is very busy at night as there are so many restaurants and theatres, but we felt completely safe the whole time, and the road actually becomes really quiet when you get within 100 yards of the hotel anyway. Our room ('superior', booked via Expedia) felt sumptuous and was a good size with bath as well as shower. The staff were cheery, warm and welcoming. Breakfast was £21, far too expensive - if we'd had it both nights we're talking £84, which I feel is pretty ridiculous. Maybe they could look into doing an 'express breakfast' as some other hotels do where you can just grab a coffee and croissant for about a fiver. However, there is a Pret and other cafes only about a minute away, so this is no big deal. In terms of dinner, you really must try Savoir Faire (they describe themselves as 'gourmet food at reasonable prices', lots of locals who seem to be repeat customers and the food is amazing) which is just up the road in the direction of Covent Garden. All in all, this was one of the better 4* hotels we've stayed at and we thoroughly enjoyed it - I'd definitely recommend it to others for both the ambience and location.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: L L
Reviews.Content: Icannot thank the lovely staff enough for all their help in makiing this trip a most enjoyable stay.The Hotel was beautiful, I would definately stay again and recommend it to others. Simone went out of his way to ensure everthing was perfect for our stay. Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mmmarte
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a good location and very nice staff in the reception. We were disappointed about the quality of our room: There were no coffee or tea facilities in the room, the cleaning staff did not clean well enough, they only changed the towels and made up the bed, when we showered the water went all over the bathroomfloor and there was a lightbulb hanging from the ceiling when we arrived. We had realy looked foreward to our stay as we were celebrating our anniversary and expected a nice stay so we were disappointed, we will most likely try another hotel upon our next stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “afternoon tea- spot on!”
Reviews.Author: Letty L
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Bloomsbury Street Hotel for afternoon tea. It was our first time, so didn't know what to expect. But lucky, it was an amazing experience from the time we entered the hotel to when we left. We arrived earlier than booked, but we were greeted regardless at the door, and taken to our table. The dining area was a bit dark, but the art and sculptures surrounding us made up for it. We were offered a menu of teas, and then in no time our goodies came out. The sandwiches were incredibly fresh and flavoursome (the smoked salmon sandwiches were amazing). We were provided with a very generous amount of clotted cream for the scones, a delicious white chocolate mousse, a shot glass of chopped strawberries and blackberries, among other things. The waiter went out of his way to ensure we were happy, and it was always easy to get his attention. I left the hotel feeling stuffed!! I will definitely be back, and will bring my family next time :) Thanks very much for such a lovely time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana C
Reviews.Content: Despite some minor examples, the service was always nice and quick and the managers and reception staff were always happy to give advice and provide help whenever required. The hotel has a good location, is in the walking distance of most of major London sights and is easily accessible by tube.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay made easier by helpful staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Mic167
Reviews.Content: Reason for stay was business. Front of house staff were extremely helpful, nothing was too much trouble. From a meeting organiser's perspective I would definitely use this hotel again. The people I dealt with were always happy to help and nothing was too much trouble. Well done! Only downside was the size of the bedrooms, but what do you expect for the middle of London :o).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...but probably not another stay!”
Reviews.Author: scm1133
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location - It was within walking distance of my office and quite near the tube, and boots.sainsburys, and restaurants all nearby. Quick check-in and decent size room with nice bathroom. Great shower. Cons: I was missing the complimentary bottle of water and robe in my room as well as a hair dryer and non-feather pillows. It was incredibly noisy and I wasn't able to sleep - not good for someone traveling on business! Upon check out, the desk agent answered his mobile and talked on it while checking me out. He didn't even ask me how my stay was - probably a good thing!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCritic
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned business traveler with reasonable, but not unrealistic expectations. I can easily give a great review and have on many occasions. That said, I can only give the Raddison Edwardian Bloomsbury the worst review I've ever written. While the reception staff and lobby were lovely, that is where the positive experience ended. Let's start with the closet they called a room. The double bed took up the entire room with not even a chair to sit in. The window was obscured by a large cement beam. My attempt to change the room was impossible. Then there was the smell in the bathroom...something putrid that would not go away. And again, it was impossible to get a room change. Room service was awful with my breakfast call being met with "Sorry the chef is coming in late today." on the first morning, and "Sorry, we misplaced all the orders from last night" on the second morning. Finally, I'm not sure why they have a "do not disturb" light for the door since despite turning it on I was awoken twice after 9pm by staff wanting to deliver things that I did not order to the room. London is a lovely city - but the Raddison Edwardian Bloomsbury could make the best trip a true disaster. Definitely pick someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChampagneH
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely stylish and chic hotel just round the corner from Tottenham Court Road tube station, it is easily accessible for those looking for a base to stay in London. The staff were very accomodating and friendly. We were celebrating a birthday and we were treated to complimentary glasses of wine delivered to our room. We had lunch in the restaurant and service and food was great! I would definately recommend this hotel, it was affordable for London and I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for shopping or seeing a show”
Reviews.Author: Loo57
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel.Clean and comfortable.Staff were excellent, very efficient and friendly. Hotel ideally placed for shopping on Oxford Street and within easy walking distance to/from theatreland. Would definately stay again and would recommend it for those people who are looking for a short break stay.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: burrowspaul
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson on Sat 8th Oct for 1 night (going to see a West End Show). The hotel has an excellent location at the end of Oxford Street and certainly within walking distance of the West End. My wife and I both separaetly commented to each other on how polite the staff were. More than just the usual politeness that you would expect. Check in and check out were smooth processes and typified the efficiency of the organisation. Rooms were clean, tidy and well decorated. There were not large but efficiently laid out to make them feel larger. Breakfast was lovely - plenty to choose from. The only negative of any description was that the bar prices were high and stopped us having more than 1 drink. For a 'non-Londoner' not used to London prices they did seem unreasonable. Overall the hotel was a little piece of affordable luxury that i would certainly stay in again - which is probably the most important aspect of any review!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jolomax
Reviews.Content: A too brief stay at this great hotel - lovely room lovely service and great location. Just wished for one more night

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!!”
Reviews.Author: ns723
Reviews.Content: We had gotten to London after a rough two weeks of traveling throughout Europe only to find out that a hotel room had not been booked for us. Luckily, this hotel was near where we had been originally dropped off and they had some extra rooms! We got superb service at the reception, the ambiance was fantastic and every member of the staff that we interacted with was very pleasant and friendly! I will certainly keep this hotel in mind as one of my top choices for my next visit to London!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: 11SarahM
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience. The reception staff were really friendly and helpful. The rooms are gorgeous - spacious and beautifully decorated. The walk in showers are fab!

Reviews.Title: “personal and special attention”
Reviews.Author: kate w
Reviews.Content: We were made really welcome on a return visit to The Bloomsbury Street Edwardian Radisson. We were travelling with my elderly father in law and the team made every effort to help us find the best way of doing things ie travel to various sights, best times to visit etc. great concierge service. Breakfasts were leisurely and first rate quality, food hot and refreshed regularly. The service was excellent even though training of some new staff was taking place. Yonka was looking after the restaurant and took the time to talk with us and make us feel individual. She was interested to hear where we were from and our plans for our stay, taking a genuine interest. Rooms clean and good facilities. Location is perfect for theatres and all major sights as most within easy walking distance. Most definitely will stay there again. Worth paying that little extra to be certain of all this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: pathakh
Reviews.Content: one of the best hotel stay so far . Hotel is very neat and clean . staff is very friendly and happy to go extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not good enough”
Reviews.Author: KylieHodges_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an awards ceremony. I was sharing a twin room with a fellow blogger whom I had never met, and the room was far too small for two people. The beds were single, which I was not expecting. The bathroom however was a good size. I was exceedingly annoyed with room service. I arrived back from our even just after 11, and the food choices after 11 are exceedingly limited. I ordered a cheese sandwich and crisps and it took well over half an hour. I received a phone call to my room after 20 minutes stating there was no card on file for me, and that I had to pay cash or credit card. I asked if I could sort it on check out and was told I couldn't. The room service person wanted me to go down to reception (um I was in my pyjamas) or he would take my credit card and bring it back, which I was not happy with either. I don't think I was much of a flight risk, and was extremely disappointed with this service. I think there are better hotels in the area, and if you can get a good deal elsewhere I'd take it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service !!! Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: SupaNige_TA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels as I travel for business. This one stands out from the crowd. From the moment you enter the hotel, you are engulfed in a very nice scent that is ever present . Staff was very professional and accommodating. Food is very good - especially the breakfast. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Civilized and thoughtful service from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: Brad M
Reviews.Content: I had a perfect stay at the Radisson Edwardian after a long European business trip covering 3 countries. After traveling to Amsterdam and Prague, I arrived at the Radisson exhausted and without luggage. I was also burned out from lackluster service in the other two countries, my expectations set by everyday life and expansive travel in the USA. From the front counter to the bar, restaraunt and housekeeping.. everything was exceptional. Just having the staff respond in an empathetic manner and offer to provide all of the things I was missing made a huge difference. I was further impressed by the staff's sense of urgency to provide thoughtful service. On my last day of business travel a large group of us had a morning double decker bus tour of the city. I was late coming down and had missed breakfast. The manager of the restaraunt gathered help and they put together a full continental breakfast to go for me in 2 minutes, at no cost. I was shocked and they just seemed so happy to get my day off to an excellent start. Thank you very much for the excellent service! I hope to return again soon with XBiz. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel option for London”
Reviews.Author: CobyCat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our 10 night stay at the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street. The room itself seemed a bit small compared to the pictures of a deluxe suite on the hotel website (we didn't have a sofa in the room - it wouldn't have fit), but it had a nice layout and we appreciated all the windows (that opened!) and the distance from other guest rooms. We also appreciated having North American outlets available in the room (a pleasant surprise). I was a bit confused by the fluctuating daily rates - I'm used to a hotel having one static rate for each day of my stay. Also, the air freshener or scent used in the entrance of the hotel was a bit strong. That said, the hotel was clean, comfortable, modern and perfectly located in the city. In fact, it was so close to the British Museum that we ended up visiting it five times. There is also a sandwich shop (Pret) and a 24 hour grocery just down the street. Very convenient. We also greatly appreciated the friendly and attentive staff. It is always good to start a hotel stay with a warm greeting at the front desk. Another reviewer had it right - there is a certain understated efficiency with the staff here that just works. With so many hotels to choose from in London, I think we made a good choice with the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street. If we return to London, I don't see why we wouldn't stay here again. One further observation - the hotel might need to be a little less steathly and work to raise its profile a bit. My wife and I took many taxis during our stay and only three drivers knew of the hotel. We ended up asking to be dropped off by the British Museum most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Pulled out all the stops”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer1966
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Radisson, Bloomsbury about half a dozen times and we have never been disappointed. This time we also hosted a small reception and dinner for 16 people and we were treated as if we were holding a massive event at the the hotel. Our guests were treated to a wonderful dinner and delicious canapes, gracious staff who excel in customer service - and a private bar area and dinning room that made us all feel very special. The accommodations are consistently good. Very comfortable and contemporary. It's in a perfect location. They even have a comfortable covered outside area for guests to smoke, which pleasantly surprised my husband who enjoys a cigar after dinner. We'll definitely be back. In fact, we are so impressed with our overall experience at the Radisson Bloomsbury, that we plan on making it our home-from-home whenever we visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the Bloomsbury district”
Reviews.Author: LeonDijksman
Reviews.Content: I often stay at hotels from Carlson Group (Radisson, Park Plaza and others), but this was my first stay at this hotel. I was greeted warmly by the staff. All staff is very kind and helpfull. The room was clean and complete. The location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “A great first class hotel for London.”
Reviews.Author: Explore88
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Raddison Edwardian Bloomsbury Street to celebrate my wife’s 50th birthday (from the 14th to the 21st of September). This is one of the best stays we have had in the 25 years we have been holidaying and at times working in London. We booked the one bedroom suite (red room) which was tremendous, from the decor to the facilities. In regards to the service by staff, it was 'understated efficiency', in other words whatever you asked for was done with no fuss or inconvenience to your stay. I need to say this was our first time at the hotel as we previously stayed at a leading London brand hotel in Park Lane; however I believe the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury outstrips many hotels on all levels. The location of the hotel is the extra bonus, as the area is full of restaurants and places to simply sit and enjoy a coffee while watching London life pass by. In summary, well done, someone has got all the elements of the mix right for a great first class hotel in London. In addition I look at value over cost - simply the hotel is exceptional value for the experience we encountered. We will return, guaranteed!

Reviews.Title: “All about the location”
Reviews.Author: DHDublin
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this hotel and the location could not have been better. Even though there is a tube station nearby, we didn't have to use it because everything was within walking distance. We were upgraded to a room with a king bed but nonetheless found the room to be quite small. As with previous comments we found the floral scent that was pumped through the reception area and ground floor to be unnecessarily strong. This hotel is not cheap by any means, but it's location and accessibility to many key attractions would encourage a future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: theatrelover25
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on 16th September as part of a theatre break, fantastic location! We had upgraded to the Deluxe Double and were glad we did! The room (2011) was very tiny even in this category so not sure what they are like on the category below! but still they are really well decorated and the beds are really comfy. The room & the bathroom were super clean and had everything you would need for a comfortable stay. Perfect for one night but maybe a little small for more than that. We didnt stay for breakfast as we felt that £21 per person was a bit much and there are plenty of places near where you can get a good breakfast for around £5. We had advised the hotel that is was a special anniversary before arrival (and mentioned again at check in) and was hoping of a few extras as some other hotels have done in the past, but we didnt get anything not even a congratulations! that was a shame but maybe thats just me being fussy! We certainly would still use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel with one of the nicest guest relation managers in london!”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: Recently visited the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury for work purposes to see the event space and rooms for company events potentially taking place next year. Luke (guest relations manager) completely looked after me and my mother and we had a fab time at the hotel. The champagne afternoon tea was amazing and very relaxed and just what we needed before a spot of shopping on oxford street. As we were celebrating my mothers birthday Luke even presented her with an amazing amenity kit! she was blown away by the gesture and it really was lovely of him to do this for her. The event space at the hotel was fab and very versatile and i'm sure we will be using the hotel within the next 12 months.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location....”
Reviews.Author: cpearce2
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and then returned for one. Perfect location, and the single room was unexpectedly cheap. Not a room you would spend a lot of time in, but then the best of london is all within walking distance. Expensive breakfast - but lots of options outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Bobby88888
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights in this hotel at the end of August 2011 for my third visit to London. First, the location is perfect. I am peripatetic so being able to walk to so many attractions was a huge plus. British Museum is literally two-minute walk from the hotel. Leicester Square (and the nearby Chinatown, which has some decently priced and authentic Asian food) is only a ten-minute walk from the hotel, and additional ten-minute walk from there you are in Trafalgar Square. In another direction, the heart of Oxford Road is only a ten-minute walk away. There are lots of restaurants and shopping within in walking distance. Even if you don't enjoy exploring by foot, the hotel is located near two tube stations for you to get around. Second, the hotel and my room was clean with modern decor; the beds are comfortable; and bathroom was good size. Finally, the hotel for its caliber was reasonably priced, especially for London. I booked early and pre-paid to receive a 20% discount. A couple of things to note: I had a Deluxe room, which was much larger than the Superior room my friends occupied (it felt cramped to be honest). Sometimes there is not a big difference between Deluxe and Superior rooms, but at this hotel there is a difference. I recommend spending the extra for the Deluxe room; it is worth it. Also, there was a strong floral odor in the lobby that bothered my friends, but not me so much.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay but the reception was a bit too fragrant!!”
Reviews.Author: alex_lochaber
Reviews.Content: Lovely stay. Joseph at reception couldn't do enough for us, especially when the room originally allocated was smelling of cigarettes. So once moved to a lovely new room, had a comfortable nights sleep in a lovely clean room with a HUGE bathroom. Most refreshing. The only downside was the entrance hall. There was airfreshener or perfume being pumped through the aircon and it was so overwhelming that when my friends came to collect me, they had to wait outside! Shame...but that was the only issue. Everyone very friendly and helpful and the room was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Excellant Service - Expensive but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Sun27London
Reviews.Content: I booked the King delux suite which had a free standing bath in the bedroom. Gorgeous suite, great modern and warm decor and great service from staff. The room had a walk in shower and complimentary aromatherapy creams were provided. Staff were more than helpful. Breakfast was very nice although over priced (£20 each!) Would highly recommend this hotel although expensive, but great for special occassions. I also received a courtesy phone call the day before to check whether there was anything else we needed. Hotel comes with no car park but there is one 10 minutes away, costing approx £26 for 24 hours. Impressed overall.

Reviews.Title: “We think it's great and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Dan H
Reviews.Content: An immaculate and stylish hotel in a great location for shopping in the Covent Garden area of London. Offer really good mid-week value for money bed and breakfast packages. The Guest Relations Team under Manager "Luke" are stars who made us feel like valued customs. We can't wait for another opportunity to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: nicjwil
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the service we were provided was warm, welcoming and friendly. We loved our room - it was luxurious and had the most impressive bed! Location was excellent... only a short stroll (in heels) to meet friends in Soho for celebrations!! Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for site seeing and eating”
Reviews.Author: Poipu04
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury. Our room was modern, comfortable and quiet. I especially liked the panel of outlets by the bed for British, European and American appliances. I did not need to use a converter or plug adaptor for my cell phone. We had a nice flat screen t.v., mini bar, hair dryer and electric kettle. The room was very clean and everything was crisp and new, including the public areas. The cooked breakfast buffet was quite extensive. We also had dinner at the hotel after a very late night out. The fish and chips were quite good. The hotel is just steps away from the British Museum. There are many places to eat within walking distance, and the front desk is very friendly and helpful with suggestions. The bathroom was perhaps larger than our sleeping area. It had a very modern looking basin and visually appealing shower/tub area. My only complaint is that it was not user friendly. The towel bar hung over the toilet so one night we woke up to find that our face towel had fallen into the toilet. Also, the partial glass shower door did not completely seal off water from leaking onto the floor. The tub had a nice rain style fixture, but I had to be careful that the spray was not too high, so as to spare the bathroom floor from flooding. Also, I did not see a plug to the sink basin to hand launder a few items and was unable to locate a retractable clothes line that most places have in the tub area. Overall, I would stay here again and would not let the bathroom issues dissuade me. We just made sure to close the lid every night so as not to lose more towels.

Reviews.Title: “We always feel welcome and pampered--we'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: kstarrenburg
Reviews.Content: Our room has everything we need for a great holiday--an ironing board, a table with chairs, wonderful view and lots of light and air, internet access, flat-screen TV, and,of course, coffee- and tea-making facilities. I love the large bathroom with lots of counter space, the magnifying mirror at a convenient height, and the spacious bathtub. We find the location ideal: within walking distance of Covent Garden, the theatre district, Oxford Street shopping, and the CIty. Several members of staff went well out of their way to help us; Aaron in the dining room and Anthony at the concierege always make us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant and well positioned hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: warrnambool
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Bloomsbury St Radisson, on a holiday trip. We arrived early in the day , well before normal check in, but they kindly found us a room without delay , a blessing after a long overnight plane trip. The room was smallish but very well appointed ,spotlessly clean, with an excellent bathroom. The staff were uniformly helpful and friendly, breakfasts were significantly better than our usual Radisson experience (we stay with this chain a lot , and I recommend their "Carlsson Club loyalty program as being well worthwhile). The gym was small but functional , and the decor of the hotel pleasant . The position is perfect..around the corner from the British Museum ,easy walking distance to the attractions of Soho (where excellent australian style coffee is now to be had) and the West End. Tube station likewise a few minutes walk away. This will be our base next time we're in London.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite Hotel in London!”
Reviews.Author: PaulB_5555
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury is a Fantastic, Stylish Hotel in the Centre of London - Great for both Business and Lesiure Breaks. I have stayed at the hotel many times and enjoyed every visit - Great staff throughout the hotel - pleasant and efficient from the moment you check in to the polite Doorman who will grab you a taxi on departure! The rooms are stylish, great beds and pillows for a great nights sleep, mini bar actually with drinks in it! and often great views from your window. The bar serves great cocktails and has a great ambience and the breakfast is the best in London! (Plus the staff are friendly, efficient and will remember you time and time again!) Great Hotel and I will be sure to be staying there time and time again! Paul Bean, Nottingham

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: excellent location, room (and bathroom), staff and location. Would absolutely stay there again (as long as the price does not increase).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great Location, Flawless service”
Reviews.Author: andrewhaynes
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife went London for four nights and stayed at Radisson Bloomsbury Street Hotel. Check in was fast and prompt, but the orginal room (standard room) was to small for a couple, maybe a night on a business room for one. However we called reception who promptley showed us a king room, which was alot more spacious and had a amazing view from the windows, so for an extra £150 we booked this. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpfull as I have experinced at all Radissons were I have stayed. House keeping were flawless and the rooms were clean as you would expect. The hotel itself is ideally located opposite the British Musem walking distant from Oxford St and Covent Gardens. (theaters) At £21 per person for breakfast we never ate at the hotel but there are fantastic cafes and restaraunts close by which I can say are alot cheaper. Overall great hotel, and fantastic location, for lite sleepers can be abit noisey at night with traffic on road. We would stay again definatley!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best - my 2nd visit”
Reviews.Author: MichaelOak
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night at the Bloomsbury Street Hotel again and very happy with the overall service, very specious room with all the facilities one would need for a business trip. I was given free drinks voucher on arrival as part of my booking package! overall very happy. Very good location, just a few minutes away from covent garden and soho , but what holds this place is the service level and staff who are very friendly. Well done, you guys deserv all the 5 starts on tripadvisor

Reviews.Title: “We loved it yet again”
Reviews.Author: susieq65
Reviews.Content: Well worth it,lovely hotel that is well situated for theatres etc. I came on a mini break with my mum to see the jerseyboys and was not dissapointed. The staff are helpful and the concierge is very informative and willing to help in any way he can. The hotel is central and within walking distance of good restaurants and shops. Will definitely stay again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Wayne E
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at the Bloomsbury St Radisson and standards remain high. The hotel decor is sophisticated and modern and we were made to feel welcome from the moment we walked through the door - great service but not intrusive. Location for museums and theatres doesn't really get much better. We arrived into London at Euston and as the weather was fine took the 15 -20 min walk (which couldn't get much more direct) rather than the tube. Good value too - we'll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: kikkimc
Reviews.Content: I have had a most enjoyable experience at the Bloomsbury hotel. I had parcels delivered before my stay and during, which Gary the Concierge helped with. All the staff is very friendly and helpful. I would suggest this hotel to any business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: NuNufoo
Reviews.Content: Great welcome, clean and comfortable room, nice decor throughout with elegant but cozy ambience. Location was convenient for a nice stroll to shop along Oxford and Regent streets, a visit to the British Museum practically next door and some interesting antiquties shops close by. Best of all and in what matters most, pleasant and helpful staff pulled all of the hard and fixed stuff together, into an outstanding hotel. Kudo's to Radisson, management and staff and we will have no hesitation in returning to stay nor recommending this Hotel to family and friends, in Singapore heading to London for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the purpose.”
Reviews.Author: Kirstyaa
Reviews.Content: This was a one night stay for us to see Shrek as a birthday treat. The hotel was in a superb location, all staff especially Duane whom part of the reception staff made a very pleasant welcome. Have noticed people have commented over small room sizes, but was more than adequate to relax in and suited our needs, as we was not spending the day in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, will defo be back”
Reviews.Author: SmileygirlIre
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bloomsbury recently, and was very impressed. The room was extremly spacious, especially considering it's London City centre location. Bathroom was bright spacious and very clean. I recieved a welcome call 10 mins after checking in to ensure everything was to my standard, the front of desk staff were very helpful with bags and dinner reservations, and the bar was very modern too. I was there on a business trip but as the location in centre, I will defintely be returning to the hotel on both business and pleasure trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kkroskey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for 4 days. The staff was great and the hotel was very nice and modern. Location was within 5-10 minute walking distance to Trafalgar Square and the surrounding areas but wasn't smack in the middle of all the bustle, which was nice for getting a sound sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price and not 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: Birkbo
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury. It is certainly not a 4 start hotel as they claim. The rooms are run down and quite small. But the worst part is the awfull smell in the reception and restaurant. They insert some perfume to their ventilation system which is very, very heavy. I made this remark to the staff in the restaurant as all food tasted of the perfume - and again upon checking out. I guess they do it for a good reason and believe the guests like it - but we certainly did not. So we had breakfast in the hotel the first morning. It was bad, expensive and had this perfume taste. So we never ate there again. Despite knowing that of course a city like London is not cheap for hotels I think find that the value was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best....!!”
Reviews.Author: cityslicker01
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here on a recent trip to London to see a show! The Hotel was easy to find just 10/15mins walk from Euston Stration and as we got there on a early train we went straight to the hotel to leave our luggage. We were told that our room was ready so could check in early (no charge-as you find with some hotels for early check-in) This was brill because we could freshen up and leave our stuff in the room not needing to come back to check in. The staff were professional, helpful, friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast was lovely, variety of choice, hot, cold, continental..whatever you fancied. We stayed for afternoon tea which was fab (we shared one though, was enough for 2) The room was fantastic and we had a nice enough view. We would definately stay here again and I am already planning a trip with my husband for October !!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussiecouple258
Reviews.Content: High quality and standards throughout this hotel. Great size modern room with large bathroom and free WIFI. Hotel is well located and only a few minutes walk to tube station. Transport, shops, laundry and restaurants are within easy walking distance. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnH529
Reviews.Content: The welcome on arrival was excellent. Very attentive staff who's main aim was to see I recieved what I was expecting. Throughout the stay any interaction with the staff was very positive. Room was veryneat tidy and of a very good standard. I have stayed in this hotel and its sister hotel on many occassions on business and found both to be excellent

Reviews.Title: “A great stay and will return!”
Reviews.Author: JulieD2908
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Impressive entrance and the staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. (The concierge was a font of information!) The room was small but had everything we needed and the bathroom was bigger than average. If you are wanting to visit London and have easy access to all the attractions without having to use public transport this is perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, will definitely be coming back whenmin the area.”
Reviews.Author: Suresh L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location close to everything we needed. It is one of my favourite hotels in London, it was the third time I stayed there this year and will definitely be coming back on the next occasion. The Radisson Bloomsbury is was very comfortable luxurious hotel where i felt at home.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back, soon I hope!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: One could not ask for a more hospitable group of people. All of our needs were met exceeding all expectations. My wife required a visit from a physician and they had one in our room in 40 minutes. I can not get in to my doctor for an office visit that quick. I would not even consider another hotel for a return trip, which I hope we can make soon.

Reviews.Title: “A first class hotel.Customer service is the best I have experienced anywhere in the world.”
Reviews.Author: Adrian R
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel.The reception staff "go that extra mile" to ensure everything is to your complete satisfaction.The rooms are well appointed and in a very contempory style.It is refreshing to find a hotel in London where they really appreciate your custom.I have been happy to recommend this Hotel to friends and family.Stay there next time,you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was very well located for places like Covent Garden, Leicester Square and of course the theatre shows and from when we first entered the hotel we knew it was going to be a great stay. All the staff are extremely friendly and very helpful indeed. The bedroom was very classy decorated with everything that you need and comfortable room space for our stay. Breakfast was of a very high standard indeed and set us off for the rest of the day. We will definitely be back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “NICE LOCATION FOR THEATRES AND SOHO”
Reviews.Author: jajasa
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be ideally situated and within walking distance to all the theatres, Soho, China Town and Covent Gardens. The hotel is modern and the room was comfortable, new and clean. We enjoyed the free WI-Fi The staff were at all times friendly and very helpful and their bar is great for cocktails and snacks. If you enjoy Chinese food you must visit China Town and have the Peking Duck and Soft Shelled Crab. We could have eaten this every day we were in London as it was so delicious. The staff at these restaurants were so attentive and even though they are always busy they are always one step ahead of your needs. If you enjoy the Theatre then this hotels locations is superb - we would stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its top rating on TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: scott a
Reviews.Content: I went home recently to London and decided to try this hotel (as opposed to my previous hotel of choice). After reading the reviews on this website I had high expectations and I am glad to say they were all exceeded. I was upgraded to a king double as the room type I had booked was not avaialble at 9am when I arrived. The complimentary water on reception was a nice touch. The staff were inormative, helpful and very friendly. The hotel was very nicely decorated and recently renovated. The wifi was great as I was working a little bit and the breakfast was very nice (although the breakfast was perhaps a little pricey). Bloombsury is a great locaiton and proximity to Covent Gdn, Leicester Sq, Soho, Chinatown and British Museum were all great. This is my first posting on TripAdvisor but I felt I had to because this hotel was very good and I found it thanks to this site. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: 55Tom
Reviews.Content: This hotel which has been refurbished in the last few years was a great location for seeing London. Near a number of undeground stations it gave flexibility to see all parts of the capital. We booked a deluxe room that was spotless and had a huge bathroom/dressing room. Had afternoon tea and the food and the service was excellent! Will be going back there!

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel - We would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: peg66
Reviews.Content: Beautifully presented hotel just of Tottenham Court Road, Dominium Theatre and British Museum and within 5 minutes walk to Covent Garden. Oxford Street and Leicester Square - Fab location! yet very quiet at night great large sofas and seating areas in the foyer, extensive bar list that did not rip you off on price, great food menu and deals on set menus and afternoon tea, super richly decorated function rooms at ground and lower ground level - we used a small one during our stay, fabulous staff, everyone was soooo attentive, always greeting us with a smile and nothing was too much trouble, modern styled compact and neat bedrooms, really comfortable beds (our room was a little warm - air con not that fab but OK) We stayed two nights and would have no hesitation in returning again

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you would hope for...”
Reviews.Author: NantwichFlatley
Reviews.Content: Front of house staff were very welcoming and informative - it seemed they were actually pleased that you had chosen to stay in their hotel. Room was well furnished, comfy and clean. The iron was missing but one call to reception and it was at my door in 5 minutes. On departure I was going to ask if our bags could be stored for the day. When the lift door opened the concierge appeared to have read my mind and was waiting to take my bags from me. Brilliant service. Definitely will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “This is my new 1st choice hotel in London!”
Reviews.Author: VickiD
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Great location, walking distance to the Museum, great restaurants and nightlife. The staff was really helpful, taking care of our car for us and getting us settled in after a long day of travel. The room was stunning, comfortable and quiet with a walk in closet, lovely shower and great bed. The price was amazing - about $260 USD with taxes etc. I would expect to pay far more for a hotel of this quality in this location. We didn't have the opportunity to eat in the restaurant, but the menu looked amazing. This is now one of my top 10 favorite hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, impeccable service,would advise anyone to try”
Reviews.Author: marita_tate
Reviews.Content: We walked into the hotel to be greeted with a hello and sincere smile, shown to the check in desk where front of house took or booking details, who by the way was very polite and friendly. on the reception desk was a bottled water and glasses, we were asked to help our selves to water. Front of house staff were fantastic, they could not help enough. We were offered help with our luggage even though was only a small over night case. We were told our room was upgraded at no extra charge and was given our key card and room number, then told we would recieve a call in a short while to make sure everything was to our liking. My husband and I went to the room which was very nice, it was lovely and clean, and there was more complimentary bottled water for us, which was lovely. We left the room after twenty mins or so to have a walk around to return to the hotel once again with a warm welcome and a message on our phone asking if the room was to our liking and if we needed any thing to just call. This hotel has a fantastic calm atmosphere, and very friendly staff that can't do enough to make your stay perfect. The hotel is also in walking distance to all of the attractions, which is also a plus. We had breakfast the next morning which was very nice, once again the waiting staff were fantastic. I will go back to this hotel, and I will and have already told lots of people about it. The reason I have put four stars is because I did only stay the one night, but do wish hand on heart I had booked for a few more, but had booked another hotel in Liverpool to end the weekend. This trip was for my birthday and arranged by my husband, he could not have chosen better. Well done to the ALL staff at the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: peuclid
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several hotels in this area and this is one of my new favorites. It had free wifi, comfortable bed, quiet rooms and location had easy walkable access to Soho and the British Museum and everything else that that implies. The bed was very comfortable. Plenty of soft pillows to make you comfy at any angle. Desk was pretty good and the wifi had very good reception and bandwidth. There was a safe in the room as well as coffee machine. I still don't quite understand why London hotels don't have full shower curtains or doors, but at least it had a half-wall for the shower. It was conveniently labelled "Shower" in case you weren't sure what the tiny class room was with the knobs on the wall and the shower spout on top. It was one of those rain-like showers coming from the ceiling which I'm not crazy about, but it looks nice, and a hand-sprayer is provided as well so you can get that necessary side-angle. I didn't spend much time in the hotel so I didn't make much use of the amenities or eat at the restaurant. From my limited experience however, the staff was extremely responsive and helpful. They were always offering help and seemed to be available at any time.

Reviews.Title: “I'd recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: lkbeep
Reviews.Content: Room was small, bathroom is big. Clean. Very good location. Good breakfast. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: Zena O
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really lovely. The staff on reception were very friendly and made us feel very welcome at the hotel from the moment we arrived. The room although not particularly big was beautiful and had a luxury feel to it, everything you would expect from a four star hotel. Bloomsbury is a lovely area of London and I would hope to stay at this hotel again should I be in London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Mellees
Reviews.Content: My wife and I make regular trips to London to see ballet at the Royal Opera House. We alway stay in the Bloomsbury area and since our previous hotel of preference has been refurbished and gone seriously upmarket in terms of price, we thought we would try the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street. What a good decision! Rooms are well appointed and the service is outstanding. We had a dress emergency where one my wife's shoes lost its heel, The Concierge were called in and within ten minutes the shoe was repaired and the evening saved. We will definitely be staying at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “High Level of Service in Superior Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: swpooky24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street whilst on buisnes in London. We were given a very high level of service on check in by Diego who was kind enough to upgrade us from a queen room to a deluxe king (ideal as I am pregnant!). On arrival at our room we received a phone call to check everything was ok with the room but we couldn't fault anything. The rooms are decorated to a very high standard and are a haven from the crowded streets of London. We were close by to restaurants and the university (where I was working) and although we did not dine in the hotel restuarant the menu looked very good.Would highly recommend and hope to stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: angela_barfoot
Reviews.Content: this hotel was lovely . very posh and we where made to feel so important . the staff where really nice we would def stay again if we can afford it .

Reviews.Title: “Four stars well deserved”
Reviews.Author: LenB_SE
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure to experience one of the large suites at this hotel, as well as a regular double room. Both were of very high standard but the suite was certainly above and beyond expectations. It's not a cheap stay by all means, but at least we felt very satisfied that we got what we payed for. The receptionist called it "the most romantic suite in the hotel" and that could very well be true. Great roomy suite (unlike many other hotels where even suites feel cramped) with beautiful furniture. Add a free standing bath tub in the bedroom (in addition to a regular bathroom and shower) and it made a wonderful and unique stay. Another thing on the plus side is the hotel restaurant was well above average as hotel restaurants go. Since we were staying a couple of days we had the chance to try out both dinner and breakfast. Both were very enjoyable with made-to-order dishes available along the regular breakfast buffé. I am unsure of the official critera for a 5-star hotel, but this 4-star one we felt were pushing the upper end of the tier. Would definitely recommend and consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the experience!”
Reviews.Author: xLisax_7
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure to dine in this hotel and restaurant one night when we were in London for the weekend! I am so glad I chose this hotel as the food was faultless. The service received by every member of staff was outstanding and especially Yonka who made us very welcomed. At first we were offered a cocktail at the bar where the bar staff were amazing! Could not have done more for us everything was fantastic! We then were showed to one of the best tables in the restaurant by Yonka and immediately offered water and told to take our time to decide on what we would like. I will definitely return to dine in this hotel and will recommend to lots of people. 5* Quality food!

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: klaijawala
Reviews.Content: The radisson edwardian is located bang next to the british museum. You can walk to oxford street, covent garden, leicester square and through the theatre district. There is a rent-a-bike right opposite that's easy to use and the tube is about a five minute stroll. Not that you'll need it! everywhere you need to be is right next door! The rooms are particularly small, but very classy. The front desk is friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: rbolly
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping, very friendly and helpful staff and fabulous sized room considering this is such a centrally located hotel! Would definitely recommend to the business and leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ronengel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Edwardian for about 5 days with a colleague. We had to work long days so our hotel had to be more than 'just a bed'. And it was. It's clean, quiet, has a great bar, spacious and nicely decorated rooms and a very friendly and helpful staff. The perfect location, a 5-minute walk from our office and form Oxford street also helps.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - best hotel I have stayed in whilst in London”
Reviews.Author: shelleyandandy
Reviews.Content: Having booked through booking.com and attending a show over the weekend, we wanted a central location, near to Covent Garden, Euston and the West End! Upon arrival I was certainly impressed, the reception staff are outstanding ! Helpful and chatty, we got upgraded to a King room. Nice start ! The overall apperance of the hotel is modern, well cared for, opulent and yet inviting. I was so impressed with my initial impressions, that I actually went up to our room with a smile on my face ! 1st floor with a room at the front, the lift and communial areas are decorated in black, sparkling and clean! Opening the door is always a 'hold your breath' moment for me, but my delight continued as we walked in a spacious, light and modern room! Very large and comfortable bed with a modern, chic bathroom! If you like the shiney, new, clean, atmospheric hotel, don't go anywhere else but here ! It is superb! Central location to everything you need, the theatre, Covent Garden, St James Park ( 10 minute walk ) and Euston, I honestly CAN NOT fault this hotel. There is nothing that they wouldn't do for you in the speed of lightening and I will most definitely stay here for all my forthcoming trips to London.! To say that the service rivalled that of Dubai would be a fair comparison and to date I have never been anywhere that was as good as the hotels there for service !

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: da150
Reviews.Content: We had pre-paid through Orbitz, but Orbitz had failed to make the actual booking. Thus, no reservation showed up in the system upon arrival. Rajni and Cynthia (at reception) went very much out of their way to be helpful, both on arrival and at departure. What could have been a disaster turned out to be just fine. I cannot say that I have ever experienced a more helpful staff. For those of you familiar with London, this is the old Marlborough Hotel at Bloomsbury and Great Russell Street. This is one of the best locations in the entire city, convenient to almost everything. The British Museum is a block away, as is Oxford Street and Bedford Square. Easy walk to Covent Garden and the Tottenham Court Tube Station. The hotel has recently gone through a thorough upgrade and renovation. Though the decor is somewhat bizarre (part Las Vegas, part Phillipe Starke wanna be; e.g. benches in the lobby that are "works of art" and require small plaques that say "Do not Sit".) It is the helpfulness of the staff that overcomes these slightly amusing distractions. Breakfast is way too expensive, but there is a Pret a` Manger a block away. Overall, very good. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “My Kind of Place.”
Reviews.Author: Trexmid
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that I have stayed at the Radisson Bloomsbury during the month of July and both times the experience was well above satisfactory, although the second visit did have a slow start. Upon check in, their appeared to be a problem associated with the booking I had made earlier that day (via the Radisson website) for two standard rooms. After five minutes a member of the front desk staff very politely asked us to take a seat in the bar area where we were then served some complimentary drinks & savoury snacks. All very nice but after a long day at the races and slowish drive into central London, my colleague and I were both keen to get showered and freshened up prior to an evening on the town. Around 25 minutes later the very attentive receptionist then reappeared to explain there had been an overbooking however, it had now been dealt with and we were to be upgraded into two higher graded rooms along with free breakfasts. It was a difficult situation, although handled very well. The rooms are well designed with really nice fixtures & fittings, beds are extremely comfortable with a high quality mattress and pillows, my only real criticism of the room would be having a shower in the bath tub, I much prefer a purpose built cubicle with a powerful spray, although the watering can type at this place was very relaxing. The television set up and control was a little confusing and rather tedious with a poor choice of FREE channels, I could not find a music video station. Breakfast was excellent and a special mention to some truly delicious bacon and sausages.

Reviews.Title: “The customer really matters”
Reviews.Author: SimonJFC
Reviews.Content: First rate service, with a call in advance of the trip to check our estimated time of arrival and any special requirements. In our case it was a away weekend for my daughter with Dad and the welcome and special treats, alongside the ideal location for our activities, was refreshing and made the experience memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, well serviced hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCmom50
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business in May 2011. The room was small, but quiet and well serviced. The staff was very friendly and helpful, directing me as needed and making suggestions as well. The elevator is key card locked, which provides added security. I would stay here again, but the room was relatively small. Nice view over Great Russell Street.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: iclubb
Reviews.Content: The room was nicely sized for a London hotel, including a great bathroom. Some might have wanted a tub but I prefer the spa-type shower that the room had. I believe they've recently renovated and it shows. Staff was uniformly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It's one of the best options in London”
Reviews.Author: Svetsol
Reviews.Content: It's a fantastic hotel with exceptional staff, central location and excellent facilities. Rooms are comfortable and beautiful. Breakfast is fantastic. I would 100% recomment it to anybody both for business and tourist purposes!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Sallyatl
Reviews.Content: After many flight cancellations and our luggage being lost for three days, our stay here at the Radisson was a breath of fresh air. The staff was kind and very helpful. The hotel is modern and chic. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. We loved our time in London and cannot wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Back to former excellence!”
Reviews.Author: Honestopinion_10
Reviews.Content: Whereas experiences can be rather mixed at the Radisson Edwardian, our last visit was extremely enjoyable. Service, accommodation and overall helpfulness of staff were exemplary. We equally noted a very impressive level of local knowledge amongst staff. Whether on a business or leisure visit, I shall continue to prefer this Radisson to the Kenilworth across the road, where I recently had a much less than satisfactory experience.

Reviews.Title: “Second time stay and we will return”
Reviews.Author: Draycott14
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Radisson Bloomsbury Street Hotel. We returned as it has a great location, within walking distance of most of central London (sights, shops and museums etc) and the staff are very competent and friendly, especially Anthony, the Concierge. Check in was smooth, check out likewise. The transfer arrangements made by the hotel for us were excellent and competitively priced. The rooms are comfortable and quiet and the bathrooms well appointed and spacious. If I have any negative comment it is that the room we had this year was much smaller and darker than last year's room. The extra space was appreciated as we had two large suitcases and were at the end of three weeks of travel and needed to organise ourselves for the trip home. There are plenty of eating choices within a short walk as well as traditional English pubs.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for and more!”
Reviews.Author: buzzzzsaw
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed a total of 12 nights in two different 'standard rooms' (we broke up our London stay with 5 nights in Paris and came back to the Radisson Edwardian) and thought it was a wonderful property with an ideal location- just a block from the British Museum and minutes from several subway stations, restaurants and shopping. The room immenities were excellent, housekeeping prompt and thorough and the Concierge assistance invaluable. One gentleman in particular offered daily aassistance with directions, booking tours, insights, etc. I would highly recommend the Radisson Edwardian.

Reviews.Title: “A great conference venue”
Reviews.Author: DanielleMcC
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel to run a conference for my Senior Management team. It is a lovely venue, very well situated with great spaces and rooms. The layout is perfect for conferences. The staff were all always very attentive and prepared to make any last minute changes we needed, and there were many. Nic, Nic, Celeste and Deep were never far away and offered a level of customer service that I have not found in many establishments. It was a pleasure to work with them. They are all very knowledgable about what it takes to run a good conference and will offer input where it is needed. The chef ensured that food was always of a very high standard and catered to all of our many dietary requirements. I wouldn't hesitate to use them again for either business or personal trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AndersC
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel in the heart of London. The breakfast was very good with a great number of dishes. The breakfast staff was always very kind and did also give us o lot of tips of good shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “2 day Conference - excellent venue”
Reviews.Author: JaneOrr
Reviews.Content: I organised and attended a 2 day conferrnece at the Bloomsbury Radisson Hotel. The staff were very helpful and the Facilities were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing suite, incredibly helpful & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MimBot
Reviews.Content: My husband took me here as a surprise anniversary treat and what a treat it was. We arrived a couple of hours early but the staff made us comfortable and prepared our room early. The gold suite was breath taking and the bath in the bedroom a luxurious, decadent place to drink tea. The meal was delicious and eating early to go to the theatre meant we felt we were the only people being cooked for even though others were there. The staff have a rare quality that makes you feel like the most important person to them in their hotel. Being told to take the pamper box was an extra thrill and I am already planning my next long hot soak. Thank you for making our special anniversary even more lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - would happily use again”
Reviews.Author: popjoy
Reviews.Content: Reception was efficient, the general atmosphere was 'sumptuous urban cool', and outrroom was very nice indeed. Sheer dumb luck saw us getting the top room in the 'corner tower', so we had a semi-panoramic view of that area of London. One small point: the room was double-glazed, but even so you could hear the traffic as a low rumble. Not an issue for us, but some may be put off by it. Then again, it's London, there's traffic everywhere at every hour, you just put up with it. Breakfast was a little pricey, but very good quality and will definitely see you through the day - so given that, maybe it was actually a bargain? If I was staying in this area again (it is excellent for the British Museum), I would definitely stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely service”
Reviews.Author: saffyst
Reviews.Content: got upgrade as told them it was a wedding anniversary . lovely service , people and bed was huge . room was clean and in excellent conditon. highly recommended. nothing was wrong or not perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, so near to oxford street - great for shopping”
Reviews.Author: jonathan30
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the this Raddison hotel in London in June 2011, great location about a 5 minutes walk from Oxford Street and all that lovely shopping! Hotel staff very nice and friendly could not do enough, even going to the trouble of going outside an waiting with us until we could flag a taxi down. We had breakfast there which was really nice, plenty to choose from, great fruit salad very fresh and again staff could not do enough to help. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location, didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: arnoldstar
Reviews.Content: The greeting and service received upon entrance was of a high standard. Was very impressed with the quality and design of the hotel communal areas, bar and the room I stayed in. It was the perfect location for the theatre show I was attending also for a quick meal before hand. The bar was open till 1am and was a great atmosphere to be in. The room service received was prompt and delivered service to a high standard. After I checked out I happily sat in the comfortable seating/bar area for a couple of hours reading the newspapers on offer and being waited on by very professional staff. I will 100% stay here again and will also recommend it to others. I definitely feel like I got more than my monies worth.

Reviews.Title: “At last a clean spacious London hotel”
Reviews.Author: MandP13
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a base for a weekend of sightseeing in London. Not having stayed here before, we did not know what to expect, but we were pleasantly surprised, as previous experience of London hotels were cramped and not entirely clean. We were greeted at the door by a friendly lady, and told that we could check in and leave our bags until our room was ready later in the day. A very efficient and friendly lady named Annie at reception did just this, and was there later when we took possession of our room key too. We did not eat at the hotel, but did use the bar facitiles in the evening which were good. Our room was clean and pleasant. It was a warm evening, and when we did find the air conditioning during the night it worked quickly. The hotel is just around the corner from Tottenham Court Road Tube Station, so has easy access to transport. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous little gem in the heart of town!”
Reviews.Author: JoyGriffiths
Reviews.Content: London hotels can be very disappointing at times, often at high cost. The Bloomsbury Radisson was a decent price for excellent service in really lovely surroundings. My room was on the small side (not an issue for one night) and yet the space was used very effectively and with some thought, to the extent that outside the window was like a tiny "courtyard" with a topiary tree and a view of some great architecture. All the usual amenities were provided and the spacious bathroom with rainforest shower was much nicer than the cramped cubicles often found in other chains. The whole place is decorated in an opulent, artsy style, with lots of fun pieces to delight the eye, including the two little pigs snout to snout in the lounge area! Afternoon tea with a glass of fizz is a very civilised way to spend time before venturing out for your chosen pursuits - shopping is nearby, British Museum, easy access to pretty much everything. Staff were friendly, attentive and went out of their way to provide excellent service. I usually end up staying where I need to be for my business meetings, but this is actually a hotel I'd also love to stay for pleasure - one to keep on the favourites list!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Cleo123123
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay here for my parents as part of an 80th birthday treat. The room tariff was 'pay on departure'. Wanting to make sure that my parents weren't charged, I rang the hotel asking them to make sure my credit card, used for the reservation, was the one billed. This has never been a problem for other hotelsin the past. However, I was required to complete a Third Party Payment Form, which was e-mailed to me. I did this, and was told everything was ok. However, when my parents came to check-out they were asked, much to their embarrassment, to pay the bill!! I complained to the hotel that their system had failed. The manager was going to investigate and report his findings. Prompt resolution - this would have been good, except that I am still waiting to hear!! If booking for others, ensure you pay up front - or choose a different hotel chain!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Kay_Z_DE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel several times and do like it. The single rooms are small-ish but still very nice. The rooms are always clean. In the lifts and corridors there is always a flowery smell - which is a nice change when you think of many hotels that mainly smell of old carpets... The hotel is located centrally, the rooms have modern furniture and I have never heard noise from adjacent rooms. The only downside of the location is the amount of traffic and thus the noise. Noise sensitive people might want to ask for a quiet room. The bar/restaurant has a nice atmosphere and the food is good.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels in London”
Reviews.Author: MEGANIsleofWight
Reviews.Content: The young man who greeted us on reception was very attentive and helpful.We liked our room due to its unconventional shape.The bathrroom was great and the bed very comfortable.The mini bar could have offerred more variety. Breakfast was fine and quickly available.We liked the attitude of the staff-always ready to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Supreme”
Reviews.Author: bright0nbelle
Reviews.Content: I had the rear pleasure of spending one night in London recently to visit my sons first University exhibition. Staying at this hotel was my son's idea due to its central location and close proximity to the exhibition. The room was not large by any means but very comfortable and adequate for my stay. The service I received throughout my short stay was tremendous, the breakfast was a traditional full english with a museli/continental option available, hot coffee, morning papers, I could get used to this. I must also mention the guys on the concierge desk , Colm and Ankit who managed to get us a table for lunch at Nobu, which I had tried to book my self twice in the past week. Fantastic. Can't wait for the next Exhibition. Darren, Hove

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF, NOT THE USUAL SURLY UNHELPFUL ANDROIDS!!”
Reviews.Author: sacwiltshireDevizes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel very short notice for one night, arrived very late and left fairly early after breakfast. This hotel was booked by company I work for so wasn't involved in the booking process. Thought the reception staff were excellent, best I've experienced. The rooms were small but adequate, can only expect small rooms with no view in city hotels wherever you are, however thought the bathroom was a great size and well appointed. Lovely rain shower with glass screen, large mirror on both sides. Nice toiletries, didn't use them but were in nice packaging. Ironing board with decent iron in wardrobe and good hairdryer, plugs in decent positions. Full length mirror on wardrobe doors but a bit obstructed by the bed. Kettle with tea, coffee etc but no biscuits, mini bar, sewing kit, nail files etc but no shoe shine, that would have been good being a business hotel. ( i say business but I would be very happy to stay here for pleasure). room service prices looked fairly reasonable for a change. Flat screen TV in good position, good sized screen, bed was very comfortable and had a good nights sleep, never heard a thing. ( I was on the 3rd floor, room 3009) Location very good but anywhere in London is as long as you are close to a tube station etc. I was driving but as in every London hotel, no car park......had to park in the Bloomsbury Square NCP, very expensive but very secure, only a few minutes walk from hotel, all car parks in London expensive so wasnt surprised. (glad I'm not paying it was about £27 for 12 hours) Only food I had in the hotel was the breakfast, £21 probably average price for London. Staff very attentive, food very good, usual breakfast stuff fruit, cereals, pastries, full english even an a la carte for no extra money. Depends what you want, a leisurely breakfast in the hotel or a cheaper version nearby, I think most hotels are the same regarding breakfast, good thing about London is that you know there is a cheaper version nearby. Worlds your oyster and all that!!! Yes I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: ChrisK83
Reviews.Content: For a 4 star hotel, we were extremely disappointed. We paid £420 for two nights, the room was tiny and there was nowhere to sit. The wardrobe was too short for trousers or dresses to hang without creasing at the bottom and the presence of an ironing board and iron in the cupboard meant that there was very little hanging space left. The bed was so uncomfortable that we had difficulty sleeping. The noise from doors slamming and the sounds of voices and people walking around in the corridor outside didn't help. We did let the hotel know but there was little acknowledgement. I left my mobile phone charger behind and tried to call lost property. I got cut off three times and when I did get through, they were unable to tell me if they had it or could forward it. I was promised a call back which I still await...... The room and lounge ares were clean and well decorated and the staff were friendly. A pity that the room ( and 'aftercare') didn't come up to scratch!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: morris1960
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay. The staff were very attentive, and friendly. The room and food were amazing. Would definatley go back again, best hotel we have stayed in London to date.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the best location!”
Reviews.Author: AngelsBaseball
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Edwardian Bloomsbury June 24-28 2011. The hotel is located in a very convenient location close to tube stop at Totterham Hall Court and within minutes to great restaurants and sights. The breakfast buffet was very delicious and helped to start our day. All staff was friendly and helpful. Stay here and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, just around the corner from the London Museum”
Reviews.Author: sesshi101
Reviews.Content: Very nice location and enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Good room and services by hotel staff. The London traffic very light even during the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “great location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: BathHappytraveller
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its location and from that point of view was not disappointed. It's a few steps from the British Museum and within reasonable walking distance of Covent Garden and many theatres. Good transport links too. The staff are helpful and friendly. However the rooms are very small and the first one we were shown was dark and dingy, opaque film over the only window and so small you could barely move. The paintwork was also scuffed and tatty. We requested and were given a better one on a higher floor. This is one of the noisiest hotels I've ever been in. The problem is that the doors to the rooms have very heavy closers and it's difficult to close them without slamming. So if people in the rooms around yours come in late, or leave early, you'd have to be a pretty heavy sleeper - or take earplugs! The maids then start up about 8am. The price was incredibly high for what you get - but, this is London and I expected that. I think if you compare it with other London hotels it's not out of line. Fine as a base and if you don't expect too much else. We came to see a show, visit the British Museum and the South Bank, and it suited us well for that, but I wouldn't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Newquaygreen
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on business. London hotels are often hit and miss so as this was my first visit I was a bit aprehensive. I had a single room which was a bit on the tight side but it was airy, light and clean with good furniture. I would stay here again for sure Staff very good especially at breakfast, well organised and smiles all round Check-in was slow, I wonder why there needs to be so many key strokes for arriving when you have a reservation. Check-out was really quick

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: jexthetraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bloomsbury Street Hotel which is very well appointed and close to everything. The Hotel services were fine but the size of the bedroom was extremely small, nothing like the photos on the web site. You could barely open two suitcaes without placing them on the bed.
