The bathroom was well apointed however we noted that they wanted to conserve water etc which is commendable. However the shower had to run for 5 minutes before the warm water came through. Breakfast cost for a cooked breakfast was 21 Pound. We decided to have breakfast out at nearby places which were excellent and cost 5 pound each. A good hotel but tiny bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: dfcoo
Reviews.Content: Very nice stylish hotel in a very convenient location. Only a ten minute walk down Oxford street to The London Palladium where we went to see the Wizard of Oz. The hotel is very well positioned to explore London. The closest Tube station is Totenham Court Road which is less than a 5 minute walk away. There is also a Barclays Cycle Hire Scheme location nearby at Soho Square. In terms of the rooms in the hotel, the initial room we were given was very small and had a frosted window which you could not see out of. We asked to be moved to a bigger room with a window you could see out of! This was no problem at all and the staff we very understanding, kind and helpful. In general our experience in this hotel was very good and I would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: privatewire
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to London and we wanted to stay here as we had to cancel a similar trip to the same hotel last year. We arrived around 2 hours earlier than the advertised check-in time of 3 pm, this wasnt a problem however and we were dealt with efficiently by a charming lady on the front desk. We were offered an upgrade to a larger room for an extra £50 per night, but we declined. The room itself was smaller than I expected, but not terribly so, it was comfortably furnished and had excellent air conditioning. The bathroom was large and elegant with marble tiling, a shallow bath and an excellent shower, the toiletries were large bottles mounted on the wall in convenient places. Cleanliness of the room was fine, although my wife noticed that one of the glasses (actually porcelain beakers) had not been changed or cleaned for a couple of days, an oversight I presume. Our room faced the side of the hotel overlooking a small residential courtyard and was very quiet, the window had an excellent blackout blind. Soundproofing was good. The bed, although smaller than we are used to, was very comfortable. There was an in room safe, bathrobes,slippers, an ironing board and iron, and a trouser press, kettle and tea/coffee etc. We didnt eat in the hotel, although the menu looked interesting and actually not too expensive, bar prices looked on a par with elsewhere outside the hotel, spirits looked expensive, but the measures are doubles. Service was friendly and efficient. Room service breakfast was rather ambitiously priced at £21!, so i'm assuming it was the same price in the restaurant, we found to very nice Italian snack bar called Giovanni's on Museum street and another Italian cafe directly opposite it on the same street which gave a full cooked breakfast for around £5, a no brainer and both delicious! This area has plenty of places to eat at night, within walking distance our favourites were, "Tas", a Turkish restaurant diagonally opposite the hotel, Zizzis on Bow St (italian) and great place called Kopapa which did fusion style dishes in a Tapas way, utterly delicious and great service. But I digress..... In short, we enjoyed the hotel,its standards and its location. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely appointed rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: Russ855
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it (the chain) was recommended for good value in always pricey London. We ended spending much more than we would have liked but the accommodations were excellent. There was a nice modern bathroom with a large window and rainfall shower. The storage closet had an excellent amount of space. The hotel is clean and well maintained. The service was good but not exceedingly attentive. This is more a business traveler's hotel than a tourist hotel despite it's location smack in the middle of Bloomsbury (just around the corner from the British Museum and about three blocks from a tube stop). Oddly there is no space in front to pull over and nobody comes out to help with luggage (or open the door for the most part). This seemed odd in such a high end hotel. The bar and restaurant were excellent. I just wished they had an a la carte breakfast menu and not a 21 pound buffet which is excessive for most. The only major drawback was the noise from Bloomsbury Street. There must be a nearby hospital or police station with sirens all night long. We were on the 1st floor so had the street noise despite double paned glass. I would try for a high floor or around the corner off of the side facing Bloomsbury Street. I would like to try some of the other hotels in the Radisson chain in future trips.

Reviews.Title: “The cosiest hotel stay in London!”
Reviews.Author: viella1975
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an unique cosy atmosphere just around the corner of the other end of the Oxford Street. Perfect location, stylish interior design, and lovely personnel. Peaceful rooms and beautiful bathrooms. Enjoyable breakfast catering with some quiet background music. You may also try an unforgettable dinner at the hotel terrace with glass of wine. I'll definitely stay with Radisson Edwarding Bloomsbury Street next time in London again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and value in central London.”
Reviews.Author: s7reamliner
Reviews.Content: Prior to my recent stay here I typically have staid in Mayfair. This time I wanted something more cost effective while putting me closer to most of the night action in Leister Square, Covent Garden, SoHo, etc. The room was extremely clean and had a very nice bathroom with a great shower. The staff was helpful but to be honest we did not really utilize them. Good value here.

Reviews.Title: “I will defenitely come back!!”
Reviews.Author: ralphicous
Reviews.Content: I arrived in london very late on a sunday. I was suprised on how easy it is to find the hotel. It took me 3 minutes to get to the hotel from Tottenham Court road station. The receptionist was very friendly and corteus. It was very late so i had to order room service and it was amazing how the hotel aims for perfection. The service was very good and the food was very good and well presented. I was greeted by the general manager upon my check out and was asked how my stay was. This is one sort of personal service that i havent seen with other hotels that i have stayed at. Some hotels just dont care and just want your money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: flawless101
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel this weekend. The service you get from this hotel is out of this world. Everyone is just friendly and smiley and make you so welcome. The reception area is well laid out and there always seem to be quite a few people working on reception. The Concierge was a really friendly guy who told us about all the best eating places in the area. The reception are was very clean and tidy. The room we had was wonderful. It was just so clean and really well laid out - the carpet on the floor was really plush and there was loads of room to lay out our stuff. The front of the room looks out onto Bloomsberry St and we could see quite a few cafe bars from our window. Everything in the room looked exquisite. We have stayed in a number of hotels in the UK and Europe, this was by far the best. The bathroom was wall to wall marble, well stocked with towels and lotions and had the most powerful power shower I have used in ages. There was even an ice making machine in the corridor. The mini-bar was well socked and also large enough for us to put our own drinks in. Our room had it's own AC which we could set to whatever temperature we wanted. Even though the hotel was just great, the best thing about this hotel was the location. It was just 5 minutes walk from the centre of Covent Garden with it's vast array of eating places and bars. We didn't get back until late evening after having such a wonderful time. The only down side is that this hotel is very expensive if you book at the last minute with a room costing upto £400 per night. We booked a week in advance and got our room for £202 - we felt that it was worth every penny we paid. In summary, fantastic hotel, magnificent location and genuinely friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “second visit looking forward to our third”
Reviews.Author: s_wright525
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel and we will return again. we have had two fantastic breaks in london at this hotel, the staff are friendly and very helpful. i have read some reviews complaining about the size of the rooms, on this visit the room was smaller than our first visit but in no way felt to small. The beds are comfortable and the rooms well appointed with all we needed. We are looking forward to going back for another visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location if rooms a little small”
Reviews.Author: Welshweekenders
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a short business trip with three colleagues. When I saw my room, which was beautifully furnished, I was struck by the lack of natural light as the window was 'frosted' and wouldn't open for fresh air. However, when I asked to be relocated this was done very smoothly and without fuss. The alternative bedroom was twin so a little bigger but equally nicely furnished. Breakfast in my room the following morning was brilliant, they provided me with soya milk, again with no fuss or question and the fresh fruit, piping hot coffee and genorous portions of scrambled eggs set me up for the day. Noise-wise, this wasn't at all bad (for central London) and I managed to have the window open almost all night. Staff are very professional and, provided I'm not asked to use the airless, lightless room again, I'd definitely stay as this hotel is easily within walking distance of everything you could wish to see for a short break and not too far from tubes etc., if you want to go further afield. As with any establishment, the staff are what can make or break it - in this case they definitely make it. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent quality...at a price”
Reviews.Author: Gillfluff
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Bloomsbury St Hotel, and other Radisson Edwardian hotels, many times over the past 5 years, so I guess that I must find something about them I like! This hotel is wonderfully located, spotlessly clean and the staff very accommodating, but it can be very expensive for the unwary traveller using the smart bar on the ground floor to quench even the slightest thirst. The bedrooms are always neat and beds comfortable, bathrooms really well appointed and everything works. On the downside, they are small, even the upgraded ones and noisy, due to the popularity of the hotel as a venue for corporate gatherings and parties. The nastiest shock, however, occurred many days after checkout when the hotel had still not released the Pre authorised amount on my credit card, despite the fact I paid in full with that card on departure! I am now nervous about staying there again next month, so may well try the Hotel Russell near by, where I stayed many years ago.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality Hotel with an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: LeawoodCouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in early June. The staff receives high marks for check in and check out -- everyone was cheerful & competent. The hotel interior is modern & stylish while the outside is graceful & old with red brick. We chose the hotel based on size (not a mega-hotel), location and price (realizing that there are very few bargains in London!!!). We were not disappointed although one of our rooms (standard double) was quite small. One thing worth noting is that the very modern shower is strangely configured and not fully enclosed so that the bathroom floor gets a little wet (although not a big deal). What is quite nice about the hotel location is that many tourist destinations are easily walkable (e.g. the British Museum is a block away), Soho & Covent Garden are next door, there is good access to the Tube and there are many interesting restaurants nearby (especially those on Charlotte Street). We did not eat in the hotel restaurant because there are many good, inexpensive breakfast options with a block or two and part of the fun of London is exploring the active restaurant scene. This property delivers what it promises -- a modern, stylish hotel with very good service and an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: binkley
Reviews.Content: We were suppose to stay at their sister hotel "Kelinworth" across the street but for some reason they asked if we would stay here. We said sure and were very happy with our choice. Our room was on the second floor, corner w/a bay window with a view of the street. At first with the buses going past I thought "this might not have been such a good idea" but in the evening the bus traffic stopped and we had no problems sleeping. We had room service and sat by the window watching the people, enjoying the beautiful tree right outside the window. The staff were very nice and helpful with breakfast, shipping a box out for us and getting tickets on the Original Bus Tour. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: rovers816
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Easter. The location is good, within easy walk to the London Museum. This is also where you can pick up the Hop on Hop Off bus if you wish to use it. Our superior room was clean and comfortable, with a King size bed and 2 armchairs, small table, flat screen TV, tea and coffee making facilities, minibar and very good air conditioning (it was very hot in London during our stay). My only complaint is the size of the bathroom, absolutely tiny, there is nowhere to put your toiletries and we resorted to opening up the ironing board in the bedroom and using that for storage. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was prlentiful and delicious. Dinner in the restaurant was tasty and reasonably priced for London. Be aware that a 12.5% service charge is automatically added to your bill in London restaurants and cafes and on top of that a space for a tip is also provided. We didn't tip, as the service charge is for the waiting staff and is more than adequate. There are 2 computers near reception for patrons to use free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: pereira_andy
Reviews.Content: My first experience with this hotel started out even prior to checking in, i had to rush to a convention downtown and really didnot have the time to check in.. The concierge Tony smiled comfortably at me and just asked me to leave my bags with him and that they would take care of th rest when i returned.. I had been staying in paddington at another property that left a lot too be desired, so when i returned later that night i wasn't expecting much from London hotels to be honest, but i was pleasant suprised that the rooms were great, spacious.. i had a view of the main road.. It made my night.. The staff Rajni, Greg, Joe were ever so helpful.. I had purchsed a mountain bike that got delivered to the hotel and Greg was ever so helpful in managing that for me.. I think what makes a property worthwhile apart from the Decor is the staff and the folks here were simply great... The location of the hotel is great, just a block away from Tottenham Court Road Station( Underground), which is the begining of Qxford street, so loads of shopping nearby... I'm going to be back in London sometime in July and would defintely plan on staying here again

Reviews.Title: “A good (somewhat pricey) hotel close to both Oxford Street and SoHo.”
Reviews.Author: Redstripe4
Reviews.Content: I actually quite enjoyed being in our room, which says a lot when you're visiting London where the hotels generally has the worst value in the world (there might be some competitors out there) and when the outside offers millions of things to do and see. The "deluxe room",which we booked, was very spacious and clean and we both felt very comfortable there. Starbucks around the corner, as well as Oxford street and you've got SoHo just a few minutes away. So all in all: Location: Superb Room: Great Value: Expensive. You pay through your nose for nice hotels in London. For the amount you're paying for a room here, you can get WAY better rooms in other cities. But that is to be expected in the most awesomest city of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy stylish room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gilead
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my mother to England from New York. It was her first time, and she's 76. The hotel was in a decent neighborhood with several places to eat nearby (for breakfast don't bother with the very expensive hotel restaurant, there are several places to get coffee and a pastry for 3 pounds a block or two away.) The reception staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. The room was cozy, but I didn't have a problem with it. The bathrooms were stylish. I liked the look of the hotel very much. I also liked the free internet in the lobby as well as the free wi-fi. That makes a big difference when the Hitlon is charging 14-15 pounds per day. I would stay here again. It's walking distance to Soho and the theater area, or 1 tube stop away from Tottingham Court Rd.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, if not exceptional, London hotel”
Reviews.Author: TDMSU84
Reviews.Content: We spend three nights at the Bloomsbury in a Deluxe King room. The hotel is very nice and the location is great. The staff is very welcoming and pleasant. Our room faced Bloomsbury street and typically we don't mind street noise. However, on our last night their was an excessive amount of shouting and singing through out the night that was annoying. If you value quite, be sure to request a non-streetview room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EperAgi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend away. The location is perfect, The hotel is clean, immaculate. Nice deco, and very quiet considering that you are in London. Management should think about improving on the room service menu and service availability 24/7. Just small things like: no choice of different pillows, no breakfast menu for room service after 10.30 on Saturday... We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: skajaya
Reviews.Content: Its located right in the city center and accessble to everything in minutes. The service of theHotel is great and they take good care of their Customers. They make the experience beautiful ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel in great central location”
Reviews.Author: Jamesinleeds
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a number of times and on each occassion I've been delighted with my experience. The hotel is modern, well furnished and clean - and whilst some of the bedrooms can be quite small (like most hotel rooms in London), the rooms are well equipped and comfortable. The best part of the experience here though is the level of customer service you receive, especially from the team on reception - they always welcome you back as if you were a friend! Would definitely recommend for a central London stay - either business or leisure

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT HOTEL, NOISY LOCATION, POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: parny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in March 2011. The hotel is clean and well-appointed and is in a good location as its almost next door to the British Museum and about a 10 min walk to Covent garden and a 5 - 10 min walk to the shops on Oxford Street. That said the location can be quite noisy at night with late night revellers and police sirens etc.... Light sleepers beware; ask for a room away from the main Road. Breakfast was included and it was very good, plenty to choose from and pleasant attentive staff. I did however complain to management after our stay as we found a couple of problems with the hotel. The first being a poor turn down service and the second being a missed alarm call. Management responded well and I believe will address the problems. In summary a good hotel but we will probably look for an alternative next time were in London.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOTEL, IN AN IDEAL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Paul503830
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very friendly and extremely helpful on arrival. Room was excellent, great modern decor - particularly liked the shower! Quite ambience, but with a nice atmosphere. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for the Royal Wedding - Central London”
Reviews.Author: Ali B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street for two nights while the Royal wedding was taking place( 28th and 29th April). It was an ideal base to walk to the main tourist stops in central London and about 20 minutes to Buckingham Palace , The Mall, Trafalgar Square , Theatre Land etc. The Hotel is near Tottenham Court Tube and when we arrived I requested a quiet room so the traffic didnt disturb us. Reception said .. no problem" and we were allocate room 6015 on the 6th floor. The room was compact but well furnished with quality walk-in shower room with black marble floors and the bedroom had lovely bedding and was comfortable ( a wall mounted flat screen 32inch TV ) etc it was modern and fresh with good air con and nice fridge and soft towels . An Ice maker in the corridor etc etc. We never heard any noise during our stay and breakfast was included ( and on till 10 each morning) Food was top class with pure fresh squeezed orange juice and self service buffet so both days we had a lovely breakfast and the staff were very efficient and friendly in every department . Well done Bloomsbury Street you made our stay very special and it was overall a fantastic experiance being in London during the Wedding... everywhere was buzzing and the atmosphere great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and hotel, would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Joey1986
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend on Saturday night for my Birthday. What an excellent time we had. We were extremely pleased with the service we received from all staff, especially Luke the Guest Relations Manager who was polite, friendly and seemed to take a real interest in the guests, which is unusual for a large chain of hotels and therefore very welcoming. The breakfast was lovely, room was spacious and clean, great location and service was excellent. I am pleased to say that this hotel exceeded our expectations and well worth the money. Would recommend a stay at this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Sophistication and very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: HLove78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a one night break. The staff were amazing!! They made us feel so welcome. The room was stylish and provided us with a central location. Soho is approx. 10 minutes walk away and the British Museum is just across the road. The nearset tube station is only 5 minutes walk. We really enjoyed our stay and will be staying there again in the future. A particularly special hotel to me as my partner FINALLY asked me to marry him there : ) Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever in London”
Reviews.Author: joby69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my son for a few days over Easter. We had one of the best hotel stays I have ever experienced. Firstly, ALL of the staff were obliging and couldn't do enough to help us and were very friendly and helpful - over and above. The location is superb - 10 minutes walk from Covent Garden, just around the corner from the British Museum. Nearest tubes, both 5 minutes walk away are Tottenham Court Road and Goodge Street. Equally we walked to Euston fgrom there in around 15 minutes. There is a cashpoint opposite the hotel and a newsagents, both very handy. The hotel had a good business centre if you need to use a PC but equally the free wifi was excellent. A real bonus is the Barclays bikes outside the hotel - you can bike around London all day for £1 provided you keep docking the bikes and get a new one - there are so many of these bikes and docking stations around now that you can go around the whole of London for the day for £1. It is far better than going on the Tube and having the docking station outside the hotel makes it a great and convenient way of getting around - London is fairly flat. The hotel is very contemporary and extremely clean. The carpet in the corridors is very deep and spongey which is great to walk down after a hard day. The bedroom was superb - we stayed in a twin room which was extremely spacious and the arm chairs and table were very comfy. The bathroom was very modern and again, squeeky clean. The toiletries are superb. Overall, this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, in London and I would definitely stay again and recommend it to people. My husband also stays here with business on a regular basis and he agrees it is one of his favourite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Best Experiance”
Reviews.Author: SteveHardington
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Absolutley my best experiance in London. This hotel is well located between the 4 cross roads of the Bloomsbury, Soho, CovenGraden, Leicester Sq, Pically, Euston, oxford street just minutes away. The service and staff offer a unique taste of luxury which in unmatched in my years of business travel. Fresh apples (Delicious!! I would love to know which apples they are using) and complimentary water whilest checking in. I was book in a Deluxe room which was a giantly wonderful with sumptuous and comfortable in decor! very comfortable king bed, impeccable cleanliness. We dined in the restaurant and the qualiyu of food was amazing. Though the price was on a higher side, but I guess worth paying for such a quality of delivery. Next day Great breakfast, marvelous choice on offer, staff very attentive and friendly but not overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of issues...”
Reviews.Author: LisaN11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Bloomsbury this past week for 2 nights. From check in to check out, continual issues kept cropping up: 1. my company always negotiates hotel contracts to include breakfast. At check in and 3 additional times during my two night stay, I had to remind the hotel that my breakfast was included. And I pulled out my confirmation to prove it. 2. my reservation specifically notes "do not give a room near elevator". yup, of course after pleasantly settling the breakfast issue, I go to the room and it's smack dab right beside an elevator. 3. They change me to another room - great. I open the closet and the door comes off it's track. I report it. it's fixed while I'm out. 4. next morning I'm getting ready for the day and in bathroom, pull the small wall-hung make-up mirrout out from the wall . It breaks off the wall. It's fixed while I'm out. 5. check out - they'd included the 2 breakfasts on my bill. Reminded them again that breakfast should be included. They claimed their system didn't have current up to date info on my company. Though the location is good, I'd hesitate to stay at this hotel again. All in all, a frustrating experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: DonFinlayson
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults) shared a queen bed "superior room" for 7 nights. This hotel is in an excellent location for sightseeing. It is very close to the British Museum and a short walk from the Tottenham Court Road tube station. Soho is also within a short walk, giving easy access to restaurants, shopping and the theatre district. Overall the hotel is modern, clean and stylishly decorated. Our room was small (to be expected in London) but very clean, and the bathroom was sparkling, modern, and larger than expected. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant included with the room. The standard of food and service at breakfast was excellent, and the staff in charge of the breakfast room deserve particular thanks for making our stay a pleasant one. The free wireless internet worked well. Overall, this is a comfortable hotel offering good value for money and an excellent location. I would stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: howling_bibe
Reviews.Content: We were not originally booked into this hotel. We had booked into another Radisson and on arrival discovered that it was closed for renovation. We proceeded to this Radisson Hotel as it was the same chain. The staff here were unbelievably helpful and apologetic towards us. We were given a room straight away. This hotel is in a great location, Tottenham Court Rd tube station is very near, buses to most areas of London are available around the corner and it is within easy walking distance of the main tourist areas for those who like to use their feet. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms are the same. The callibre of the staff is on a par with many of the 5* hotels we have stayed in world wide. Nothing was too much to ask and all of them were friendly and helpful, it was a pleasure to deal with them. A special mention for Joseph Mugabo, Luke Francois and Darius ( unfortunately we don't have his surname) for their outstanding service and for turning what could have been a bad experience, (due to the first hotel being closed) into a really fantastic stay. We wil definately recommend this hotel to our friends and have already booked it again for ourselves in October. Unknowingly, this hotel has got two new customers that travel to London at least twice a year and an extended family who do the same.

Reviews.Title: “A curious place”
Reviews.Author: LambkinBern
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times in the last three months, and find it a curious place. First impressions of the lobby is that this is a cool hotel, which pumping music. It's OK I suppose. The reception staff are always remarkably helpful. However, on each occasion I have stayed here I have had really quite small, poor rooms - our should I say broom cupboards. Also breakfast doesn't start until 0700, which is really poor for anyone who has early meetings or travel plans. So, I will go back but I don't really look forward to the next time

Reviews.Title: “My London residence, excellence all over!”
Reviews.Author: DrRoosterJim
Reviews.Content: I started using the Radisson Bloomsbury about 2 years ago, now I won't stay anywhere else in London. It's very well appointed, all the rooms I've stayed in (from the gold suite after my wedding, vv nice, king deluxe, twins to a basic room) are excellent. Stylish, clean, well equipped and modern. Nothing is too much trouble for front of house, helping with my stays, bookings around town, onward bookings, travel etc. Excellent cocktail bar, well stocked with knowledgable and friendly staff. Same story in the restaurant, fantastic food, superlative service. Altogether makes it worth travelling into town!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Minicooperess
Reviews.Content: My husband and i came to see a show and stayed at The Raddison Edwardian for one night, we turned up a little early as we had got a little lost finding The Hotel but they got the room ready while we went for a walk, and took our bag which was appreciated as it was too heavy to drag around with us. the staff were very friendly and welcoming. We found the room to be lovely and clean and bright, bed was comfy and to have tea/coffee in the room was appreciated too! The bathroom was very clean, good shower and good quality soap etc which was the best we have ever had in a Hotel, so all in all a very enjoyable stay, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very smart hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BillyBear01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found the hotel to be of a high standard with excellent quality decor, cleanliness, service and superb quality food. The only slight problems we had were that the hairdryer did not work and the room was a little noisy during the first night - we guess due to air con/water/heating systems - but was fine the second night. Also, charging over £15 for two drinks at the hotel bar seemed expensive even by London standards. Overall an excellent hotel in a great location for easy access to central london sights/attractions.

Reviews.Title: “4 star Hotel with a 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: LiliSantos
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding reception at the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street on the 19/03/11.The Hotel has a great location with easy access to transport and a walking distance from Oxford street and Leicester square.Me and my wedding guests all agree the proffessional approach of the staff helped make my Wedding day perfect. Celeste and Kunal who helped my event run smoothly and ensured my guests always had their glass full,Luke who ensured we had a beautiful,spacious room and made all our guests feel welcome with a friendly smile and helpfull attitude and Jinal who offered a friendly , fast, stress free check-out . An overall amazing experience made possible by the efforts of a dedicated team at a beautiful,stylish Hotel. Thank you for making my day Perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “London laid back vacation”
Reviews.Author: Grandmawdotter
Reviews.Content: Perfect service at the bar and at check in desk. Especially Annie was a extra +. - Only one kind of cider at the bar. - On the internet site I wasn't able to book two different rooms like one with king size and one with single bed (perhaps you don't have single beds) - Little bit to loud music in the bar Otherwise everything was as we expected and better.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: amidtun
Reviews.Content: I have twice stayed at the neighbour hotel belonging to same group, and have been satisfied with my stays at Radisson Edvardian Kenilworth. This time I decided to try Bloomsbury Street, and I did not regret. Nice room with good bathroom, and excellent service everywhere. Had a good breakfast both mornings, and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Good location”
Reviews.Author: ajhaeh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well placed for all the amenities as previous correspondents have reported. The rooms could be bigger, but as stated... this is London. The rooms were spotlessly clean, well serviced... bathroom the same. Coffee and tea making facilities in each room, flat screen TV, room safe, mini bar and hair dryer. The hotel is very modern and the breakfast buffet is a little pricey at £21.... but good. Staff were polite, friendly and efficient. Would I stay here again... yes. Would I recommend the hotel to friends and family... of course....

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: polly45
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time last weekend for 2 nights we had previously stayed over the road at the Kenilworth but got a reasonable deal for here. The hotel in just a block away from the British Museum and covent garden, soho are all walkable from here. We were asked if we wanted a low or high room so opted for the high 6015, it was nicely appointed, warm, tea and coffee tray no biscuits, lovely warm dressing gowns and a lovely shower room with a window so natural light....bed was really comfy every where was clean only drawback was there were only 2 small drawers plus the wardrobe ok for us but not if you were staying for a while. Lifts were operated with the key card you get for the room they were also well kept. Breakfast was really nice, well stocked cooked breakfast, tea/coffee brought on request , though you make your own toast here it was very nice. Staff asked if we had been here before and went on to explain the layout etc very helpful. The bar is quite expensive we paid £7.50 for two pints of carling and if you do not ask for the service charge to be removed it will cost another 94 pence so be warned... Only downside for us was we were out all day and on our return at 5 o clock our room had not been service so we went to reception who said they would get right on to it I said we would be just on the settee near the entrance and we were still there after almost 1 hour so I went and asked if room was done the staff telephoned and said it was ready.... no apology was made, I thought a complimentary coffee while we waited would have been a nice gesture. Overall a nice stay and I will return if I get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, centrally based”
Reviews.Author: aremjay51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Radisson twice now. Once on our wedding anniversary, which gained us a free room upgrade, and the second time for a Spring break this year. The hotel is a very friendly, beautiful, modern, and comfortable one. The staff have been very polite and helpful in all areas of the hotel. The upgrade room was a 'Queen' room, very spacious, airy and light. The en suite bath and shower room was enormous. If it had been fitted with a bed would have been the same size as the standard room for our second stay. The standard room was small, but again, comfortable and light with a small ensuite shower room only. We drank at the bar and ate in the restaurant during both our stays. The cost of doing so reflects the standard of the hotel. It is not for a cheap stay! If you can find this hotel on offer for rare occasions to meet a lower budget then you'll blow it eating and drinking here. We spent over £200 on a meal and drinks for 4. Having said that the food, service and ambience was well worth the expense, hence our second visit. The hotel is really very central to most of London's attractions. We tend to walk when we visit cities and this hotel's position makes this possible even in London. The West End, Soho, Covent Garden, Trafalgar Square, Leicester Square, Piccadilly Circus are all within a easy walk. London Transport is available on the same block - a 5 minute walk. There are many eateries close to the hotel for those who wish to stretch the cost of their stay. With breakfast at £17.50 at the hotel we found a local cafe opposite which served a full english for £5.95. I feel we will continue to return here, despite being retired and not on a very high income. It is well worth spending the year's savings especially for those special occasions. This hotel would be well worth a stay, even just the once. Highly recommended (We are definitely returning, when our savings pot fills back up)

Reviews.Title: “It could be a 5, but it's not quite there . . .”
Reviews.Author: Illinioisian
Reviews.Content: Positives: +Great location, in the middle of everything--walking distance to the British Museum, the Charing Cross Road bookshops, etc. +Helpful, enthusiastic staff throughout--front desk, dining room bar, etc. +Good food for a London hotel restaurant--best ribeye I've had in the UK during the last year +Attractive public areas in the hotel--some fairly decent art Negatives -Nano-sized room--okay, it's London, but only one foot (that's right, 12 inches) from the end of the bed to the wall? Bring shin guards with you! -Flashy/cheesy room furnishings An all-acrylic chair (the only one in the room)? A television so large in a tiny room that it perches on the wardrobe like a vulture? Dear Radisson chain: I know you are trying to appeal to the targeted younger demographic, but also recognize that their taste isn't the same as the demographic that currently pays your bills. -Unauthorized bill add-ons: £2 per day for a newspaper, £1 for some children's fund. Certainly not the practice of a 5-rated hotel. Bottom Line: I would stay again, but would ask to see the room on arrival to make sure it's larger than a breadbox.

Reviews.Title: “No doubt! - A great choice in London”
Reviews.Author: Harald035
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of the vast number of great reviews on this ( and other) site(s). I was not let down in any way. But first, the room sizes. I can see that some people would be dissapointed with the room size. They are generally small, especially if you choose the Standard rooms. But then again, London hotel rooms are rarely very big. Sp if you need a room for sleep, they will absolutely suffice. The rooms are clean and newly refusbished. The staff are attentive and friendly. The service is fast and of high quality. The breakfast is very good. I stayed for 6 nights and didnt encounter any major problems. The few situations that did occur was resolved quickly by the staff and with a smile. The location is brilliant! I will absolutely return to this hotel next time Im in London

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: fetty
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights 11th-13th March + points Attentive staff Fabulous breakfast Spacious room Modern clean decor Large dressing area Huge queen size bed Great location for Central line/Northern line (Tottenham Court Road) and Piccadilly line (Holborn) for the underground straight to Heathrow - points We only stayed for 2 nights

Reviews.Title: “okay location, good service”
Reviews.Author: vineetjain1973
Reviews.Content: Was there in July 2010 with wife and small kid. The hotel is very close to central london covent, leicester (the most happening) areas. Almost 5-10 minutes walking distance from here. Lotsa restaurants in those areas. The breakfast in the hotel is good and service very good too. The concierge are one of the best i've seen and assisit you in bookings, eating out, any info! Really the best! You will enjoy london much more with such help!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Londonhans
Reviews.Content: Very good location, just 4 minutes away from the underground, walk away from soho!, coven garden. Very helpful staff from the minute you walk in to the hotel. Sahil in reception very helpful. Evening the hotel creates an atmosphere by deeming the lights with various staff welcoming people back to the hotel, the bar starts buzzing with low lights, candles and high mucis. Conference facilities are very good, the room we were in had natural day light, light was server in the restaurant overseeing Bloomsbury street, service overall was great. Well done and I would 110% recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelOak
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference at the Radisson Bloomsbury Street Hotel, overall great experience and encountered very friendly staff. Room allocation offered was good size with King Size bed and very comfortable mattress, evening standard in room daily was appriciated, breakfast had very good selection and reception staffs were very prompt. Ps: Apples at reception a nice touch! as a suggestion water on arrival will be something for the management to look at.

Reviews.Title: “ok but beware the breakfast check in”
Reviews.Author: ellucy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times in the last year.Good location,generally helpful staff and good facilities. However watch out for breakfast. Have observed on both occasions guests beiing given the third degree when arriving for breakfast as to whether they have prepaid for breakfast. Whilst this is important to establish for the hotel the guests were publicly humiliated in effect quite unnecessarsarily. I think the source of the problem really lies with reception who do not clearly establish whether breakfast is included at the time of check in. On my last visit I hd booked room with breakfast and had my print out to prove it . However it was only when I went through my booking with the receptionist that I realised that she was checking me in without indicating breakfast was included. If I had not done checked this I would have caught the bad side of the tough little cookie running the breakfast operation. That said the hotel ticks most boxes.

Reviews.Title: “not enough to make me come back”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_traveller_Nick
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as it was a stone's throw away from my new office. BUT - i think i will stick with Lancaster where they provide 5 star service at 4 star prices. The bathroom floors were very cold (no underfloor heating) - no slippers. It was literally uncomfortable to be in the bathroom. On the plus side the bathrooms are very roomy and well designed. The hotel lobby is very nice, the rooms are adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Typical London Prices, but good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: JDE260767
Reviews.Content: Efficient check in, good clean room and good restaurant food. Very good service - helpful and friendly - from all staff from check-in, to breakfast waiters. Typical London hotel in that rooms are smaller than rest of world and also quite expensive, but a good place to spend a weekend in London!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience, a true home away from home! Thank you Bloomsbury Street Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlanMadrid
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the hotel, It was an amazing experience and a place I would call home away from home. The hotel is located in an excellent location, tottenham court road station was just 3 minutes walk, and soho just 10 minutes away. The staff are so upbeat and welcoming, you always find people ready to help and in the lobby with big smiles I remember speaking to Darius. We had Dinner in the restaurant, the food was amazing, the bar after 6:30pm become live and music, very good cocktails, ted expensive, but well worth it. Breakfast was always good and plenty to choose from. The room presentation was excellent, very well kept and spotless and the added luxury was the daily turndown service. The Hotel also have wifi around the hotel and its FREE!!! What makes this a truly special hotel is the staff, they are so friendly but not overpowering. Nothing is too much trouble for them. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and work colleagues. Thank you to all the staff of this hotel for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: joanoArmagh
Reviews.Content: Returned for a one night stay with my husband. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a suie to compensate for a disappointing experience on a previous visit and we were not disappointed. On this occasion we enjoyed a very different experience. Check in was fast, efficient and welcoming. Our suite was fabulous and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in these luxurious surroundings. Service at breakfast was excellent. (KC in particular) Despite being extremely busy ,staff coped well and were pleasant and efficient. We had lunch and bar food in the evening in the hotel which was a very good standard. The location of the hotel is very central and convenient to Covent Garden and theatres. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great service”
Reviews.Author: mtjersey
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with a great location. I would definitely stay here again but next time would ask if there were any rooms at the rear of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and modern hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Moderntraveller
Reviews.Content: Lovely. clean, very modern hotel in perfect location for theatres, tube station and Covent Garden. Excellent food and very friendly and helpful staff. Bar drinks very pricey. Extremely comfortable bed and very quiet room, as requested. Standard room booked through Superbreaks is very small. Only just about adequate. It was a good job that we only had hand luggage with us or we would have been tripping over suitcases. I am not sure that the best use is made of the small wardrobe space by having an iron, ironing board and trouser press in there. There would have been no room to erect the ironing board if we had wanted to use it anyway! The bathroom was a reasonable size and very modern with a polished granite floor, which of course is very hygenic and easy to keep clean. However, I do think that a towelling bath mat should be provided as a)the floor is very cold to stand on and b)a wet floor can be slippery and cause accidents. We did not like the opaque glass door separating the bedroom and bathroom as if one has to visit the bathroom in the night, whenever the bathroom light is turned on it floods the bedroom with light and disturbs the person sleeping in the bed. Maybe either a roller blind on the bathroom side of the door or a small night light in an unobtrusive place in the bathroom would be helpful. Also the frosted external window in the bathroom is not frosted enough to leave the blind open when the bathroom light is on. Very good size flatscreen TV on wall but would have liked sports channels to be available as well. The room keycards really do need sorting out. We kept our keycards completely separate from our mobile phones and credit cards but every day for 3 days when we returned to the hotel in the evening our cards would not work and we had to return to reception to have new ones done. The receptionist suggested that the alarm mechanisms in the shops demagnetised them but we have stayed in hotels all over the world that have these cards and have never had this trouble before. Would definitely stay here again. Much better than any other London hotel we have stayed in previously. I know that room size is always a problem in London and this hotel is no different to any other in that respect. The free wi-fi in the rooms was greatly appreciated.The small newsagents shop opposite the hotel entrance in Bloomsbury Street is a very good place to buy and top up the Oyster cards for travel around London.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms...but rather noisy!”
Reviews.Author: msra8kc4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street Hotel for 1 night on 26th January 2011. Check-in was extremely fast and the lady who dealt with this was efficient, friendly and informed me that my room had been upgraded. Staff were waiting in the wings to carry my luggage up to the room, which I declined, as I was only carrying a small case. As other reviewers have mentioned - I disliked the way that the lifts functioned. Having to put your key into the lift in order to operate it was slightly confusing with no prior explanation, but this was solved swiftly by a member of staff. Upon arrival in the room, it was clean and had everything that I needed - a comfy bed, a big tv and a beautiful bathroom. The bedside light didn't work, but this wasn't really an issue. The room was air conditioned - not necessary for January weather, but a plus if you stay at this hotel during the summer. The bathroom was lovely and pristine, although if I had been staying for longer, I would have expected there to be extra bathroom provisions such as nail files etc. However, all in all, the room had everything that I needed and was decorated to a high standard. The only problem that I had was that the rooms are not insulated well in terms of being sound-proof. I found it difficult to fall asleep because I could hear people walking down the corridor outside and people who were talking on their way to their rooms sounded as though they were actually inside my room! The redeeming factor is that the people that stayed on my floor on this occasion were not too noisy, but this could be a problem perhaps on a weekend, when there are less business guests staying in the hotel. The hotel is very central and close to many lovely restaurants and within walking distance to most tourist locations. Check-out was swift and the hotel stored my bags safely until I had finished my assessment day at 5pm that evening. Definitely not the cheapest hotel at £195 a pop, but I do believe that if you book in advance, you can get some good deals!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsGNewcastle
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely modern hotel in a great location for exploring covent garden, leicester square, Theatreland etc with lots of lovely bars and restaurants on your doorstep. Staff are very helpful, friendly and efficient. The hotel has all of he amenities you would expect from a Radisson, the rooms are lovely but as many have said the standard rooms are small to if longer than a one night stay I would definitely go for the bigger room. The bathrooms are really good and well equipped. We would stay here again and definitely recommend it to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Luxury weekend treat for my mum and me!”
Reviews.Author: kirstyjenkinson284
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because I wanted to treat my mum to a special weekend away. I'd booked theatre tickets and this hotel was less than 5 minutes walk away. My mum was blown away with the quality and service we received at the hotel. We did have a problem with our shower not draining properly but we reported it to reception and whilst we had breakfast someone went to our room and fixed it. Speaking of breakfast, the choice was amazing and there was plenty to eat. I loved the option of pancakes with maple syrup especially as they were cooked in a different style each day. There was a bus stop straight outside and the tube station was just round the corner. I couldn't have asked for better, and it was worth the money we paid!

Reviews.Title: “looks great doesn't work”
Reviews.Author: jonnybluejeans
Reviews.Content: the reception looks cool and the reception staff can't do enough to get you checked in ASAP, the problem starts when they give you your key card that works the lift and you room door, (not) apparently if you store it with your mobile phone or Ipod it gets striped of the data it needs to work doors and lifts or either one or the other. They didn't tell me this till I had got to the 8th floor and couldn't get into the room, I also couldn't get the lift down to the lobby as the card wouldn't work this either, so had to run down 8 flights of stairs. Not a good start. When I finally got in the room I thought it was a bit bland on decoration and very cold. The aircon I failed with completely and spent the night freezing to death. The lighting whilst moody is far to dark to enable you to work and also very finicky to work. (you have to switch on the first switch at the door to work everything else in the room) The staff at breakfast appeared far to busy to attend to us even though there was very few people there, some people always have something else to do first I guess! Overall not good and I will be going back to the Covent Garden Hotel. They treat you like you matter there.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: Hilly1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for 2 nights. On arrival (which was 2 hrs earlier than the check in time) we were given our room cards. On entering the room (1007) i found it to be very dark and unwelcoming. There was one small window blocked by what looked like a large fridge, on closer inspection i found it to house the mini bar and tea/coffee making facilities. When i eventually opened the window (which you could only do a little) i discovered outside the air conditioning for the hotel not a pretty sight. The room was very dark and you needed to use the light at all times. i immediately went to reception and explained to the receptionist that i was unhappy with the room we had been allocated. The reception (without hesitation) offered me another room on the 5th floor. Room 5006 was lovely, very spacious, comfortable bed, good sized bathroom. We had arranged to have breakfast at the hotel which i have to say on both days was excellent, plenty of choice and the scrambled egg was just how i like it. All in all our stay at the Radisson was first class. All the staff were very attentive and very friendly. The location of the hotel is excellent if you want to be near all the sights/theatres. We would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the cost!”
Reviews.Author: UKTraveller1991
Reviews.Content: We came to stay here after a week skiing in Bulgaria and wanted a place to rest. Upon check-in we were upgraded at no cost, and my girlfriend was also given a complementary (and very tasty!) Easter Egg due to the time of year. This was because we booked online, so it may be worth keeping an eye on the website for any special offers that are available. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful, giving us directions, hints etc on where we could get various needed things. We both slept like babies, the bed was just right. Breakfast the next morning.. The gentleman who bought it in was well built and it looked like he was struggling. It took us a good half an hour of constant eating to devour the breakfast - well worth every penny extra that I paid for it. In short, go. Great location, 2min walk from a Tube station, and a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: mfwalshy
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for a weekend and had a wonderful stay here. We took the Junior Deluxe Suite so our expectations were high - and they were more well exceeded. The room was very big (in fact 2 rooms - lounge with a 1 metre flatscreen, sofa, armchairs and office and bedroom with another large tv and a wonderful deep bath in the middle of the room! There was also a separate bathroom). The staff were very friendly and helpful, a warm welcome, quick and friendly room service (and great food!) and it is also situated less than 5 minutes from the Britsh Museum and tube stations. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, stylish. Great Location."”
Reviews.Author: retb1980
Reviews.Content: Easy to reach by the Tube, friendly, responsive staff. Clean, modern amenities. Great shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: KevinScheppach
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay in England. Very clean and friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: gisela012
Reviews.Content: Had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel. Rooms very clean and had a spacious bathroom with large shower. Bar staff, reception and concierge very helpful and friendly. I am going to re book for my visit to London in February.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel I have ever had the pleasure of staying in.”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Woohoo
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel at the end of January on a weekend theatre break, and were not disappointed. The greeting on reception was warm and friendly, and Annie seemed genuinely interested in the purpose of our visit, discussing the show we were going to see. We were especially impressed with the various works of art on display on and around reception, which provided a talking point when waiting in the foyer for others to join us! The room was immaculate, with lovely thick carpets and warm, comfortable bedding. Hopefully we will have the opportunity to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to fault unless you are really picky”
Reviews.Author: glasssol
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay at the Radisson Bloomsbury Street as an escape form our children, a rare and enjoyable break which was enhanced by the largely friendly and helpful staff at the hotel. As it was just a short break we decided to treat ourselves to one of the few suites that they have at the hotel. It was nicely furnished with most things that you would generally expect. A CD player or IPod dock would have been a worthwhile extra and not really too much to ask for their top rooms. The suites are located on the corner of the “L” shaped hotel with curving windows giving a pleasant view of the streets and rooftops. With the exception of the odd emergency siren the double glassing kept the street sounds down to an acceptable level. The highlight of the room is the free standing bath in the bedroom which certainly helped us get the most out of our few precious hours of relaxation. The main bathroom is compact but features a large walk in shower with a range of jets We booked direct via their website a chose a package which included some added extras, most of the staff didn’t seem too familiar with this offer but it didn’t any great problems. Part of the deal included afternoon tea which they kindly served for us in our lounge. Another added bonus was a late check out until 4:00PM which for us trying to make the most of our time was a very useful add-on. The hairdryer broke while we were there, a replacement was with us in less than 10 minutes and front desk called back again after about 20 minute to check that it had arrived. It is what you would expect from a hotel of the calibre but you don’t always get it so worth a mention. Location – for us it was perfect. About 5 minute walk to Tottenham Court Road tube, and 7-8 for Holborn and Covent Garden. The taxi back to Kings Cross Station came to £8.00 which is about the same a two single trip tickets on the tube. I am sure you could find minor things to complain about if you really wanted to but we were very satisfied with the hotel and it’s staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel..good location :)”
Reviews.Author: skitszo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to combine a birthday trip to the theartre with some xmas shopping.. Firstly we arrived very early in the morning , so reception kindly kept our luggage and we started our shopping early :) When we got our room, we weren't dissapointed...what i did notice was that outside a room next door there was a tray left with left over room service on it..which was still there the morning we left even though the rooms were made up every morning, no one lifted this tray, ??? Strange.. but aside from that we had a fabulous time in london in this hotel.never used the restaurant but made good use of the bar ..bar tender was rather slow to take orders and being a publican myself this realy grated on me..over all i did enjoy my stay, going back to london in february for another b/day celebration but staying i leicester square this time...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay If In London”
Reviews.Author: Andy1226793
Reviews.Content: Very smart Hotel with a great location for staying in central London. Very clean and tidy, helpful staff( Tony the car valet is a cool guy) with perhaps THEE most comfortable bed i have ever slept in!!. Didn't sample the food so can't comment on the cuisine. All in all, a very enjoyable stay, a little pricey, but in central London, guess thats not a suprise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Tiggers-bounce
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone. It's location is brilliant, 2 mins from British Museum, 5 mins from covent garden and about 10 mins to Regent Street. You don't really have to take the tube at all. To get a taxi from any of the North London Stations (euston etc) costs about £7, which is more than reasonable if you've just got off a train with multiple suitcases! The hotel is clean and the staff are warm and friendly (obviously well trained!). The rooms are spotless and the carpets are so thick you just can't wait to get your shoes off!. Beds comfortable and had a better nights sleep there than I do at home (mind you the cocktails may have helped somewhat!). All in all, very happy and will be returning again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sven_Brussels
Reviews.Content: When i come to London, i stay in this hotel. The rooms are just great, nice furniture,clean,with a comfortable bed. The bar is fantastic to have a pre-dinner drink, or to entertain friends. The location is perfect for shopping, cultural visits, or nightlife. Once you enter the lobby, you are welcomed by the staff, and you feel to be home. Next time i come to London, i book here again. Sven

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: petefin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on super break deal and was very pleased with all aspects of our experience! Slightly bad breakfast on first morning with unprepared table and long wait to get hot milk for our coffee but food was very good tho i dont know if it was worth £21!!!! Much better table and service next day. Room not big but very well presented with beautifull bathroom,underfloor heating would have finished it off perfectly. Had dinner before our show on the 2for 1 deal and could not believe the quality of the food we had! Highly recommended! Would stay here again the next time we come to London. Peter

Reviews.Title: “First UK trip a success”
Reviews.Author: WGS534
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research in order to pick a hotel that met my needs for my first trip to London - proximity to museums/cultural sites/the theatres etc, reviews from others, price, size, etc This hotel became my choice - of which I am very pleased - the room was as large as many I have stayed at here in NA (contrary to the 'too small" mantra I saw over and over in hotel reviews about rooms in London) The location turned out to be perfect for my needs - I walked everywhere for 2 weeks from this hotel (mind you I like walking!) - it was literally a block from the British Museum and only a few minutes - 5-15 from most theatres and hundreds of restaurants and shops and places like Leicester Square and Covent Market Garden etc - I was actually very surprised at how close even after my research The staff were all pleasant from start to finish - the room was cleaned and tidy - was surprised at the heated towel racks :) The shower/tub was nice but different than what is found here in NA but easy enough to get used to - the only off putting thing was the height of tub from floor - I expect that someone less limber might find it a challenge. I was a bit dismayed at the poor TV channel choices (not hotels issue really but certainly a bit of a change from basic TV offerings here) -really only 4-5 channels - mind you I found some interesting viewing :) Elevator was quite chatty - was always talking to occupants - mind the door - floor xx and so on..could hear it easily if you stood in elevator lobby :) hotel bar/restaurant seemed to always be busy and noisy in the evenings - nice enough place - cant speak to food as I never ate there (was out and about trying all sorts of the multitude of restaurants in the area) -Otherwise the place was quiet including in my room The fitness room was well equipped and well maintained - however (and this is my only complaint of entire hotel experience) the TV’s built into every machine could only be heard if you had a set of earplugs from an Ipod or similar - I didn’t know this first day and had to work out in silence - when I did bring my own I found it clumsy to wear them plugged into the machines - this ,off hand, seems a good idea as you don’t disturb others (on the other hand in 2 weeks I only ever shared the room twice) - eventually my ear plugs died - maybe from excess sweat and I was back to silence - and then the recumbent bike started acting up - after some use it would zoom up to maximum tension and refuse to be lowered - had to stop using it as it happened every time. Unfortunately I did not report it at the time as by the time I cleaned up afterwards in my room and left the hotel I had forgotten in my excitement to get going on my days adventure It wasn’t a cheap hotel but not the most expensive I have ever used however I knew this when I booked it because everything else met my needs in the planning stage and worked out as hoped in actuality. I stayed for 14 days during some unexpectedly pleasant October weather - balmy days - felt like May or early June here in Toronto I highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel with friendly staff but rowdy patrons”
Reviews.Author: Sarcastic_Travel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Radisson twice now within a couple of months. The staff are very friendly and the location is decent. You are not directly near a tube station, but Tottenham and Holborn are within a short walk's distance. There are plenty of convenience stores and food within easy walking distance and the British Museum is only a couple of minutes away by foot. However, both times I've stayed here I've had trouble with other patrons. The first time the person in the room next to me would start smoking every night about 1am. Because there was a connecting door, my room filled with smoke and woke me up. When I called the front desk, nothing was done about it. I was told the second time that they could not ring the bell of the room due to the late hour. Both times rowdy patrons have also been a problem: yelling in the hallways late at night, loud parties. This trip when I called the front desk, these issues were addressed. To follow-up on the smoking issue: I completed their customer survey after my trip and received an email from the hotel manager saying he had spoken to the staff involved and hoped I would give the hotel another chance. This is the first time a hotel has responded directly to a survey and I thought this was an excellent example of customer service. I was planning another trip to London, and did reserve at the Radisson. I requested a room without a connecting door and had a better experience, minus the loud patrons a couple of nights on my floor. The rooms are nice, standard size rooms for Europe, fairly well organized and provisioned. My only major complaint is that all the lighting is overhead and very harsh, making reading laptop screens difficult due to the glare.

Reviews.Title: “great value - great service and staff - great facilities -”
Reviews.Author: dalllo
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a stay for the holidays at the Edwardian on bloomsbury street - from dec. 26 to jan 2nd - The hotel looks great modern and cool - the service and staff was above average- this is a fantastic value - Rajni was especially kind to us- on new year eve we decided to stay in for a little champagne and foie gras in our room they provided us with everything we needed with a smile- They have a great breakfast with fresh fruit - specialty coffees no charge - don't miss it - we do travel a lot and are very critical with hotels - this one is a keeper - can't wait ot go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aspegren
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay. Nice, quiet hotel with helpful staff and good service. Very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clockend71
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here quite a few times when on business in London. the rooms are clean, spacious and modern. The staff a friendly and helpful and it is good value for money, when so many other London hotels aren't!

Reviews.Title: “"Should be Five Stars"”
Reviews.Author: arundelmews
Reviews.Content: We have just spent two nights at this Hotel, New Years Eve & Day. We were not expecting too much as it was a last minute booking, and we usually go for a 5 star Hotel. We checked in early and we were greeted by really friendly staff, Always a good start to any break. After a day of Shopping and what a great position, went to our room, We were not disappointed. Tea & coffee facilities. everything in this Hotel has really been thought through to make one stay Perfect... Dressing Gowns, slipper's and a well supplied Bathroom.. Fautless... The hotel was dressed Beautifly for Christmas. And after a Wonderfull New Years Eve in town, Great to be able to come back to a relaxing Bar. Breakfast did not disappoint. The only thing that let that down were the quality of the sausages,Which is no big deal considering the choice on offer. There are somethings that happen in life which are a joy from start to finish, And this was one of those times. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: youngmarrieds112
Reviews.Content: The staff from the concierge to housekeeping were efficient and friendly. The room/bathroom was spotless and modern, and comfortable, and the delicious breakfast was relaxing. The whole package is slick and good-looking.Any noise creeping in through the windows or door was unobtrusive, but sensitive sleepers may be disturbed by sounds from outside and in the corridor, especially if you have noisy neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, worth a stay.”
Reviews.Author: joff16v
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last night just for one night Very nice place, just been refurbised Rooms are a nice size and have everything you would need Staff are very friendly and pleasent Good location, walking distance to covent garden / leicester square and only 2 mins from tube Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely time at the Bloomsbury!!”
Reviews.Author: lucynics
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night while we celebrating my husbands birthday at a show. I had previously spoken to the guest relations manager and he had been so helpful with my arrangments. Upon arrival we were given a complimentry upgrade to a king room which was very nice indeed. They are not huge rooms, but big enough not to feel cramped. Our room over looked the main road, so it was very noisy all night with people shouting and talking, bin lorrys and sirens, but thats London not everyone is in bed and quite for midnight. We had our breakfast delivered to our room in the morning which was lovely, we were brought a full english, toast, breakfast cakes and fruit salad also coffee and juice. There is a charge of £1.50 for this but its lovely to have it in your room so you dont need to get dressed before you eat. We were also brought a bottle of red wine, strawberrys and chocolates as a treat for my husbands birthday, which we both thought was just so lovely. The location of the hotel is great, we went to the Lyric theatre and it was a 10 minute stroll and we had a meal in a restaurant on route. Overall i would highly reccomend this hotel if you want a nice stay in London and you want to be near the theatres.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic service and typically overpriced like all london hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Economist_Reader
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the radisson on bloomsbury street on my visit to london for the world travel market.There are a couple of points i would like to bring up which i think was so not required to be done by the hotel staff. 1.when i was checking out i had spoken to the staff the night before and fixed a cab fare to my next destination,to my surprise they quoted a 10 pounds higher fare the next day when i was checking out,when i argued with them they agreed on the 55 pounds that they had qouted the night before.The third party that provides them taxis is obviously trying to make an extra buck which i thought is so uncool. 2.i stayed there for five nights in all, three nights later i get a letter from their manager stating that they would like to debit my credit card with a sum of 1000 pounds,when i asked them why they said thats because we wouldnt want to charge you a full 1300 pounds at one go so its better that we take 75% of your payment in the middle of your stay.I thought that is rediculous considering that the hotel had verified my amex corporate card they were still thinking that i may not be able to pay or probably run away without paying.I think that is so disrespecting the customers who stay at a hotel. 3.The service was very average for the price i was being charged it was 175 pounds per night plus VAT...honestly i should have rented an apartment at half the cost i would have been happier. 4.The round the clock menu is so basic and overpriced that i would rather step out in the cold and get something to eat from a tesco or any other sandwhich shop.I have written to the manager and explained to him that considering you get travellers from around the world to stay at your hotel it would be better if you could have a slightly more elaborate menu for cater to all taste buds and he agreed that he would do something. 5.there were days when my room was left undone even though i had hung the card to clean the room. Overall not happy for the price you pay to stay here.I would never ever stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant place, centrally situated with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Penny969
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely and centrally situated. Nice and relaxed atmosphere. Staff was friendly and welcoming and breakfast was very good with good quality food. Our deluxe room was very good although a little small, we would have liked a bigger one. The bathroom is nice and spacious but the shower head is fixed. The hotel was great for accessing places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, refurbished Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JPiworld
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in perfect condition! I believe it has been recently refurbished. I stayed here for three nights in a King Deluxe room, the bathroom was very large, although I found the room size to be a bit small. The breakfast buffet downstairs, was very good also! Its located in the west end close to some theatres and many restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant”
Reviews.Author: 297654Princess
Reviews.Content: location excellent from shopping area luxury stores ,hotel pretty good helpful staff. 2 minutes walking indian restaurant very good clean!!. breakfast spred was good and staff very well mannered.majorly only one problem no parking near the hotel. guest supplies nothing top of the line but surely good. only one restaurant not offering much for meals but you are walking distance so its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend break”
Reviews.Author: NCarlton
Reviews.Content: Looked for a nice hotel close to Theatre land and this came up on Trip adviser, It looked a bit expensive to start with, but when you looked at other options in the area is was not that much different. We arrived and the Service and attention we recieved was second to non and the room standard was excellent. We went for the Breakfast option, and it was another good choice, the selection and amount was faultless, an it kept us going for most of the day. Overall excellent location 5-10 walk minutes from most theatres, attentive, very freindly staff, spotless room, and the food was great.. So overall one of the most pleasant stays I have had in a hotel in the last 12 months.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in central London”
Reviews.Author: Alox
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this centrally located Radisson hotel twice during business trips to London and the experience has been great on both occasions. The service at front desk is highly professional. Rooms have a very trendy design, are spacious and very clean. i particularly like the hotel's scent concept which runs through the entire building. In addition, one should mention the breakfast which offers a lot choice in terms eggs, cereals, bread etc. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel, lacks in service”
Reviews.Author: eff7
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel for 4 nights in September 2010. My husband and I arrived separately at the hotel. My husband got there first early in the morning to leave his bags as the room was not available yet and go to a work meeting. He told the people at the reception that I will be arriving in the afternoon and since it was my birthday he asked them to leave some kind of "happy birthday" note for me. I later found out that he also made this request a few days before our arrival by email. His requests were ignored and he was disappointed by it when he came into the room in the evening and I said no when he asked if any greeting was left for me.
