I found the room modern and very beautifully (minimally) decorated and the bathroom spacious and pleasant but the bathtub had hairs in it (yuck!) when I first came in (I cleaned the entire bathroom with disinfectant wipes I brought with me). The bed was very comfortable but we had just one sleeping pillow in the room and it was with feathers when I specifically asked for hypoallergenic synthetic pillows when making the reservation online at the hotel web site a few month earlier (it was one of the options offered there). We had to ask the reception for more pillows. The electric kettle with tea and coffee that was refilled every day was very nice and so was the free wifi (!). They even had free printing service at the concierge desk (not the best quality, but I was able to print our e-tickets for the way back home) The location on a quiet street within easy walking distance to the British Museum, Covent Garden, Soho, central underground stations and shopping on Oxford st. was perfect. All in all, I found the hotel perfectly located,beautiful and with great amenities. I just wish the staff were more attentive and hospitable and not so impersonal, maybe even indifferent, towards the guests. Will I go back to this hotel next time? not sure, just because of the service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: deathsblackdove
Reviews.Content: My employer booked me in here when they sent me to London and I found it to be a very nice hotel. Rooms are very clean and well presented and staff are very friendly and helpful. Well situated for all attractions in central London.

Reviews.Title: “High Priced hotel for the room size and services”
Reviews.Author: DelhiGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 days. The tarriffs are exorbitantly high because of its prime location, paid 220 pounds a day as tarriff. The rooms are very conjusted. Kept knocking my feet against the corner of the bed due to small rooms. Though it is a Radisson Group hotel, however, they do not honour any of the radisson norms. I am a radisson gold card member which allows me an early checkin and a late checkout. However, the hotel reception clearly refused a late checkout and this facility was only available on payment of additional 20 pounds. The staff is ok, not very friendly as you would expect in a prime hotel. The hotel has been recently renovated, so the carpeting and furnishings are new and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location for theatre, service could be better!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahaj67
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Superbreak as a theatre and 2 night stay. Quite pricey but wanted something nice for my moms 71st birthday weekend. 4 of us travelled, 2 rooms. (Saw Priscilla which was AMAZING!!!). Arrived at the hotel to be told that the twin room for my mom wasn't ready. I wanted this trip to be really special for her and having to wait for the room took the edge off a bit. I wanted 2 rooms on the same floor as I thought this would be easier for sharing items such as hair straighteners etc. The reception did offer to give us another room but it was on another floor so we waited for the initial room. A nice gesture would have been to offer us a complimentary drink while we waited, but sadly non was offered. Instead we went out for a walk and bought our own. When we got both the rooms, the decor was lovely, very plush, lovely bathrooms, really big in both rooms. The rooms don't have much of a view but then thats not what we were there for. I had booked a table for dinner before the theatre on the saturday. Through superbreak we were offered a 2 4 1 deal in the hotel restaurant. Previous to arriving for our break, I e-mailed the hotel about a table and was told that not only could we have 2 4 1 off the set menu but we could also have 50% off food from the main a la carte menu. Great I thought, good job I printed this e-mail off because when I arrived in the restaurant, they were unaware of this offer and I had to show the e-mail. Then I was told that we would have to have two courses to qualify for this offer, these conditions were not highlighted in the mail when I booked so I talked to the manager and she agreed to uphold the offer for our 1 course (didn't have enough time for 2 as theatre beckoned). I have to say, this annoyed me no end becuase I was made to feel embarrassed by the manager in front of my mom for the way it was handled.That did not go down well with me at all. No tip was left that night. That said, the food we had was lovely. However, coincidence maybe, but everyone else in the restaurant had their food before we did, and that felt like they were just making a point. Breakfast in the hotel was lovely, better on our 2nd morning than our 1st, on the 1st morning we had to ask for things to be re-filled but not the 2nd, they seemed much more on the ball that day. Pretty much everything was there and as with dinner, good quality and tasty. So, would I stay here again, no probably not because they annoyed me with the restaurant issue and the room not being ready but that said, it was a very smart hotel in a good location for Covent Garden and theatre district so maybe you shouldn't let me put you off.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel "but"”
Reviews.Author: EriEvan
Reviews.Content: We stayed with at this hotel having read good reports on trip adviser that were endorsed by Theatre Breaks who we booked through. The hotel has recently been renovated and all the facilities are in good condition. Booking in was simple and the reception desks were well manned, but we arrived early, about 11.00 am and had to leave our bags. The concierge desk was unmanned and we had to wait about 5 to 10 minutes for the concierge to return while the reception staff booked in other guests. When we left the same happened again we had to wait about 5 or 6 minutes for the concierge to get the bags. In other hotels we have stayed in the concierge desk is manned almost permenantly and they have other people to take the bags to the rooms and store them when required. The rooms were well appointed and very clean but there appear to have been little thought given to soundproofing and although there are thick carpets to muffle footsteps you can clearly hear anyone walking down the outside passage talking. We didn't eat at the hotel in the evening but round the corner at Le Bistro Savour Faire that was excellent however I would recommend booking even if you are eating at 5:00 pm as we did. Our package included breakfast that was buffet style and very good with attentive professional staff and a constant supply of food but if breakfast is not included in the room rate it will cost £18.00 per person that I personally think is on the high side. Having been to the theatre we went to the hotel bar that had plenty of seating but is a bit plain and had music that in our opinion was much too loud making conversation difficult. If we'd wanted to go to a night club we'd have gone elsewhere but all we wanted was to finish of the evening with a drink, a chat that was spoilt by the volume of the music. The hotel has the potential to be an excellent hotel but would I stay there again, probobly not because there is in my opinion a much better hotel in the area that doen't have the buts.

Reviews.Title: “A real find - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Skib99
Reviews.Content: We used to stay at the Thistle Charing Cross and were really disappointed with it in July 2010 so opted to try something new for a 3 day (me) -4 day (hubby) visit this November. We were so pleased with the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury and will stay again and recommend it highly. It is very elegant with its old facade and then has a cool modern tasteful feel upon entering (and we were often personally greeted upon returning from an afternoon/evening out, what a nice touch). Our room was large and tastefully decorated and the bathroom was fantastic: enormous and gorgeously modern. It was also very quiet for London. We were at the end of the hall, so the maid was still finishing up our room on two of the late afternoons when we returned to rest before going out again, but she was so apologetic and sweet that it was no problem (and quickly finished up). I didn't eat at the hotel but my husband did the first night and was very pleased with both the food and the friendly service. The location is fantastic, we could walk to the theatre area (wonderful not to have to fight for a taxi to get back) and walk to lovely shopping areas. Several museums close by as well. The price is reasonable (in London) for such an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable, centrally located hotel with the most charming staff to make your stay a superlative one.”
Reviews.Author: zedgee
Reviews.Content: After five visits to this superb hotel over the last year, I can safely say that this hotel is second to none. The service at reception was very helpful and welcoming, especially Arjun, who is a credit to the hotel. Yonka at the breakfast buffet is lovely and remembered just how I liked my morning cup of tea from my previous visits.This attention to detail by the staff make for a very comfotable trip. The rooms are opulently decorated, plush and very comfortable. The location could not be better than this; so close to the the theatres, China Town the great book shops on Charing Cross. The British Museum is a stone's throw away and sites such as Covent Garden, Leicester Square; Picadilly Circus are so close to walk to. I would highly reccomend this hotel for its elegant style, comfortable rooms and the fantastic and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: SueStaples
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Bloomsbury Edwardian for our anniversary. From the moment we arrived the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was very stylish and our room everything we could have wanted - clean, big, quiet and luxurious. Did not eat at the hotel, but had a drink in the bar which was great and very relaxing. Location perfect and only a 10 minute walk to Covent Garden. Would definitely return - let's hope we can get some babysitters again soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - friendly staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dutch6
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice in the past month - and am a frequent London traveller (3x a month). This hotel has nice amenities, good bar, solid breakfast and is well situated to bloomsbury and the theater district. The two rooms I've stayed in were nicely done - new. From a business traveller point of view only one request was unfulfilled - and that was for a european plug adapter - you had to cross the street to purchase one at a local store (really - shouldn't hotels always have these on site?) Staff was always friendly - helpful. Simple things - when staying late at the bar - no one rushes you out even if your the last group there - front desk staff is helpful - they hit the solid points - offering luggage storage, taxi, opening doors for you on your way in and out. Having had difficulty with a key they did not make me do the requisite three trips up and down - but escorted me with the new key to the room to ensure it worked.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel,and in the right place.”
Reviews.Author: brian19452010
Reviews.Content: Check in was efficient and very friendly,our room was very tastefuly decorated in Caramel and muted purple velvet and, with all requirements to hand. Bathroom was perfect,lovely thick warm towels. Public areas follow the same theme,laid back luxury. Bar and restaurant staff excellent, food superb.Overall a beautifull hotel with attentive,caring and proffesional staff. Five minutes walk to all theatres and main shopping areas. We will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Charliegirl73
Reviews.Content: I booked a night at the radisson bloombury street online and said that we were celebrating my partners birthday. When we arrived Sophia on reception wished my partner a happy birthday and upgraded our room, free of charge. I'd booked a standard room (London on a budget!) but I think we got a deluxe or a superior room. On both days (before checking in and after checking out) Gary on the concierge desk was only too happy to store our suitcase. We felt very spoilt.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Avoid this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: c14leigh
Reviews.Content: While the accomodations themselves could have been better, the customer service at this hotel was the worst I have ever seen. They will lie to your face to make an extra profit and clearly have no regard for their guests. While I was staying at the hotel my bag was stolen and one of the front desk representatives offered to waive the hotel's (extremely steep) phone charges for me to make the necessary calls to cancel my credit cards and get emergency funds sent. After I had gone ahead and made the necessary calls , she later informed me the next day that she had learned she was not authorized to waive the fees, and despite the fact that I had a note from her in writing confirming her promise that I would not be charged, the hotel management refused to honor it. I highly recommend you look for a different hotel that puts more value on its customer service and honoring its word.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, helpful staff, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ge0babe
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel whilst visiting London and taking in a couple of shows. The hotel is very central making it easy to walk to the theaters and other sightseeing locations. Check-in was smooth and we were offered upgrades at a cost - we were also offered plentiful advice as visitors to London. Our deluxe room, on the 7th floor, was spacious, clean, quiet and luxurious. Despite one of the recent reviews we didn't experience queues for the buffet. Coffee was good and service at the breakfast table was attentive and quick. (My one minor gripe was that my partners plate was cleared away before I had finished).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel! Decor great, service friendly, good location!”
Reviews.Author: PaulB_5555
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, I've stayed here 3 times, ideal location for Central London. Friendly hotel staff and efficient service on check in and check out. Great room, can be slightly noisy if front facing rooms. Very clean. Decor great, newly rennovated. Definitely would recommend and stay again!!!! Breakfast on the go is a great idea!! A happy customer!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and underdelivered”
Reviews.Author: Ttaveller
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel, the first experience was good and we decided to return. When we did the booking we requested a specific room. On arrival the check in was okay and the special request was ignored,it was not even mentioned. The room we got was like a panhandle room with a long passage within the room. The bathroom was so badly designed that the one basin is behind the door so to use it the door must be closed and when in use no one can enter the bathroom. The coffee making facilities in the room did not include cups and saucers so we had to request this which took 30 minutes. The breakfast was like a bun fight, it is so cramped that people literally form queues around your table to get to the buffet. The service in the breakfast room is shocking and if you are lucky you may get a waiter to bring you a bad cup of coffee, Overall the whole experience was shocking and I have another booking there in February which I will be cancelling. When we were checking out I mentioned my issues with our stay and the desk clerk offered that on my next visit they will give me the best delux room in the hotel and guess what this was the room we requested and this request was ignored. The location of the hotel was the only thing good about the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff, comfortable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Brooklyngirl2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. We were welcomed at the front desk by Joe M. at the front desk who personally showed us several rooms from which to choose, when we agreed that we wanted to upgrade to a larger room. The room we selected was large and extremely comfortable. The only negative was that the bathroom, although beautifully renovated, was extremely slippery when wet. We asked for several towels to place on the bathroom floor to avoid an accident. (Another negative was the unpleasant scent that permeated the lobby). The hotel staff that attended breakfast each morning were also wonderful. Yonka, the manager, was extremely organized and efficient. The breakfast buffet was delicious and plentiful, and also allowed for one to order special items from the kitchen. We ordered pancakes (more like crepes) from the kitchen on two occasions. One morning, we inadvertently awoke late and missed the designated breakfast time. Yonka and Aaron (the kindest server) seated us in the bar area and provided us with coffee, tea, fruit and yogurt and a basket of assorted pastries. In sum, we had a wonderful stay in London and would recommend the hotel to friends who wanted to be centrally located and a 10 minute walk from Leceister Square, the National Gallery, and around the corner from the British Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: kapuchok
Reviews.Content: Recommend this hotel to anyone!!! The hotel is clearly very trendy, modern and clean. The location ideal for West End Shows, Soho, Covent Garden and we were able to walk to most places.

Reviews.Title: “All show and no substance”
Reviews.Author: allan_munro_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two day business trip to London. Booked late and staggeringly expensive (breakfast not incl) so expected a lot...but sadly didn't deliver. Standard room (2028) was small & looked nothing like the images on the web site. Furniture incl a bed, small desk & chair & a random fridge like unit with the mini-bar etc plonked in one corner. TV was fixed to wall above. All very unappealing especially as carpet was stained. En-suite was a good size, but smelled of sealant. Builders had left spacers under mirrors. AC controller wasn't properly finished & loose. Extract fan a bit noisy. Made me think it had been recently renovated. Very noisy as fronted onto Bloomsbury Street so didn't sleep well either. Had to ask for bed linen change as curious brown stain on sheets. Not 4* by any means except the price. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable pleasant hotel with friendly staff in the hart of London”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the professionalism of the staff, the nice interior design, nice room, high quality breakfast. After trying out more then 10 different hotels in London, I would definately put this in my top3. I will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: Razigirl
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great location, beautifully presented and staff are helpful. i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - very attentive helpful staff - lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: down122
Reviews.Content: We had booked the Radisson Grafton we were in London to sort out my husband's visa for america next yr and to see a show. When we arrived at the Grafton we were told it was over booked so they put us in a taxi to the Bloomsbury. I have to say we landed on our feet from check in to check out the staff were very attentive - always smiling and seemed happy to be at work which makes a lovely change from some hotels. We have stayed at Radisson hotels before and know to expect a good hotel but his was great. Breakfast was a lovely selection all freshly cooked and we had a lovely seat in the window. We will definately return to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone who wants to be close to Covent Garden and Oxford Street it is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “You don't get what yo pay for.”
Reviews.Author: alanh43
Reviews.Content: In our booking confirmation it was noted that we requested a 12:00 nonn check in. - We had to wait until 14:30. Our fridge wasn't working. Thus it didn't keep drinks cold or more importantly didn't keep my wife's eye drops cool. When we reported this at check out we were refused any refund although they had not provided everything for which we had paid. very poor customer relations. We won't stay there again. Alan Hepburn

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Little Hotel, Nothing compares in Value!”
Reviews.Author: Luke_wells
Reviews.Content: Our stay in September sparked many others to come! We were greeted by fantastic staff, very polite and welcoming. The hotel looks and feels spotless, and the location is fantastic, its fairly quiet, so its good for a good nights sleep but only one or two stops away from some fantastic London Locations! The breakfast selection was great; far more that i expected, and the bedrooms are beautifully decorated and kitted out. Our weekend was fantastic, and it really felt like home when we had to leave! I'll be back in November for my Birthday! You really impressed! Many Thanks to the Bloomsbury Street team for an unforgettable weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: ninjupug
Reviews.Content: Would highly recomend the Radisson Bloomsbury Street Hotel, location ideal for West End Shows, Soho and Covent Garden. Hotel was excellent, with 1st class service, Room very clean and very spacious. Restaurant excellent for evening meals and breakfast. If you are looking for a Restaurant with a difference the try the Paramount at the Centre Point tower, the Paramount situated on the 32nd Floor, the views are fantastic. But I would have to say you have to book in advance and also the menu and drinks are not cheap, but they very much worth it. Go on treat yourselfs!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely hospitable hotel where ALL the staff go out of their to help at all times.”
Reviews.Author: Corky93
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location and we were able to walk to most places during the weekend. The rooms were spacious, very clean and comfortable. Excellent breakfast and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a lovely stay this year, this was out second trip to the same hotel and we will return again next year I hope.

Reviews.Title: “One of my good stays..”
Reviews.Author: SahilDubai
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel; good value for money; excellent location - 5 min to underground; 10 min walk to harrods and the best shopping streets....breakfast was very good, stay was very comfortable and they guided us well..very good Indian restaurants nearby specially bombay brassiere...so food was never a problem..

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: ALC23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over a weekend to celebrate a friend's retirement. Initial impressions very good when we entered the hotel, spacious neat and tidy and we ( six of us ) were dealt with very efficiently. Our luggage was stored for us as we did arrive late morning. Rooms exceptionally clean, lovely shower and although the rooms not massive, I did end up with the largest room! Breakfast was great, enormous selection which we all enjoyed. We did not eat in the restaurant in the evenings as other arrangements had already been made. All in all a very pleasant stay, and we all commented next time any of us visits London we would be staying at this Hotel again!! Location a plus being near the Theatres and Tottenham Court Road tube station. A very nice gentleman hailed a taxi for us when we left, and graciously dealt with abuse from the taxi driver, with an apology to ourselves also. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for an occasion”
Reviews.Author: MPFB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the above hotel for a special birthday treat in London, the superior room was excellent as was the service, nothing seemed too much trouble. Enjoyed the breakfasts, especially in the room. Restaurant was closed on the Sunday however was directed to sister hotel over the road (Kenilworth) and offered complimentory wine for the hassle, had an excellent meal, for a reasonable price. Thank you to all the staff who helped make this a weekend to remember.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service.... Super friendly and efficient staff.....”
Reviews.Author: rjcc007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the night in London to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The staff were very welcoming when we arrived. when we got to our room I was a little disapointed due to the size, even though it was super modern it had a tiny window and seemed really dark.I went down to reception to ask whether this was are correct room as I booked a 'duluxe kingsize room' the receptionist cheked and said we were in the correct room. I explained how disappointed I was as it was our wedding anniversary and the room seemed really small. She did not hesitate in checking her system to find me a better room. the hotel receptionist took me upstairs and showed a lovely room at the front of hotel with lovely bay windows overlooking bloomsbury road. (we had this room) The bathroom was huge!! We went down to the bar to have a drink before dinner and the again the the service was excellent and the bar was very trendy.. All the staff at the hotel were so helpful and friendly. We would definitely recommend this hotel. A fantastic hotel!! Well done the Radisson...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Room”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneLin
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! I had a Deluxe room which was very large, beautifully decorated and had a huge, very nice bathroom. In addition, the bed was comfy and the room was very quiet. I will deinitely stay here on my next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling value and standards from big brand”
Reviews.Author: Wearing
Reviews.Content: The room I was assigned was tiny, the air conditioning was noisy and stuck, the finish of the fixtures was poor (shower head come away from ceiling, light switch mounted at an angle, chair too wide to fit under desk) and the bed was old and soft. Appalling value at £200+VAT for the night. I only used this hotel as the Pope was clogging up the entire city and there was little choice in the 4* market. Back to the Hilton next time I'm away with business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Saffa_Travel_Girl
Reviews.Content: This hotel can be found very close to Tottenham Court Road Tube Station so it is easy to get to and right in a hub of theaters and shops. Reception / Lobby: The reception staff were very friendly and even though I arrived early (around 1pm), they were able to let me have my room, which I appreciated. The lobby itself is not large, but it is very tastefully decorated and has a nice feel to it. Restaurant / Bar: I had lunch in the bar area which was really good. The food was nice and was reasonably priced. I conducted some business meetings in this area and I have to say that it was perfect for that purpose. The sofas give it that relaxed & yet formal feeling. I had breakfast included in my rate so had breakfast both days. Continental Breakfast ingredients were on display (which were sufficient) and they made cooked breakfasts to order. Initially I thought it inconvenient, but they were so fast (and it was fresh), that I actually asked for a cooked breakfast the next day again. Rooms: My room was comfy - I liked it. My bed was very comfortable. The room had what you would expect in a 4* deluxe property - wifi, laptop safe, iron & ironing board as well as AC. My work desk was comfortable to work at as well. I had a large flat screen tv in my room with plenty channels. I did think that the room was quite small, but i liked the room so much, I did not really mind. The bathroom was very modern and it had a shower over the bath. No material curtain which I hate - there was a glass shower screen. Overall, I thought that the hotel was really good. My room was good, the food was good, the staff were friendly and welcoming. I would go back to the hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katyhack
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The decor was beautiful yet very comfortable. As with a hotel in any major city, it was not a huge suite but still I found it to be very spacious unlike some of the reviews I read. There was even rrom for a table and two chairs. I have to say I loved the breakfast in the morning - delish, as was the dinner I had there one night. The mojito was expensive but so good. Good location, just around the block from Oxford St so shooping on Oxford and Regent are really close. Also buses are very near by, get an Oyster card when you get there to prepay bus fairs, its a great way to see the city. Not a bad walk to Picadilly Circus and the British Museum is up the street less than a block. Really enjoyed this hotel, wonderful location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Rooms and Efficient Staff”
Reviews.Author: vaibhav81
Reviews.Content: The location is quite central. 5 min walks to Tottenham court road station. Tons of eating places close by (theres wagemama right opposite). The bus stop for gower street is 2 mins walking. Check in was speedy and efficient. Really nice to get an upgrade into King Deluxe Room and our request for room close to elevator was considered. I stayed for 8 nights and really enjoyed the hotel. The breakfast staff and other staff is great and extremely efficient. Rooms are neat and clean perfect, decent size for London standard hotels where rooms are miniature. The bathroom had a great shower and nice touch with the heating rod for towels. Lots of interesting artwork around the hotel. The free wifi is really useful. The only small issue I had was that the decor is dark and dingy, which I would have preferred if it was light and bright. Also on the last night before checkout next morning the staff woke me up in the middle of the night to change a 10 pound note! This was alarming since it could be done in the morning when I was leaving rather than disturbing a sleeping guest at 1230 am. She said that she had no option which wasn't very convincing when you are paying over a 1300 pounds for your overall stay. Other than the above the stay was great and just one small issue at the end didn't leave me in good taste. I would recommend this hotel and the previous reviews on tripadvisor are well deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for you money....hands down!”
Reviews.Author: scarletSf
Reviews.Content: I decided to take myself on a solo trip to London. I scoured over hotel ratings and read review after review looking for a hotel that had the feel of the W Hotels in the US. I wanted to splurge on this extravagance since I was traveling alone but unfortunately the W London doesn't open until Spring 2011 so I decided booked a MUCH more expensive hotel in the hopes of great room service and pampering. Two days before I was leaving I reeled myself in and decided a cheaper hotel was really the right thing for my wallet so I started over. I am sooooo glad I did! Now the Radisson Edwardian is not exactly cheap, but it was definitely cheaper than my original choice by a ton. It is also a preferred hotel for international travelers at my corporation so I figured what the heck. In the US, Radisson Hotels are usually 2/3 stars out of 5. I would say this hotel is a 3/4 star hotel on that same scale.....based on booking the King Deluxe room. I was pleasantly greeted upon arrival and they even had a room ready for me to check into at 11am which was great. The interior was not perfect, but the rooms were big, the bathroom was modern, the air conditioning worked great and most importantly the bed was comfortable with nice linens. Very W-ish in style. The only draw back were the cable options were VERY limited...I think there might have only been 5 local channels? But there were several movie options which was fine with me. There was an Underground Station close by, but I have to admit that London was packed with things to see. As many of the reviews have said, if you have the time...walk everywhere that you can. Its very rewarding and doable! I walked to many of the attractions which was great and it helped me get my sense of direction. I also enjoyed being just outside the crazy, tourist zones. It was nice to come home to a quieter area. As far as food options.....you could get your room with breakfast included but I'm just not a big breakfast person. Starbucks was right around the corner and that was a great/cheaper option for me. Beyond that, I didn't really seek to spend my money on upscale restaurants (not much fun by yourself) but there were lots of pubs and reasonably priced restaurants in the neighborhood. I even found a fabulous fish and chips place (recommended by a local that I met) 10 minutes away called Rock & Sole Plaice. It was so good that I went there 2 nights out of 5! Highly recommend. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cintia-RS
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable and the location was very convenient. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: SteveHAnkara_Turkey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in London over the years and I have always been frustrated by what I see as unnecessarily high room rates. With this hotel I was expecting the samer 'pokey' rooms that I have experienced in the past: no room for you AND your suitcase. Imagine my surprise to discover that the rooms here are ultra modern, large, clean, tastefully furnished and very comfortable. The en suite bathroom was beautifully decorated in a pleasing green marble with clinically clean surfaces (exactly what anyone of us wants in a bathroom) and plenty of room. The hotel is perfectly located, with the British Museum, Tottenham Court Road and Oxford Street all nearby, including Tottenham Court Road tube station. Service can be patchy at times, especially trying to get tea and coffee service at breakfast. This is largely due to the fact that the hotel can be quite busy at times and it seems odd that the self-service breakfast is not comlemented with self-service tea and coffee. A second cup would be nice without the hassle of grabbing one of the breakfast staff. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and I will certainly stay there again. It also bodes well for the other hotels in the chain. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: CNO99
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed at the hotel for a weekend. The location was great, with walking distance to Covent garden and Oxford street, and tube station close by. We had a warm welcom by the staff, and when they heard it was my daughters birthday, they gave us a better room and great offers in the restaurant for both breakfast and dinner. The room was quite spacious for London standards, and high standards on bathroom and interiour. I could very well choose this hotel again for my next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly . ...”
Reviews.Author: izzie1963
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel the same morning I left a horrid hotel also in Bloomsbury. It was what you expect in a hotel. The staff are amazing, courteous, helpful, pleasant. The room was exquisite.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: OxfordPeterpan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson in Bloomsbury Street as we were visiting Ronnie Scott's for a birthday celebration. The hotel was spotlessly clean, comfortable and the staff extremely helpful, especially the reception staff. The whole experience that weekend was wonderful. Thankyou

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Cindy25171
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite convenient and has a good restaurant. BUT the gym is to small and useless, the room was VERY small and not to convenient and the price was high. We tried the 2 for 1 offer at the restaurant and it was actually quite good but they seem to get the discount back only on the water. Bottle of sparkling water was 4,8 pounds! In London it is hard to find the perfect hotel but this one is not on the short list for them. However the service was ok and the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: wazoom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when I was between projects and in London to get a visa. I was impressed that they were able to accommodate my early check-in request when I arrived at about 8am. There was good quality free internet in the rooms, both secured and unsecured. The staff were very helpful with both business centre requests and advice on local restaurants. The breakfast is very reasonable, especially when built into the room price. From a leisure perspective this hotel is in an excellent location, being within walking distance of Oxford Street, Leicester Sq, Covent Garden as well as being within 1 minutes walk of the British Museum.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in London.”
Reviews.Author: Donna4678
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. It might have been the quietest hotel we have ever stayed in. The staff was friendly and very helpful when we asked for assistance or a restaurant recommendation. We loved the continental breakfast. We selected this hotel because of the location close to the British Museum, which was a very short walk. The neighborhood was very nice and a an underground station is close by. We plan to stay here again the next time we travel to London.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Alainlux
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury St hotel and were very impressed, the room was immaculate, large bathroom and very comfortable bed. The bar was great, very friendly staff and offers fantastic cocktails. We had dinner in the restaurant, the staff made us very welcome and assisted us with all our requests, nothing was too much to ask. The menu has good variety of meat, fish and vegetarian options, something for everybody, you must try the rump of lamb with courgette gateau and tzatziki, perfect combination, and of course creme brulee, the best I have ever had. Over all it was a great experience and we would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel near Tottenham Court Road & TUC Conference Centre”
Reviews.Author: gareth_999
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Tottenham Court Road Tube and all the tourist attractions this area of london has to offer, for this trip I was at the TUC Conference Centre and the hotel is about 50 metres which makes it a great location. Hotel is very nice 4 star hotel with all the feature you would expect, very polite and helpful staff and rooms are of a very good quality, the room had a rainfall type shower and ample space in the bathroom, flatscreen TV on the wall and desk to work at if required. Breakfast is expensive at £18 per person but luckily the quality is good so dont feel you have been completely done by spending that much money on first meal of the day. I've rated sleep quality to a 4 as busy area of central london and as expected woken at 8am with daily noises of london.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonAreWeThereYet
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a night after a celebratory dinner in Soho with friends. The hotel was only a five minute walk away, but is in a nice quiet location. Large room with wonderfully equipped bathroom - loved the shower in particular. Was a real shame we only stayed the one night. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location & staff.”
Reviews.Author: PSBTEXAS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a two night weekday break and really enjoyed the experience. It more than lived up to all our expectations for a four star hotel in London. We usually stay outside of the congestion zone but decided to stay where we could get around by walking. This hotel turned out to be the ideal location for that. It’s within easy walking distance to the British Museum, Covent Garden, Carnaby Street, Oxford Street, Soho, etc. The nearest tube is Tottenham Court Road, a five minute walk. The hotel is also on a bus route and taxis are abundant in London anyway. Our room (#6014) was perfect, both clean and comfortable. It's on a corner with lots of windows. Others have mentioned the street noise was a problem. Whilst there was noise the hotel is double glazed to reduce the sounds of the busy London streets, and we are baffled why one would think it possible to escape noise in London. Anyway we did not find what little noise that did get past the double glazing to be distracting or keep us awake at night. We had the daily buffet breakfast both mornings. The selection was big and the food was very good. Every staff member we came across was very helpful from check in (and before) to check out as well as polite and cheerful. We especially want to mention Neil, Gary and Katie who were very responsive to our needs and requests. We made good use of Gary at the concierge desk, whom is very knowledgeable and happy to help to provide directions, restaurant recommendations and more. The next time we return to London we will definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends and family alike.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike48
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business. Great location only minutes from the West End attractions. Check in and out was swift and efficient. Room was comfortable with all you need for a short stay. Bathroom was modern and the rainforest shower great. Bar service good and breakfast was relaxed and not too busy. All in all a good hotel

Reviews.Title: “London Luxury”
Reviews.Author: marcopolo1701
Reviews.Content: The ideal spot for our weekday break to London. The staff were helpful from check in to check out, we could not fault the service and the helpfulness of the staff. The concierge organised show tickets and our tour bus for the day. Our room was both clean and comfortable, we had breakfast daily which was buffet style or there were items you could order separately, again the staff were helpful and friendly even when dealing with rude guests which we observed frequently. We are returning to London at the end of the month and have already booked our stay here again, comfortable in the knowledge we will have a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in convenient location for West End shops/Theatres”
Reviews.Author: perhaver
Reviews.Content: Most acceptable hotel in an excellent location for West End shops. Literally a five minute walk from Tottenham Court Road underground station. Hotel facilities were very good. Deluxe room was nicely appointed and the restaurant served a good standard of food for dinner and breakfast. (Complimentary water in the rooms would be a pleasant gesture should the Radisson choose to implement this!!). Beds very comfortable but due to location and being in the capital police sirens wereheard until small hours. Little disturbing but considering the locality it is to be expected. All in all a superb hotel in a prime spot!!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: ClaireBrabbin
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the Radisson Edwardian Kenilworth Hotel, which was the hotel my husband booked six weeks earlier, to drop of our luggage, we were told that the hotel was overbooked and would we be happy to move to the sister hotel across the road. This was sold to us by informing us that the alternative hotel was a 4* deluxe rather than the 4* we had booked. We agreed to move as we are not the sort of people to cause a fuss and understood that these things happen occasionally. We were too early to book in the room, therefore we arranged to leave our luggage and spend the day sightseeing etc. On returning to the hotel we had a limited amount of time to book in, shower and change as we had theatre tickets and needed to be out rather quickly. Our initial reaction to the hotel room was a little disappointing, small, dark, quite obviously a room set up for disabled users, which in itself isn’t a problem but I do think it would have been polite to have informed us. The lack of natural light and noise from a huge air conditioning unit situated outside the window was also disheartening. On further inspection there was litter on the floor under the bedside table and the glass dining table had a good layer of dust. When sat at the dressing table I was unable to see in the mirror as it was placed far too high and this would have been impossible for a wheelchair user. My husband was the first to use the bathroom, the toilet was situated extremely close to the wall, the sinks did not have plugs and the area around the main sink had marks and looked very unclean. The shower head had obviously been damaged by previous users and when switched on sprayed water all over the bathroom floor, there was a hole in the wall were the small mirror had been fitted incorrectly and damage to the wall where the mirror continuously hit the wall. All of these discoveries were very disappointing to find not only because the weekend was meant as my special birthday weekend but also because we didn’t have time to deal with the issues straight away. The main reception and restaurant areas are extremely stylish and the staff were very polite and helpful, especially Katie. Overall, despite the excellent breakfast and good customer service, I would have to say that our stay was unsatisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: iamlaura66
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, staff were keen to see to our every need, we found the manager very helpful. The bedroom was large and spacious, modern decor, very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. I would absolutely recommend this 4 star deluxe hotel. Suitable for anyone, whether it be business or leisure. Location is ideal, with only a couple of minutes walk away from Covent Gardens and very close to Euston Station. The nearest tube is Tottenham Court Rd, only a few minutes walk away. If we came to London again, we would certainly choose the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury St.

Reviews.Title: “Theft from room”
Reviews.Author: absolute
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 16 to 20th July. Overall hotel is good in terms of room/location and concierge services was excellent but small rooms & no views from window. Our main complaint is that by mistake we forgot our clothes in the closet while checking out which the hotel claims they never found nor did they give any proper reply to us on same. We informed them of same the very next day but they kept telling us investigation is going on and even never replied on emails till date. I find this utterly disgusting that a hotel of such name will retort to such services and not return clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Made us feel so special,very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: maisieeight
Reviews.Content: Sooo central within walking distance of theatres, covent garden,Oxford street for shopping, catching the tour bus for all the city tours. Absolutely everything is within walking distance. Staff couldn't have been more helpful with advice on tubes, places to go ,cheapest way to do it. Every staff member we came across was genuinely interested in usand made us feel very welcome.Hotel itself is gorgeous, room we had was beautiful and cannot be faulted. Absolutely loved it and was very very pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “The service at this hotel was incredible!”
Reviews.Author: NYCKen
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury was the most responsive and helpful I have ever met at any hotel. From the moment we checked in, we felt as if we were VIP's. The conciege responded to our every need quickly and efficiently. The room rate included free breakfast, internet service, and a great workout room. Several times during our stay we had to print up e-mail and send faxes back to the U.S. and the desk staff provided these services for us at no charge. I would recomment this hotel to everyone because of the staff, the ambience, and the location, which was extraordinary. The hotel was only a few hundred yards from the British Museum and all of the West End Theaters. There could not be a more convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zarir
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the city - walkable distance to sights/shopping and pretty well connected. Efficient check-in process. Rooms small (like most in London) but not too uncomfortable with basic amenities and clean; bathroom adequate; in-hotel food options limited but why would you want to eat in with great choices within walking distance. Overall, decent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “If you go to London, you have to stay there”
Reviews.Author: mikealan2003
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, I loved every minute of my stay. Located within walking distance to all the theaters and Greater London. The hotel was very clean, the employees were very friendly. The best part was the Food, a five start *****gourmet . I look forward to returning

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Baxter052
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked a room at the Radisson Kennington over the road the day before I was due to arrive. I had booked the hotel really last minute due to being let down by another hotel. When I arrived, I was informed that the Kennington was fully booked, but I had a room at their superior sister property, The Radisson Bloomsbury (which is literally just accross the street), and that my room had been upgraded too. This was above and beyond what I expected and really friendly service from the gentleman on reception. The bedroom and bathroom were spacious (especially for London) and spotlessly clean. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. This hotel is in a great location, a short walk to many of the attractions and a tube station. My only negative about this hotel is that we didn't sleep very well due to the noisy traffic during the early hours. Our room faced right out on to the main road, so it may be worth requesting a room on a different side of the hotel. We were only staying one night, or I would probably have asked to move. I am sure if I would have mentioned it to the staff they would have been very helpful and done something about it. All in all, this was a great value, lovely hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “FAB! Really rounds a great trip to London off!”
Reviews.Author: Curly_Fry14
Reviews.Content: I spent ages trawling through review after review to find the perfect hotel to take my boyfriend away for his birthday. All the hard work was worth it and i hope this review allows you to stop those relentless hours of searching to book this hotel. LOCATION: Perfect... close enough to the hustle and bustle of Oxford street and Soho for some great shopping and excellent restaurants. The tube station is a 3 minute walk and takes no time to get to all the various sight seeing you may want to do. HOTEL: Just gorgeous... Hotel staff are very welcoming and friendly... happy to help with any queries regarding places to go etc. Allowed us to check in early even though we hadnt previously asked if that would be ok. The room was great... really spacious and one of the best nights sleep i have had in a long time! The bed was massive!!!! Everything about the room was great... no complaints, lovely shower and bath if you would prefer. Just a lovely place to retire to after a long day walking around London and taking it all in!! Breakfast was good... everything you could want and again staff are really friendly and attentive. It just all felt so clean and well maintained. I would definitely recommend this hotel for your stay in London... you really wouldnt be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: princess097
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in April for my birthday with my boyfriend. It was sooo lovely, very clean and modern with helpful, friendly staff! Excellent location, very close to madame tussards etc and short taxi ride to Oxford st etc. Would no doubt stay there again and good prices are to be found on lastminute rooms.com

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal--service, quality, location, price”
Reviews.Author: RedUakari
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week for a business trip. Everything about the hotel other than the small rooms was excellent. Can't say enough about how wonderfully helpful and kind the staff was. Breakfast was included in my room and it was delicious-fresh, filling, good food. Location was hard to beat. I had a room in the back of the hotel and had no problem with traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: TeignmouthRed
Reviews.Content: Note to Trip Advisor editors: I need a rating in between 'average' and 'very good'! Lovely hotel, pristine reception, nice room and very helpful staff somewhat spoiled by the traffic noise that rumbled on for most of the night. As an exiled Londoner myself, I know not to expect silence when I stay in town but my room was right on Bloomsbury Street and the glazing was most definitely not soundproof. Hence, the low score for Sleep Quality. And in a nutshell, that's why I need a 'good' somewhere in between 'Average' and 'Very Good'. The hotel itself was anything but average but I couldn't call it very good because of the dirsuptive night. Would recommend if I could guarantee a room away from the road with better soundproofing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff, comfortable room - recommended”
Reviews.Author: CuriousTravellerYork
Reviews.Content: Was in London for a 2 day training course and wanted somewhere close to the venue so chose this hotel. Arrived half an hour before official check-in time, but was given the key to my room straight away, which was very welcome. The room was a reasonable size - certainly bigger than others I have stayed in in London and with plenty of room for hanging clothes. Modern fittings and a spotlessly clean, modern bathroom, with bath and over-bath shower. Didn't really spend much time in the room as the course went on until after 10pm, but it was comfortable (and the quiet air-conditioning was very welcome). The only problem I had was the noise of traffic outside which woke me several times in the night in spite of the double-glazing. I wondered if there was something wrong with the double-glazing but when I opened the window in the morning I realised that it was blocking out some of the noise - it's just that the location is a busy part of London. The shower was hot and efficient, plenty of towels, nice smelling shower gel etc. Friendly staff on check-in and check-out. I would certainly go back here. Wish it was a bit cheaper, but that's what you have to pay for such a central location, I guess ...

Reviews.Title: “hotel with style”
Reviews.Author: Dinala_10
Reviews.Content: first i should mention that i didn't pay for the accommodation therefore can't rate "value for money". still, the hotel is very pleasant, beautiful art in the cozy lobi, great service, nice breakfast, free wifi (very slow in the rooms though), real bath with quality bath amenities (soap, body lotion) large LCD, iron in every room, and windows you can actually open for some fresh air. rooms small but very practical.Really enjoyed my 2 nights stay.oh, and the location was great. few minutes walk to the underground and 1 station to Oxford Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: karen_dunn2
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Radisson Edwardian in Bloomsbury Street with my friend for one night. We arrived early (before check in time) and were immediately made to feel welcome by the friendly staff behind reception who kept our bags for us while we went out to Covent Garden. The twin room was small but perfectly formed and very contemporary with purple and silver soft furnishings. The whole room was obviously well designed and thought out. The bathroom very modern and light and most importantly spotlessly clean. After a great nights sleep, in the most comfortable beds ever, we enjoyed their fantastic full English breakfast. Overall outstanding hotel in a great location with genuine friendly staff. I would recommend it to anyone willing to listen!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: R2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a birthday night out in London, the location was absolutely ideal and easy to find. Close to the tube, shopping and great venues. The room was beautiful and despite being on the corner of a busy street, really quiet. The staff were really pleasant and very helpful and even lent us a knife to cut the birthday cake with Happy Birthday wishes. We had drinks in the bar before we went out, which was reasonable for London and the full buffet breakfast the next morning was very tasty with a large selection of choice. Thanks very much for making our stay fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern and very central!”
Reviews.Author: HannahNorwich_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for only one night (not enough) in a standard room. Room was a good size for London and beautifully furnished. We didn't have much of an outlook, but this didn't really matter as only a short stay. The main bonus of this hotel, in addition to its plush and spotless interior is its location. You are within 5 mins walking to Oxford St, 10 to Old Bond st and I guess 5-10 mins for all the theatres of the west end. The British Museum is also right on its doorstep. Overall a great stay, in a lovely hotel in a fab location. Will definitely be staying here for our next show break. Oh and went to see Warhorse at the New London Theatre-AMAZING!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel/Location/Service! Cant fault this hotel at all!”
Reviews.Author: stevieboi2004
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fantastic, from the lovely exterior to the lovely scent when you walk into the lobby! Greeted by a porter and had our bags held for us while we checked in, the man at reception was extremely polite and helpful and upgraded our room to a kingsize. We had a speedy check in and took our bags to our room on the second floor, Now after looking at numerous hotels online in london...i wasnt getting my hopes up because to be honest id seen some very awful places for outrageous money...but when i stepped out of the elevator you could feel the quality in the carpets alone, once we stepped inside our room i had a huge sigh of relief because the room was just a gorgeous as it looks in the pics on the website! (now it did cost us roughly €200 a night...which i thought was acceptable for london and for the hotels location! Its literally just around the corner from the tottenham court tube station!) The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was very clean and modern, theres only 2 minor set backs and they were 1. Seemed to be a nice amt of traffic noise at round 6am but on the second night i cud barely notice this, and 2. the food i got from room service was just okay. But the room alone makes me give this hotel 100%. Oh and the bar downstairs was extremely comfy and we got some lovely cocktails and relaxed on our last night there Looking forward to staying here again in the near future! ;) Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: malfo
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely hotel, good price. I got in at 11 PM and had to leave at 4:45 AM to catch a train. The guy at reception did everything he could to make my short stay as pleasant as possible. He got me a coffee and a croissant although they were not serving breakfast at 4:30 AM, organized a minicab to take me to the train station, etc... without me asking. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Much better than many other hotels in London.

Reviews.Title: “Just one word - FantasticMy wife and...”
Reviews.Author: Yoggie14
Reviews.Content: Just one word - Fantastic My wife and I spent one night at this hotel and throughly enjoyed our stay. Whilst offering great value for money the hotel provides lush contempary surroundings in a great location. We've never stayed in London overnight before but would jump at the chance to return to this hotel. A real credit to the Radisson chain!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: MitchLisbon
Reviews.Content: I will definitely choose this hotel for my next visits to London. The location is very central and the staff very helpful. The staff at te reception were very helpful. The rooms are clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a hotel right in the centre of London close to Oxford St Shopping and Cultural Sites”
Reviews.Author: aussie37London
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a real gem, the staff are polite and courteous and the layout of the hotel is really trendy and at the same time inviting. The rooms are spacious, and the beds are as comfy as. I would and do recommend this hotel to my friends, families and business colleagues and contacts.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good, but a bit disappointed with certain things!”
Reviews.Author: hanf06
Reviews.Content: When we got to the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury i was quite surpised at how modern and luxurous the hotel looked. The decor was beautiful and once we checked into our room was pleasently surprised again! The room was very nice though later in the evening we did find out our room had been mixed up with my partners parents room who had paid for a Superior room. Fantastic for us but not for them. Silly mistake on behalf of check in staff. On the night the hotel was very noisy just after midnight constantly heard doors banging! I thought the breakfast at the hotel was over priced no matter what they offerd. You can quite easily get a decent breakfast around the hotel without paying 18pp. Reception staff were helpful when we asked for help and advice on various things. When we left the hotel on returning home i realised i had left something back at the hotel i immediatly called the hotel and spoke to a manager who was quite unhelpful and seemed a little put out she was taking the call. Surprise Surprise what i left at the hotel wasn't found so had to pay to get it again. Overall hotel was beautiful and would stay in again i will just be more careful not to leave anything there by mistake because i know i wont get it back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: SazzlerYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was on the small side but nicely decorated and it had comfortable beds. The restaurant and bar area was plush and the staff were pleasant and non intrusive. The only downside to our trip was the cleaning staff buzzing our room bell a couple of times to ascertain what time we were leaving on our last day. I wouldn't of minded but it was 8am on a Saturday morning and check out time wasn't until 11am!!!!! I felt this was truly wrong and when mentioned to reception staff we were told to keep the 'Do not disturb' sign on, an insult really as but we didn't need to use this on the other days that we stayed there. Motto here is use the 'DO NOT DISTURB' sign if you don't want to be turfed out of your room before check out time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the few London hotels I'd return to”
Reviews.Author: John55
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, almost on a par with the Montague but without the gardens. Reasonable rates if you contact the call centre rather than using the numerous, apparently cheap, online booking sites. Loved the breakfasts. A very good hotel by London standards / prices.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in every aspect that we have stayed in all around the World.”
Reviews.Author: JanetHoss
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is the best we have stayed in all around the World - the Radisson should give praise to an exceptional staff member ARJUN. He was our guardian angel. He did absolutely every thing for us. He arranged a early check in and breakfast for us, an upgrade, offered us his assist for our entire stay. We cannot speak highly enough of him. The Hotel itself was magnificant. We had previously stayed there 2 years ago during its renovation and that was a complete disaster. But we put our trust in the Radisson chain and they came through with this fully renovated hotel. It is in the perfect position to everything. There was no outside noise heard in our room. It was perfect in every way. You would have to be crazy not to stay there. Once again Arjun should be voted employee of the Year.

Reviews.Title: “I Feel very let down with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: clareNottinghamshire
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite at the hotel for one night i was very let down with the suite as soon as i walked in the bathroom had water marks all around the sink and my husband had ordered champage & strawberrys the day before he left his card details to make sure they was in the room as it was my birthday there was nothing in the room so i called down to reception who didnt have a clue what i was on about and put me on hold! And then i spoke to someone else who didnt have a clue! and he said he would call back it must have been 45 mins before he rang back and hold me he could not find anything on the system! One more point i would like to make the suite was very close to the road ( Front & side) on 4th floor and traffic was loud!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - perfectly positioned for shopping and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: peakwalker26
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this hotel whilst on a visit to London with my Husband. From the moment we stepped through the door, the staff couldn't have been more helpful. From helping with our luggage to finding us a quiet room. We didn't eat in the restaurant in the evening, but had an excellent breakfast the following morning. Plenty of choice and again good service. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sethyr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night as was in London to see a show and wanted to make a weekend of it. The Hotel was booked last thing on Friday night as was the best deal we could find. Wasn't dissapointed! The Hotel is very clean and modern, very nice reception area and all the reception staff were extremely helpfull and couldn't have been more friendly. Rooms and bathrooms were very modern and nicely decorated to a high standard, ours was a small room but perfect for one night, and had no complaints at all. Didn't eat in the Hotel, but the bar and restuarant area looked very nice and would definetly consider if I stayed again (which hopefully I will do!) Can recommend this Hotel 100%, made the weekend perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very modern!”
Reviews.Author: cwein
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location. We were able to easily walk to Covent Garden, the theater district, china town, Oxford Circus, Regent Street, and many other locations. It's fairly easy to walk through most of London, but you'll need good shoes especially to walk on the cobblestones. The hotel has very modern decor and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We were in a room with two twin beds. The room was very small (which is to be expected somewhat), but the bathroom was good size. And like others have commented, the shower was fabulous. The staff offered to upgrade us to a bigger room, but we would have had to pay additional money so we chose not to do that. That of course was our choice, but it was nice to have the option. Our only complaint about the hotel was the noise in the hallway early each morning which made it almost impossible to sleep past 7 am (local time) which was 2 a.m. back home. We really wanted to sleep until 8 or 9 am, but the noisy laundry carts in the hall made that difficult. The laundry room must have been just past our room, because several carts were wheeled by every morning. And the carts have noisy metal wheels. Other than that, our stay was very nice and we would recommend the hotel. But ask for a room away from the laundry room if you think you might want to sleep past 7 am!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AaBrules
Reviews.Content: Great stay for 3 days. Verry helpful staff, when we want to change to a double room instead of a twin. The hotel is perfect for the price, and the breakfast is the best i have tried in London Hotels...The free wifi was good, and the ice cubemaker on every floor was great... Thanks for a good stay...

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at the Radisson Hotel was by far the best i have ever experienced, made fell welcome from the start and treated”
Reviews.Author: pen0001
Reviews.Content: I would reccomend anyone to this Hotel, a geat place and set in a superb location for all the theatres

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great value for London”
Reviews.Author: Bestdavid
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 1 night on Saturday 8th. Great location (5 mins walk to Covent garden/Leicester Square/British Museaum/Theatreland etc) and the hotel and rooms were comfortable, well decorated and very clean. The bar and the common areas of the hotel were a bit disappointing for a 4* hotel - but were functional - and lets be honest, how much time are you going to spend in these parts of the hotel? The rooms were a bit on the small side, but that is usual for london. Given the location and price i believe you would be hard pressed to find a better hotel. We payed £105 + tax (£125 total) for a standard room, which i would consider as very good value in London. Quite often in London you could pay much more and get a poorer/older room. All around a good hotel and a good experience. If someone asked if i would stay here again, my answer would be certainly.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: 4Holidayagogo
Reviews.Content: I was only one of a party of six ladies coming to London on a Theatre and shopping break. No easy task booking a suitable hotel but I am very happy to report that the Radisson Bloomsbury Street met all our expectations!! Kris Leszczynski, the Lobby Manager, secured three identical rooms for us (2030, 3030, 4030) and they were ideal for our stay. They were clean, contemporary and spacious, especially for London standards. Check in/ out service smooth and efficient with staff even organising our online flight check in before departure. Now that is fantastic service. The hotel is within walking distance of London Underground and easily accessible to Covent Gardent and the British Museum. Small note, we were aware of late night traffic noise but ultimately it did not spoil our sleep. Will definately book this hotel again and have no reservations in recommending it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Fusion_10
Reviews.Content: The Location is just perfect. Nice places to walk around. The rooms are very spacious, with authentic views of the area. The staff was nice and very helpful. The food was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Smudges-dad
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel right in the heart of London. It was clean and comfortable although the normal problem of not being able to receive Radio 5Live on the TV was there. Is there any reason why hotels cannot provide more radio stations? The only other gripe was the cost at well over £200 for a night, which even though it was on expenses seemed very high for a basic room. At that price you would at least expect a large room and a few hgh class toiletries. Breakfast at £18 is a total joke, so it's much better to go over the road for a freshly cooked breakfast at a third of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and fab rooms”
Reviews.Author: ClairePear
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptionally well placed being 5 mins from Covent Garden and pretty much opposite the British Museum. Check in was quick and very friendly with the front desk upgrading my room on seeing that I was heavily pregnant, to give me a bit more room. The room was well furnished, had a massive bed compared to most hotels and a fabulous bathroom. Everything you would need. Hotel breakfast was great, lots of lovely food and served by friendly and gracious staff. Checked out within 3 minutes, again, very friendly and we were on our way home. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wow!!”
Reviews.Author: jaynegurl
Reviews.Content: wow!! what a fantastic hotel, situated right on new oxford street, it was easy to find, and within walking distance of the tube station, which came in handy for sightseeing and the theatre. our room was beautifully decorated, very clean and contained all basic necessities - hairdryer, tea, coffee, ironing facilities and the all important mini bar!! the staff were incredibly friendly, and even looked after our luggage on our departure date until 2000hrs in teh evening. will definetly use again, and would firmly recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A very, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobbyson
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was excellent, the staff were some of the most courteous and helpful I have encountered anywhere. We stayed bed and breakfast and the food and servive were to the same excellnt standard. My only grouse was that our standard room was a liitle on the small side, but the qualtiy and clenliness were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: brtUk
Reviews.Content: Spent an excellent 4 nights here is early April. Hotel is in perfect location, just 10 mins walk from Covent Garden and Oxford Street. All staff were very helpful and polite. Bar is a bit pricey but no more so than any other central London hotel. Only negative is that despite requesting a quiet room, we were overlooking the busy road. We were however very quickly and efficiently moved to a rear facing room. By far the best hotel we have used in London.

Reviews.Title: “tasteful and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: BorisandBunty
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to stay in as part of our honeymoon week and what a fantastic choice! When my husband made the reservation he mentioned the reason for our stay and didn't think anymore of it,however on arrival we were told that we'd been upgraded at no extra charge. Our room was immaculate and very tastefully decorated just like the rest of the hotel. The staff were very courteous and outstandingly helpful. The location was perfect for sightseeing and our walk to theatreland took no more than ten minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: beeStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister and brother in law booked this hotel as a surprise for my 40th birthday. It couldnt of been a more enjoyable stay. The hotel rooms and reception were immaculate and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location couldnt have been any better within 10 minutes walk from tube, theatres and weatherspoons perfect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting London. We did Blood Brothers on the Wednesday and tea at the Ritz was a birthday treat. We visited all the sites and the weather shone. Beware the Imperial War Museum as you need longer than one day to complete it we all had sore feet but totally enjoyable. The hotel had upgraded our room so it was larger than a standard room but all the rooms were beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “hotel might be ok, long as you don't get sick in the middle of the night”
Reviews.Author: SugarRotterdam
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again!! I was travelling with my partner, he fall really ill just after dinner and I came down with a fever (food poisoning) on our first night stay at the hotel. I called the concierge for help requesting for a doctor to come and visit us (as my partner by now was violently sick). The concierge basically refused to send a doctor over because I do not have over over 100 pound cash on me and even when I offered to pay with credit card (come on, I am not poor if I can stay at a four star hotel). Especially given I am also ill, concierge insisted the only way forward is for me to go outside in my condition to withdraw cash from the cash machine (11pm in the evening, single women in unfamiliar city). After negotiating for about an hour, the hotel finally agreed that it is ok to take the cost as room charge, but then the doctor is no longer available and we have to call emergency service instead. The hotel did not send anyone to come and check on us until about 3am in the morning. It is not to mention there is not a single word of apology or even trying to check if we were ok in the coming two days we stuck in the hotel. When we checked out, there were no words on how was our stay or even asking how things are going. It is perhaps ok hotel to stay, but my advice is don't get sick when you are there. The staff was incapable of assisting the situation, not to mention lack basic human compassion and understanding of urgency of the situation. When we finally returned home and had the situation checked out by the doctor, the doctor said it was lucky for us the poisoning is just manageable for us, but calling doctor at the time was the right thing to do. I dare not to imagine if it was any more serious, it would have lead to very serious consequence.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for mother,daughter theatre and shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: ednaMidlands
Reviews.Content: Value for money and much better than hotel of similar rating behind Oxford St in which we had stayed 2 months earlier at a silmilar cost. Staff were very friendly and properly trained to do their roles. Checkout was busy and very well organised and speedy. Room was compact but perfectly formed! Could benefit from privacy curtaining in rooms, like ours, which overlooked other rooms. We could see into other rooms! Easy to leave luggage with concierge and access the shops in Covent Garden area!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully located, friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: culturevulture60
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides beautifully decorated, comfortable rooms and good food. But the real plus is the helpfulness of the staff, who bend over backwards to answer any questions you may have or sort out any problems. The central location is excellent, putting you within walking distance of many of London's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: swsgm30
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for some sightseeing and to see a show. The Hotel is just around the corner from the British Museum and just 10 minutes from Shaftesbury Avenue and Covent Garden. We didn't use any of the facilities at the Hotel as we had been warned about Bar prices etc.(Breakfast is £18) - there is a small cafe directly across the road from the main entrance and their prices are very reasonable.The rooms appear to have been refurbished quite recently and ,we thought, to quite a good standard. We had an ensuite shower and our friends an ensuite bath, both very modern and fresh looking.Rooms are not large but there was ample room to stow bags and good wardrobe space. We had an electronic Safe at no charge and a Minibar (which we stayed away from. All told, we would recommend this Hotel for a short visit to the Capital and intend to use it again when we next see a show

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, gorgeously decorated, fairly priced and excellently located”
Reviews.Author: LisaP_10
