Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our first night away from the children in 4 years (yes we know!!!) and to be honest booked it as it was near Euston station and the British Museum and near the theatre district where we had dinner reservations. The hotel has had a recent top to toe refurbishment and is beautifully decorated. The hotel held our bags as we arrived early and the room was super with a fabulous bathroom and everything you would expect from a 4 star hotel. The rooms are not the biggest in the rold and I suppose some US visitors could be surprised by this but the sound proofing is good, the carpets and soft furnishing luxurious and the thread count of the sheets made up for the size. The abr is a lvoely place to relax (a bloke next to us proposed to his girlfriend) as we had a pre-dinner drink! It's that kind of place. The drinks are pricey even by London standards but it feels special so you don;t mind. The breakfast was the best I've had in any British hotel but then I am a sucker for good juice and good pancakes! Book a breakfast option if you can. It is worth it as I was full for most of the day! The hotel is within 50 yards of the British Museum and a 5 minute walk to the tube. We won't leave it 4 years next time!

Reviews.Title: “Give customers the breakfast they are paying for and it would match the rest of the experience.”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Chissock
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel, recently refurbished to a very high standard. Has a nice opulent feel compared to my previous experiences of 'chain hotels'. The room was of adequate size but not large and I loved the fabrics used, which gave that opulent feel. Pillows and bed were reasonably comfortable and we were not disturbed by noise at all, either from inside or outside the hotel. The room itself was very pleasant overall. There was a great shower too but no plug in the basin as, apparently, many guests had flooded their bathrooms through not knowing how to use them! Had we known this before retiring to our room for the night, a plug could have been obtained on request from Reception! The staff were friendly and gave us good pointers for a pre-show bistro. It was within comfortable walking distance of the West End, Covent Garden and Oxford Street etc. The most disappointing aspect of our stay was the breakfast, which was nothing like I'd expect for the £18 charged for it. It was adequate but the toast was pallid, the cooked breakfast was ok but not hot enough due to being self-service from a buffet and the pain au chocolat had been heated so long ago that it was like biting into cold rubber! The coffee was alright and I've had worse breakfasts but it let the stay down. My husband stayed in a Premier Inn and they managed a decent self-service English breakfast so it CAN be done! (Note, it was Easter Sunday and they were expecting a high volume of diners but still....) Give customers the breakfast they are paying for and it would match the rest of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern quiet but buzzing hotel, clean and fresh with helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LALALA30
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I went with my sister whilst on a girlie weekend for an overnght stay. It was off a main road so not too much traffic whizzing past but just enough so you could feel the buzz of london. The hotel is fresh and clean with a fantastic flowery smell when you walk in l(ike you are in a florist). The staff are welcoming and very attentive so you dont have to wait long. The staff are also happy which puts you at ease and there's professionalism and pride combined. Lovely decor , very modern but not so OTT that any age wouldnt appreciate it. The restaurant and bar are open planned, comfy and clean. Food fantastic and not over priced. Drink is reasonably charged with the area. Very peaceful hotel with spacious double bedroom - ideal for two. Quiet bedroom on fifth floor towards side / back of hotel. Received a complimetary gift when they reaslised it was my birthday and a candle with my dessert accompanied by happy birthday sung to me (unrequested but really nice touch). The location is ideal, close to bus stops and tube stations, walking distance (15 mins max) to Leicester square and theatre land. Taxi cabs were often available if needed. Can't see how they can improve if honest, check in and out was quick, easy with no fuss. Plenty of seats if needed. Lifts although a little small (most people you could fit in were 5) were quick so no queues formed. Breakfast was tasty, fresh and quick to serve. Overall 5 out of 5 for me. Had a really enjoyable stay! P.S: I'm afraid you will have to pay for your stay though I didnt have to as it was a treat - not everyone has a lovely sister like mine !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Conference”
Reviews.Author: Funexsvfx
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and very attentive Desk Staff. I was greeted and welcomed to the Hotel by Arjun and the information that he gave was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street - Really nice”
Reviews.Author: njd47559
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street last Saturday night with the wife and we had a great time. Room was great, furnishing fantastic and modern, Staff very friendly. Downside breakfast is £17 per person!!!!!! Go to the cafe over the road or another just around the corner, you dont have to pay their price. Would recommend, especially for £93 special rate on line via LR's.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting possibility in London”
Reviews.Author: Triper_07
Reviews.Content: We have suffered the refurbishing process of the Clifton Ford at Wellbeck St. in the form of pitiful rooms at exhorbitant prices.And we have verified that Novotel Hotels in London (at least the Waterloo) has nothing in common with Novotel hotels in Germany or even in France. So we decide to choose the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street Hotel for the 2009 Christmas and New Year Eve. We didn´t know anything about the april 2008 negative documentary on ITV. Perhaps it such case we would have changed our mind and looked for an other hotel. Fortunately this was not the case. The place is an excellent option in London and the price for Christmas 2009 was reasonable in London hotel's terms (186£ plus taxes including breakfast for a superior room). The room was exactly as described in the website: wide and well provided (with complimentary wifi access) and the bathroom spacious (although without heating system except for the towels). And housekeeping was efficient and kind, including the days the hotel was full and were surpassed by the work they had. The breakfast buffet was quite good in spite of the lack of space for so many guests the hotel had. Unfortunately, there most of the persons who supposedly were in charge were complete incompetents. Only their less recognized peers solved the mistakes they made and their lack of skills for the job.I still remember one of them, called Denise, who clearly thought, and I imagine still thinks, she was not born to help guests. Not everything in the room should be considered OK. I have mentioned the lack of heating system in the bath which is not very understandable in winter months. But that applies specially to the heating system, very noisy and difficult to adjust. Our room had two independent machines that work at their owm rhythm with no relation with the temperature selected and one of them switched off automatically late every night. Perhaps we should have contacted with reception, but we didn't because the noise was "unfixable". And in addition to that, the hotel (or other firms) have placed the exterior air conditioning machines in the common courtyard floor. The high number of them (see photo) translates in a considerable noise that has to be hard to carry in the lower floors rooms. We didn't stay at one of them, however some nights the noise was very disturbing (in spite of the windows insulation). So next time it will be a good idea to make the reservation by phone (if prices remain the same) and to ask for a room with window to one of the three streets that surrounds the hotel. In spite of all that and based on my experience about London Hotels this Radisson Edwardian is one I will recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Made a special occasion even more special”
Reviews.Author: StaffordshireMarmot
Reviews.Content: I wanted a special hotel in this part of London for a special occasion. I chose this hotel out of many others in the area after a phone conversation with Joseph on reception, who impressed me with his knowledge and his friendly, helpful manner. I sensed that this hotel placed importance on good service, and I was not disappointed. We were given a beautiful deluxe room; we were able to check in earlier than usual; and the Guest Manager even gave us a complimentary bottle of wine to help our celebrations, which was a really lovely surprise! Room service was prompt, and the gentleman who took our orders was also really friendly and helpful. Being able to have a full English breakfast delivered to our room was another welcome bonus: we went down for breakfast on the Sunday and had to wait a while as it was very busy, so the tray charge for room service was definitely worth it on the other two days. This is a gorgeous, modern hotel, perfectly situated for a stay in London. yes, it is expensive, but I do think it's worth it if you really want to be sure of having a fantastic time. All the staff are friendly, courteous and efficient without being obsequious or coming across as false. Checkout was efficient and friendly too. All in all, a fantastic experience, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ljlNorthEast
Reviews.Content: Visited the Bloomsbury this weekend with my daughter (aged 8). The hotel is ideally situated for most of the attractions, in particular The British Museum, Covent Garden, etc. Also a short walk from Tottenham Court tube station, just come out at Dominion Theatre exit, turn left and left again, then just around corner, pass Dorothy Perkins .... left and again on left! We booked direct with Radisson on website using their special rate, which stated a 'complimentary upgrade subject to availability'. Unfortunately there were none available at the time of our stay (although I was offered an upgrade for £40 so not sure how there were none available?!) The room was really nice, just far too small although it was well equipped and furnished with a lovely bathroom. Wasn't particularly impressed with bed comfort but I usually stay in Marriott's in London and their beds are hard to beat! It was fine for one night but had I stayed for more I would have upgraded to a deluxe. We did not eat breakfast there, used the Italian Coffee Shop over road as per a previous review, which was really nice and great value. Our room was ready earlier than we expected which was a bonus and the staff we encountered were very polite and friendly and always willing to help. I would definitely return again but only if I could be guaranteed a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the room photos on the website, Standard is SINGLE size”
Reviews.Author: andys_Bristol
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels for work and pleasure, so could not believe when I checked into the Standard room this evening. The bed is smaller than my own standard double at home. As I have booked a superior room for tomorrow night, I asked to see this and was shown what looked like the website Standard room. I was told that there are only 2 rooms in the hotel which look like the standard photo, "So that people look and think that it looks nice" .... Mmmm,good marketing, but not for repeat business or loyalty customers. Even being an Elite member of Goldpointsplus, clearly doesn't mean anything in this hotel. Stylish without a doubt but, Disappointed guest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in London!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieODarlington
Reviews.Content: Being a female, a one night business trip in London is something I never look forward to - a hotels within company budget are never of good standard- usual allocation is a box room at the back of the hotel. What a surprise with the Radisson Edwardian (Bloomsbury St)! Beautiful room with huge bathroom. Marvellous shower with full water pressure. Big plus for ladies with good magnifying make-up mirror and lighting. Wall mounted plasma screen with normal channels. The huge bed was so comfy it took some getting out of!!! Tea & coffee making in room - the only downside being UHT milk. Room service was excellent and quicker than they stated with huge portion of requested meal. Everywhere was being constantly (but unobtrusively) being tidied or cleaned (even the cushions on sofas in the lounge areas) I attended a conference in the hotel and again surprised at the quality of food etc. The staff made even more difference - they were total smiles and courtesy, even remember your name is you say something nice. - when I get good service, I like to tell the staff and their manager - everybody likes good feedback! The downside? £7.50 for a glass of wine!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice room, comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: LondonTourist1967
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Kenilworth, literally across the road from the Bloomsbury Steet Hotel, while my friend stayedin the Bloom Bloomsbury Street Hotel. The Radisson Kenilworth staff were very nice, very helpful, and offered good customer service, Rajaii was very helpful. The room was very well soundproofed, comfortable bed, and nicedly decorated. well recomended. The Hotel Bloomsbury Street was excellent, amazing staff, The Guest Relations Manager could not have done more for us, and the suite was truly wonderful. In short a succesful, and extremely pleasant stay in two great hotels. Perfectly located, an only a short walk from Tottenham Court Road Tube Station

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, some issues”
Reviews.Author: Tim_the_Taf
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a superior room on a Sat night in March 2010. Comfy bed, but unfortunately the traffice noise was particularly intrusive, and it wasn't until I found my ear plugs at gone 3 am that I got any sleep. Disappointingly equipped room - no CD player/ radio; no dressing gown or slippers, and really they should provide bottled water, biscuits etc. at these prices. Bath was very shallow, so more like a slightly deeper and larger shower tray. Poor range of toiletries. If this was a Superior Room I'd hate to see the standard rooms. Hotel itself is small, public areas are incredibly dark thanks to the "designed to death" decor. Buffet Breakfast was Ok but nothing special. Not worth £17 each. Not helped by a dubious looking hair sitting on top of a (literally) mouldy piece of cheese in the buffet. Somewhat off-putting. I wish we'd not paid for breakfast, and gone to a very good little Italian cafe opposite the hotel, which did a full English for £5.50.

Reviews.Title: “Courtesy and an open helpful approach from everyone”
Reviews.Author: mog1Devon
Reviews.Content: No matter what time of day you arrive at this hotel you always get a great welcome, the staff remember you every time you return and the restaurant staff know where you like to sit and how you take your tea - whilst the bar staff remember your favouritetipple - maybe I am too much of a regular?!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel ideal for sightseeing in London”
Reviews.Author: Serendipity47
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for four nights in one of their recently refurbished suites. The staff were excellent, professional and the service outstanding. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and our room was beautiful. Yes we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: dontstayputtravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just like the Radisson Edwardian in Manchester where I have stayed on several occasions. The quality of service, decor and even the aroma about the place were the same which made me feel safe and at home. I would definitely choose a Radisson Edwardian when travelling to a new city, particularly as a solo traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Surpurb Experience”
Reviews.Author: whassey
Reviews.Content: The only thing that surpasses the accomodations at the Radisson Edwardian on Bloomsbury Street in London is the quality of the Staff. The service was outstanding. The people on staff were consistently available and helpful in all aspects of our stay. Nothing was too small or insignificant to them...whether it be asking for directions, getting clarification on a topic of interest or simply being there...they were terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Pink2210
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after staying in a Raddison in Manchester. We expected slightly smaller rooms being in central London but were very pleasantly suprised with the size of the king deluxe room. The decor was modern and the rooms kept very clean. Most importantly the location is spectacular, to the left is Oxford Street and the British Museum and on the right is Covent Garden - absolutely perfect for a city break!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: fromkent
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near enough to the tube, british museum, and walking distance to the west end and oxford street nearby. The ice and water on eachfloor near to the elevators were handy for a refreshing drink on the way back to the room. Hotel should be more specific when it comes to exactly which carpark to park in that offers the 25% discount for staying in that hotel, the nearest carpark in the road next to it was an ncp and we found out on departure that the hotel does not have a stamp to stamp our parking ticket so the machine at the carpark could offer us the discount so we had to then pay the full amount - £36 for 14hours! if we were told that there was only one specific car park that was a fair walk away was the only one you could use for the discount we would have much prefered to pay that carparks fees of £20 with the discount off. Other than the carparking situation the hotel is nice (although we was only in the room breifly for a few hours sleep and to get refreshed and changed, so didnt use any of the bar,restaurant etc)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: joanoArmagh
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 night stay in this beautiful hotel in a wonderful location. Unfortunately we did have some problems, mainly as a result of poor communications, which the hotel have gone out of their way to address. I still would highly recommend this hotel despite our difficulties. Having visited London on many occasions, we were pleasantly surprised to be able walk to Covent Garden, Leicester Square, Regent Street etc. Avoided the underground! The decor throughout the hotel was modern and luxurious. Breakfast was a good standard. Service was excellent even though the dining room was full on the first morning. Hope to make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “very well presented rooms, and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jan019
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel , and cannot complain at all about our stay. The rooms are really lovely- newly and luxuriously decorated. Breakfast was consistently good, serviced well, staff at reception were all very helpful. Free use of internet on ground floor was excellent as was the in-room internet facility for £3 per hour. Cannot comment on restaurant but you need a mortgage for the bar!! Good bar lounge with lovely comfy sofas to relax. Just a walk around the block to the nearest tube. I would definitely recommend this hotel for couples and special occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Are female guests taken for mugs at this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: LadyGrayChorley
Reviews.Content: In all honesty I felt like I was taken for a mug upon check in at this Hotel. Believe you me I am far from it; a business owner and very smartly presented ... oh and blonde so maybe that had something to do with it :-) I booked a last minute deal for two nights as a treat for a colleague and friend. The rate was reasonable but not cheap and I paid a litlle more, specifically for a deluxe twin. To be fair it is a nice stylish hotel, contemporary furnishings etc until after we checked in and got to the end of the corridor, to our corner bedroom. Not quite sure were the 'Deluxe' title came into the equation, but this was a dark, extremely small twin room. One bed against the wall, next to the entrance door, a tiny space inbetween, we may as well have booked a double room and the bathroom door and toilet pretty much squashed facing the bottom of the other bed. If i was travelling on my own for work and secured a cheap deal, this would have been an ok 'just get your head down for the night' type of room and I wouldnt have complained. However as it was for a special occassion and I had also booked and paid for a deluxe I was miffed to say the least. Even more so when I went back down to reception to request a room change, only to discover the hotel wasnt full and was then shown a whole host of different, much BIGGER rooms throughout the Hotel. In all fairness the female Receptionist (who hadn't actually checked us in) handled my complaint very well but my issue is why Stefan, the guy that did check us in, fobbed us off with what really was a cr*p room. Had I checked in with my husband ,I somehow get the feeling we would have ended up with a totally different room allocation tsk tsk. I've stayed at a few Radisson's for business, The Mountbatten in Covetn Graden and The Edwardian in Manchester but this trip has put me off lining their pockets in the future. I am now off to burn my bra ... :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leperina
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, within walking distance to all the main areas for nightlife, shopping, entertainment, etc.. but not in the thick of things so you could get a good night's sleep. The neighborhood was in a nice area and safe and public transportation on the tube and bus was readily available. The rooms were clean, spacious, comfortable, and had new upgrades. I liked the fact they had american outlets and free high speed internet as well. The staff was also very helpful and they let me check-in early at 9am when I arrived which is a huge plus because coming from states you really need to get some rest either on the plane or when you arrive or else you'll be up 24 hours! Normally the check-in is 3pm. Overall I was very satisfied with the hotel especially the condition of the rooms which were nice and luxurious. I definitely would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “good location, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: maxieslim
Reviews.Content: visited on a weekend in Jan. Room was good and the staff very friendly. Its location was ideal. The only gripe we had really was the cost of food, drink and pay per view tv(£7 for a movie, £3+ for the music channels and if you wanted anything stronger in your viewing taste it will set you back £14+) at the hotel which was rather pricey although I'd expected to pay over the odds in London. We ate once at the hotel, a better than average meal but the drinks were extortionate. We gave breakfast there a miss. Dining room is small for such a big sized hotel and were advised to get there early-hell we wanted a lie in! All in all though I'd recommend this. Staff were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: dmhholiday
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few days just prior to and past Christmas 2009. Was lucky enough at check-in to find I was upgraded. Room was spacious enough for one person with a well positioned luggage and wardrobe area (best I encountered in many weeks in London and the Continent) and bathroom was also well appointed and clean. The only slight adverse comments I would venture to make were two. 1. I chose to pay for my 'incidentals' by cash rather than credit card after encountering the situation at other hotels where this money is effectively 'frozen' for one month, even after checking out. Having sorted this out at check-in, when it came time for room service I was advised (more than once) that I had I had not left any 'incidental' money. This also applied to when I tried to make a phone call I was advised that the phone had not been connected as I had not left any money for incidentals. Very frustrating trying to sort this out.... again more than once. 2. As a solo traveller (by choice!) over the Christmas period I had my eye on the Christmas menu which was on display for a few days before Christmas Day. There was what one could describe as a 'budget' Christmas meal and then a more expensive and elaborate one. On Christmas Night I was ready to order the budget one (still around 40 pounds from memory) and I find out it was not on offer. So to plan B rather disappointingly which was room service of mushroom risotto. Not really a Christmas meal but very appetising, none-the-less. Breakfast times were very busy on most days, and it would have been a good idea to let guests know that this might be the case by advising or displaying messages to this effect, which I encountered at another 4 star hotel in the London area. Overall though, relatively good service, clean and well decorated hotel with a bus stop around 2 minutes walk away. Would definitely stay again, if the same room type could be provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great”
Reviews.Author: jaseww
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyable stay in a modern hotel. Much better than its cousin the Radisson Mountbatten which is just down the road. Would suit the average tourist, with its great location, excellent service and clean and polished rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sayitasiseeit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were welcomed at reception by Lilly, slightly over-enthusiastic but a vast improvement on the typical London hotel receptionist who is hardly able to speak English and shows no interest in you as an individual. The reception area and adjoining bar is modern and a little clinical but with some interesting modern artefacts. For example, two crouching pigs facing each other like sumo wrestlers. Our twin bedded room was a good size as London hotels go, with a large dressing/bath room with a good shower. The room was pleasantly cool and quiet, overlooking the courtyard to a range of traditional flats. On our return from an evening out the bar was pleasantly buzzy and the staff welcoming and attentive. Drinks prices as one would expect at a London hotel; all plus 12.5% for service. Breakfast was included in the room rate, and none of this "it only includes continental breakfast; full English is extra"! A vast range of choice from fresh orange juice to fresh fruit and freshly cooked bacon and eggs. All the staff were as interested and attentive as Lilly. I assume from the quality of service that this is an American owned chain, but what a welcome change from the traditional London hotel. it's Radisson for us from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed!”
Reviews.Author: rui_mim
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room and received an upgrade to a Deluxe room. The room was quiet though my girlfriend found the air conditioner a little noisy during the night which woke her up a couple of times and the shower valve could have done with being replaced as i found the hot water difficult to regulate. Apart from that the room was clean and comfortable, the staff were helpful and courteous and the food excellent. The decor of the room, bathroom and hotel were also smart, relaxing and luxurious. Most definitely one of the best hotels in that bracket. It was a shame that the hotel seemed so quite, it was probably because it was Boxing Day. When we ate there were only another couple eating so there was a lack of atmosphere but of course that is no fault of the hotel. Still we thoroughly enjoyed the meal, which to my surprise far surpassed my expectations, deserving compliments to the chef!. We also requested an upgrade and got one. Many thanks to Phillip for making us welcome and being so helpful!. Would we return? hell yeah!

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: Rick30
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance to everything, river nearby, trafalgar square, british museum,etc. Also Tube is close in case you get tired of walking. Breakfast is included and is wonderful. Buffet is excellent so may choices and staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms a bit small but typical for europe, htel in quiet location which I liked. COnceirge very helpful too. NOt too many tv channels but wasnt there to watch tv. WOuld stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad roomservice”
Reviews.Author: Trondheim10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early January 2010 in the cheapest room for 2 nights. No breakfast. Nice, big hotel and nice room but tiny. Had to turn 90 degrees and sneak my way to the desk passing the bed and tv on the wall. The chair was too low and very ugly (seethru plastic), didn’t fit the room at all. I didn’t sit good either at the desk. Bathroom was big and classy. And warm because of the towel-warmer. Bathfloor was not cold like many other hotels in London. Bed was very good. There was no bottleopener in room. I called reception and they sent a man to my room to open my bottle. Easier to have a bottle opener in room? Location is good but the subway is not close. But there are buses passing the hotel. I took the bus to Victoria station from just outside the hotel. Helpful and nice staff. The minibar was hardly working, items was not cold at all. Roomservice was a nightmare! I will give it 1 star. First I ordered a steak with mashed potatoes. But after a few minutes they called back and said that the didn’t have potatoes. I canceled my order. Then I ordered the Pizza Extravaganza. It looked very good with pepperoni, green pepper, ham, mushrooms, red onions and olives so I ordered it. After 25 min. pizza came to my door and he told me that they didn't have any pepperoni and if it was ok? Of course not! They could have said this before and I wouldn't have ordered. But the pizza was also missing cheese!! What kind of a restaurant makes a pizza without cheese!!?? And they didn't bother to tell me before making it!! I called to roomservice and they were sorry. But they could have told me before making it! Without cheese you can't call it a pizza. And ofcourse I would not order a pizza without cheese. Manager called me afterwards and offered me a free sandwich. That was ok. And ofcourse I didn't pay for the "pizza". Next day I wanted to try the pizza again. So I called roomservice and asked if they had pepperoni and cheese. Yes they had. Minutes later they called me and said that they didn't have pepperoni! (I was not suprised) But I could have salami instead. I said ok to that. After 25 min. my pizza with cheese arrived at my door. But where is the ham!!? Yes, this time it was no ham on the pizza (but there was cheese). And one olive had a stone in it. And there was no red onion but ordinary onion. I didn't bother to call back. When I checked out next day I said I wanted a discount for the pizza. But I got it for free. Maybe I will be back, but I will not use the roomservice again! And if they change the plastic chair with something nicer and better. (+): Bed Big and luxury bathroom Warm bathroom with warm floor Free internet Staff (-): ROOMSERVICE Plastic chair Tiny room Minibar works bad No bottleopener in room

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Quality, A Must-stay”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer1966
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel in any major city can be quite daunting, but thanks to a Tripadvisor review, we discovered this Radisson. It is the most lovely hotel, great quality, good value, extremely comfortable, fabulous bathrooms and extremely helpful and hospitable staff. The rooms are a little cozy (i.e. small), but they're well appointed. We have stayed at numerous London hotels, but this one ticks all the boxes. The location is fabulous with great local restaurants and convenience stores to pick up anything from forgotten toiletries or bottled water at reasonable prices. It really is a lovely hotel. Free Internet is an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel...”
Reviews.Author: mr_and_mrs_s69
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely. Our room was nicely furnished and very clean, and we were greeted with fresh strawberries and chocolates on our arrival! The bathroom was huge and very clean! The bed was very comfy too! Only downside would be the price of drinks at the hotel bar, we expected them to be expensive but were a bit shocked at £18 for just two drinks (not even cocktails!). would definitely use this hotel again at a last minute price.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury london hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlo12
Reviews.Content: Hi, I attended a work meeting at the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury street hotel and found it excellent. The front of house staff were very helpful. The rooms (I was in a standard room) were not huge but decorated to a high standard and the bathroom was larger than I expected for a London hotel. THe meeting room was excellent to. Location is only 5 mins away or so from a tube station so very convenient to get to. Thanks for a great stay. Kind Regards James

Reviews.Title: “A second great stay at the Bloomsbury”
Reviews.Author: Thorndon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2009 when we could not obtain a reservation at our preferred hotel. The service, room quality, location convenience, and cost so impressed us that we came back for four days in December. Following its major refurbishment, the Bloomsbury offers rooms which are modern, very comfortable (great beds) and well planned for a longer London stay. However what makes this hotel is the service - friendly, committed, and we found consistent between all the staff who work as a team. Having experienced over 30 London accommodations in the last 20 years (including some top end hotels) these obvious features are not often found in our experience. Well done the Bloomsbury - we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient and most helpful staff - the Radisson model works well here”
Reviews.Author: IrishTraveller80
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 1 night, but were very pleased with the hotels convenience, cleanliness and most helpful staff. We were lent an umbrella when it rained and the concierge printed out our boarding passess when we were leaving. The room was a good size for a city hotel. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A London Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Campbie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in London Radissons - predominantly Grafton and Kenilworth- on a number of occasions but this was by far the best. Very good situation for Bloomsbury, Oxford Street, University etc. First impressions from the lobby and check in were excellent. Did not use the bar or restaurant but looked tempting. I couldnt fault the room, reasonable size for London, comfortable bed, modern bathroom and excellent shower. Free wireless internet. The room was quiet, the temperature control worked and I slept really well. Only minor criticism- probably the msic in the lift ! A good breakfast with a very substantial buffet and good coffee. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble for the staff. Very good value but may have helped that it was a Sunday Night. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: vitalhealth
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, excellent service, very modern and comfortable rooms, ideal location

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a boutique hotel, not a chain”
Reviews.Author: Newstead62
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I've stayed at the Radisson Bloomsbury Street and every time I'm made to feel very well-taken care of. From the front-of-house staff to the personalized welcome in my room, it definitely doesn't feel like a chain hotel. The level of service is most assuredly top-notch and I don't hesitate to recommend them to anyone wishing to stay in London. The added bonus - they're just around the corner from the British Museum. Well done once again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, friendly staff, superb location!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzieoaks
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard Queen Bedded room as we were seeing a show at the Leicester Square Theatre. The room was not ready when we arrived, however we were offered complimentary drinks while we waited for the room. When our room was ready we were asked if we needed help with our bags, and the staff were very warm, welcoming and very polite. We went out for the evening, and when we returned at 10pm, we sat in the bar with a lovely bottle of red wine, the ambience was perfect, never have I had such a nice time in London. We could not fault this hotel, the room was clean and beautifully decorated, the security was brilliant - you could not enter where the bedrooms are located without having a key card. The location was second to none - we will be back and we will recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to listen!! We did not try the food at this hotel, but when we return, we will ensure that we fit in a meal as the restaurant looked lovely, relaxed and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, fantastic everything you would wish for”
Reviews.Author: isabelsarah
Reviews.Content: Perfect, fantastic everything we could have wished for and all down to superb customer care and attention. Kris the manager looked after us after we expressed our disappointment with the room we were staying in the sister hotel the Kenilworth, it was small with the double bed against the wall, hardly a romantic setting for a romantic weekend in London. To make amends for our disappointment, Kris arranged for us to have a complimentary breakfast and moved us to the Bloomsbury, and our disappointment soon turned to delight as he showed us to a beautiful suite as a way to make up for our previous night, it was a beautiful room and the hotel staff were friendly and attentive. The food in the hotel was excellent. Thank-you Kris for your excellent care and lovely manner. Patricia and Sam Belfast

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Ipswich18
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, however, the 'Background' music is too loud in the Reception area and it is difficult to hear the Receptionist whilst checking in. We were given a room that had an off-putting smell of drains and the hotel was reluctant to give us another room immediately. They fobbed us off with a Maintenance Man with a bottle of bleach. This didn't solve the problem. It wasn't until one of the Housekeeping staff told us that there is always a problem smell in that particular room that the hotel relented and agreed to change our room. They clearly knew there was a drainage problem when they allocated us this room. Drinks in the bar are expensive and there is a service charge on top. Breakfast was lovely but the dining room is too cramped. This hotel is not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - top hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Tanea H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times this year. This is my hotel of choice in London. I happened to be travelling with colleagues this trip but often travel on my own. And as a woman traveller, it is important to me that I feel safe. And yes, at this hotel I feel very safe indeed. The Raddison Edwardian Bloomsbury (apart from the tragically long name) is a great hotel. The staff are friendly yet professional. I have always experienced the best service from all the staff. The rooms are pleasant and well appointed, some are very small but you have a choice!! Want something bigger?? Upgrade! I love the free internet!! And the location is perfect - walking, underground or by cab, you are in the heart of the city!! Enjoy your stay - I always do!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: NayanVoorhees
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in September. We came to hotel early morning and they gave us a room. Check in was very easy. The hotel is located in an area with good access to public transport and is within easy walking distance to a number of shopping districts and restaurants. Very close to British Museum. The hotel is very nice with beautiful rooms and bathrooms. All staff members were very friendly, polite and efficient. Our special thanks to Mr. Kumar, the Guest Relations Manager, for helping us in reservation and for his outstanding customer service and very professional too. Overall, very nice stay and a good price for central London hotel. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Just right for the Theatres etc”
Reviews.Author: EastbourneKipper
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable and clean, the staff where very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was very good with a good selection of food and drinks. The decor through out the hotel has a lot of black marble with darkish wall covering, very smart but not every one`s choice if a bright and airy is colour scheme is prefered.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels out there.....”
Reviews.Author: jeeva
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels all over the world and this one was less than impressive. I was there for a 2 day Medical Conference arranged by a drug company which paid the bill.... ( I would have been much more annoyed if I had to pay for this myself) The lobby was attractive but thats about all that was good. The room was TINY and I had a wonderful view of a wall from my equally tiny window.The TV had about 5-6 channels (they could at least invest in a freeview box which would triple their channel choice). I mentioned to the receptionist that my TV remote was dead and she said someone would sort it ....but of course no one did. The small bathroom was clean but the shower had low pressure. The room was also a bit dusty which a colleague of mine in another room also mentioned the next morning. To top it off, I received a wake up call the next morning at 730am which I hadn't requested...later found out that the lady in the queue behind me (while I was telling the receptionist about the remote control) had asked for a 730am wake up call which she never got. Overall I wasn't at all impressed. Am just glad that I didn't have to pay for it. Maybe we were put in 'second class' rooms because it was a mass booking by a company. The food in the restaurant was quite tasty. But seriously....london has far better hotels to offer in the same price range. Don't be fooled by the lobby.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stylish modern decor”
Reviews.Author: BarryNorton
Reviews.Content: Fantastically placed for the West End without being right in it. Stayed here and went to the Colliseum (English National Opera, straight down the road; also very handy for the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden). Friendly professional staff, well decorated rooms (not the biggest, but it's central London). Also check out the Lebanese restaurant, right over the road and open until late.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaBerksMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raddison to watch a show and take in a meal at Covent garden. The hotel is modern with fantastic rooms, all have flat screen tv's with connectivity, and the bathrooms are fantastic with walk in showers with modern tiling and accesories. The staff are friendly, particularly the Concierge for who nothing is too much trouble. I would reccomend a stay as the central location is great for theatreland, Covent Garden etc...highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star hotel with 4 star prices!!!”
Reviews.Author: cj025
Reviews.Content: We have been fortunate enough to stay in some excellent hotels around the world including The Wynn (Las Vegas), The Ritz Carlton South Beach (Miami) and can easily say that the Radisson Bloomsbury is equal to if not better than these hotels with respect to its customer service. The level of this service is second to none the staff are both polite and courteous and will do all they can to accommodate your needs. We had the pleasure of meeting Kumar who is the Guest Relations Manager at the hotel and is a credit to the Radisson Edwardian family. The hotel itself is beautiful and the restaurant is extremely comfortable with an excellent menu. London is very competitive when it comes to hotels and restaurants but I highly recommend not only staying in this hotel but dining in the restaurant. This is the only place we’ll be staying for our next and future visits. Thanks once again for all your help Kumar it was a great couple of days made all the better by the hotel and your outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel surpassed expectations which made for a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: thedancemanager
Reviews.Content: Although we only stayed there one night, the service, quality of the surroundings and general feel of the whole hotel helped make the stay very special

Reviews.Title: “Total commitment to customer care”
Reviews.Author: peekabooYorkshire
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel styled with luxurious and elegant furnishings in all areas. Although the first room we were shown to was a bit small we were quickly given another one and a plausible explanation for the problem. The service was excellent and courteous. Also very convenient as well - 10 minutes from Covent Garden / Embankment and across the road from the British Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: napierlouise
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for my son's 13th birthday treat and have to say I was impressed ! Check in was a smooth process and the reception staff were paticularly helpful - even noting that it was my son's birthday. Although we knew the hotel was central we didn't realise it was so central ..... only 3 minutes brisk walk to Oxford Street, Covent Garden and 10 minutes walk to Carnaby street. Tube close by - choice from Holborn or Tottenham Court Road. We had a deluxe room which was large and spacious, tastefully decorated and had the 'Radisson' smell which I love. Breakfast had a great selection and the staff once again were paticularly helpful. Overall great stay at a reasonable price - would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mikedni
Reviews.Content: We were in London for a sporting event and were seeking a good hotel in an excellent location. After much searching we settled on the Radisson Bloomsbury and upon arrival it was clear that we had made an excellent choice. Rooms were tastefully decorated and the staff at the hotel were helpful and courteous. The hotel is located close to numerous, pubs, restaurants and entertainment. The hotel is located in an area with good access to public transport and is within easy walking distance a number of shopping districts. We thorough enjoyed our stay and it will be our hotel of choice during our next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler1705
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to find a good Hotel in London which is excellent value for money but this hotel is it. The rooms are nice, clean and modern. The hotel is very receptive to suggestions for improvement to their services. I had a problem with the person who checked me in on my first visit so I alerted the hotel to this and they fixed the problem. I have stayed twice now and will return. The location is fabulous. The concierges could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “brill”
Reviews.Author: blueeyesNewcasle
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel on the 17th till the 19th of october, Very nice hotel the location was perfect, as in the theater district, and close, to most attractions,I found the hotel staff very helpful and polite, I would recommend this hotel to anybody, ps the food was good too

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed hotel in very handy location”
Reviews.Author: evissa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night on 20th Oct 2009, Room 4009. I booked through my company and the B&B rate was £112 inclusive. The hotel appears to have been recently refurbished and although the hotel is possibly early 20th century the decor is very modern and minimalist in style. It is clean, smart and everything is new. The bedding is new, the bathrooms are new and it's all beautifully clean and sweet-smelling. The breakfast was lovely, they even had fresh strawberries and raspberries on the breakfast buffet. While I was staying at the hotel I went to see Thriller Live at the Lyric Theatre (the evening showing). I was able to walk there in 10 mins (no need for a taxi) and I also walked back alone after the show. There are plenty of people around and the area feels very safe. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel - it was a joy to stay there! I can't think of anything to fault about it. However I didn't eat in the restaurant in the evening or use the bar so can't comment on those aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lexydan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2009. We were met outside the hotel and our luggage was taken to our room. Check in was smooth and our room was clean and modern and the bed very comfortable. The hotel staff were very helpful and efficient. However, the bar is very expensive, we had 4 drinks which cost £30.00. The hotel location is perfect for Oxford Street and all of the major attractions. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a gem for Central London”
Reviews.Author: dcpen43
Reviews.Content: I have got so tired of staying in poor London accommodation and now use the Crowne Plaza, Ealing as my base for business trips to London. Yesterday (Monday) however I had to stay in London and was anticipating an uninspiring stay at the Radisson. I walked into a nice reception but was all the time thinking "yes wait until I get out of the lift and the corridors will be shabby – a usual trick." To my surprise the corridors looked smart as I made my way out of the lifts to room 6006 - still thinking the room itself was going to be the let down. To my delight I walked into a well furnished room with modern fixtures and fittings - over the moon. The best bit was the peace and quiet. No discernible traffic noise – amazing and a good night sleep. The morning breakfast did not disappoint. A good selection of food with pleasant staff. Thank you Radisson for restoring my faith in Central London accommodation. The only catch here was that I was upgraded. I am willing to take a chance to see if my visit next week bags me the same standard of accommodation. Fingers crossed.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated, elegant hotel in very central location”
Reviews.Author: MichelleHEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Sept 09 when I visited London on a business trip. The hotel was fantastic - really upmarket looking and sophisticated. The staff very exceptionally friendly and professional - nothing was a bother for them. I got an upgrade to a kingsize room - loved the furnishings and the bathroom/ shower. Breakfast offered a huge selection, again the staff could not have been more helpful. The decor of the hotel (all areas) was modern but with a warm elegance. The hotel was a few minutes from Tottenham Court Rd tube station which meant travelling about London was really easy. I wish I could have stayed longer - maybe next time! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates receiving friendly, professional service and a luxurious bathroom!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for business or holidays”
Reviews.Author: paquitoelchocolatero
Reviews.Content: I have been 5-6 times in this hotel during the last year, the hotel quality is very good but they still have to improve the cleaning, this is my main concern. The hotel is moderm and the staff very friendly, recomended for business or holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Better choices abound in this part of London.”
Reviews.Author: ergcanada
Reviews.Content: The hotel was overpriced, the room so small we cold barely move around let alone open our luggage. The drain overflowed when you took a shower so the bathroom flooded out into the room. The whole hotel is scented with something that smells like overpowering perfume and the front desk staff are condescending. Only good part was free high speed internet and business centre use.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: nomonkeys4me
Reviews.Content: As a frequent, worldwide traveller, I have seldom been more disappointed. Client service - both in person and in amenities - was well below par, from the employee who let the hotel door slam in front of my sister as she was struggling with two big suitcases, to the lack of signage to help the customer know where to find anything, to the cash-grabby attitude to customer service (late checkout? that'll be 20 pounds an hour please!), and to the slimy concierge who insisted that we use "his" taxi to get to Paddington, when there were tons available on the street. The room was terrible for the money we paid (about C$400): small and cramped (no room to lie down the suitcases even), overly hot, a non-functioning fridge, tv with the fewest possible channels, and - the worst - the teeny shower which flooded the bathroom (amazingly, it seemed designed to cascade out onto the main floor!). But don't confuse the Radisson Bloomsbury STREET Hotel with the Bloomsbury Hotel (around the corner): the latter is lovely and I thoroughly regretted trying something new this time. Radisson should learn that investing in a swanky lobby does not make up for a total lack of concern for the client themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location apart from a few faults”
Reviews.Author: egyptfan86
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from staying a weekend at this hotel and was very suprised at how close it is to Tottenham Court Road station. Literally a 3 min walk from a station which has great access to other areas i.e. leiscester square. And easily walkable to oxford street's great shops. Dont bother walking from Holborn. We arrived at the hotel around 9pm and prior to arrival I emailed the hotel to give my requests i.e. high floor. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by a lovely receptionist who completed check-in. This hotel is very very modern, funky, and boutique i.e. black floor, velvet walls however there was quite large music around the reception area and both if us could hear what each other was saying. The receptionist explained that we had to put the keycard in the lift before pressing the floor button but people still seemed to get confused about this coming back to reception to say the lift didnt work! On entering our floor the hallways are just amazing, big sculptures and plush carpets. Even better when we got to our superior room (6020) which although cosy, was filled with a few special touches i.e. round glass table, big flatscreen tv, and velvet bed throw and extra pillows. They have done a good job. If you like a good bathroom then come here... rainforest shower head, gilchrest & soames bath products, hand wash & body lotion. Best of all the bathroom is huge!!! Breakfast was included with the package and it really was good. There was a menu where you could have anything cooked up for you, some free, and some chargeable like smoked haddock or kipper (£2). Still good value. If you like your fruit then they offer fresh strawberrys, raspberrys as well as melon, orange, and pineapple. Cooked breakfast was great with 2 types of bacon, sausages, eggs and lots more. Hardly ever had to wait and got seated straight away both days. However we did notice that once my parter drank a yakult that it was a week out of date! He informed Robin the restaurant supervisor and he apologised and offered us a free drink in the bar, which was quite generous. Once we left for the day we forgot to put our 'clean room' button on, but I though that all the hotels I have been to they would clean the room anyway.. wrong, we returned at 4pm to find the room hadnt been cleaned, but once we went out and put the light on, we came back to find it had all been done. Great service considering most housekeeping go home at 2pm. My only major gripe was that our safe didnt work in the room for the entire trip. Initially I phoned reception who could barely hear me due to the music as mentioned before but she came up straight away and said that maintanence had gone home and will be in the next day. Came back to our room the next evening to find nothing had been done. This was very frustrating as we had to take our valuable out with us and just did not 100% trust the reception safe. Overall the hotel interior is top notch, location.. one of the best around. We were obviously unlucky with the safe issue but it really is a good 5* hotel and not to snobby!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: topcatportsmouth
Reviews.Content: we really loved it here the staff were so friendly and helpful to, the room was spotless and so comfortable to, can not fault this place at all had a great weekend we also read tripadvisor and its so true this place is beauifull cant wait to go back to london and stay here again thanks from mr and mrs tucker portsmouth

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place in the city but you don't know it.”
Reviews.Author: off2danz
Reviews.Content: From the courtyard entry to the over the top greeting you feel welcome and pampered. Once inside check in was fast. The room we had was large and so was the bathroom unlike most hotel rooms we have stayed in Europe. Convenient to the tube. Great restaurants within walking distance. I hope we can get back to London again soon. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and sophisticated but a bit too fragrant...”
Reviews.Author: RoversReturn2009
Reviews.Content: We spent five really happy days at this classy and well situated hotel. Everything from the staff to the bedding was perfect - clean, comfortable and relaxing...except.... for the very strong air freshener scent in the lobby reception area. I am not one of those scent sensitive people by any means, but I found the floral perfumey odour in the main reception area really, really over powering. Other than that, absolutely no complaints! Our twin room looked out over the front of the hotel but it was very quiet - lovely street view and leafy green trees. The staff were super helpful and didn't have a problem when we asked for the mini bar to be emptied so we could put our own food in the fridge (even though it was probably a bit of a hassle for them). Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- but not good service”
Reviews.Author: westdidsbury
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in August for and October weekend. Seems nice since the refit but had we the following problems: 1. checkin took over 30 minutes as the could not find the booking. had a printout and confirmation on my iphone but still had to wait 30minutes and made to sit on the "naughty step" Eventually got to the room (even though they hadnt found details) and they rang the following day to say they had "found the details" 2. House keeping were knocking at the door at 8.30 am on a saturday- we said we would be gone in 10minutes but when we came back at 15.30 the room handt been touched. I put the do not disturb sign up so I could have a rest before going out again- but as soon as I fell asleep- housekeeping telephoned to ask why I had got the "do not disturb" on the door and when could they service the room! 3. the keys only worked some of the time. If you have ever waited ages for the lift, walked down corridors with bags- only for the key not to work- you will know how annoying this can be..... 4. breakfast! The restaurant is not big enough.. Sunday morning we were in a que with 40 other people waiting for a seat- my adivce would be don't bother- find somewhere else for breakfast if you have to stop here. in summary the hotel is nice and rooms good- although ive had a much better expericnce in a premier inn at a LOT less money. Shame.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience in London”
Reviews.Author: Skippy29
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Raddisson Edwardian hotel on Bloomsbury Street. We found the hortel itself very modern, hip and clean. The staff all friendly and willing to make our stay a most enjoyable one. We felt comfortable that you needed your key to operate the elevator and felt that was a very good security function. The room was quite large and beautifully appointed. The bath very modern, and beatiful with all the ammenities one would need including a heated towel rack and separate LARGE shower. The bedroom was in soothely stylish decor and colors. A delightful room., The bed comfortable and room service proved quick and efficient as well. Our only two minor concerns which we did verse with the management upon leaving were two small annoyances. 1/ The refuse pail was large and useful, however they place a plastic bag less than one third its size within it. Obviously the first pieces of trash you throw into it,, the plastic bag falls to the floor of the pale and is now rendered useless and annoying as you must constanrtly bend down to open it and try tro fit tre gardage into it. A quick fix and no anxiety for the guest- A proper size Plastic bag (SOlVED) the only minor other problem was teh lighting. There are ample ceiling lights throughout the room, on a dimmer, so all the lights on high work great, or dimmed low for moos wonderful, however I you want to sit at the chairs b y the table an read,, you must keep the lights up high,and it makes it impossible for someone else in teh room to simply take a nap. The addition of a lamp on that table for not too much money would solve teh problem easily. Lastly- the placement of the hotel is WONDERFUL. A stroll to Soho and the restaurants and theartres. Its greatly situation, around the corner from the British Museum. Everyone who stays there will enjoy their trip.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, friendly, stylish and all in an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: rodrian
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for my 40th birthday weekend and with the number of hotels in London, it was hard to make a decision on which one to choose. I'm so pleased that we decided to go with the Radisson Bloomsbury Street; it exceeded my expectations in all areas - and I would have been absolutely gutted to have chosen badly on such a special occasion. Every single member of staff was professional, friendly and courteous and Ona (who cleaned our room) really went the extra mile for me once she learned it was my birthday; she really helped to make it special.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel in a wonderfully central location”
Reviews.Author: PortsmouthPip
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel for a number of years, we are still delighted with all aspects, especially the service and friendliness of the staff. Just a few hundred metres from the British Museum and many theatres, it is a perfect location for short breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Lancashirelasses
Reviews.Content: Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Room service was excellant. Bar in the evening was delightful for a late night drink.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tabisox
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night at the Radisson and the staff were wonderful and the hotel was lovely. The room we had overlooked onot the back which was a little nosy as it backed onto a residential apartment block - however, this did not spoil our break in any way! We would definately return. The hotel staff couldnt do enough for us - very attentative and willing to help ALWAYS. Excellent place to stay would highly recommend! (Excellent location! Only round the corner from Convent Garden and if you're a stage lover then youre right down the road from ALL the shows! It was fab!!)

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Weller_Fan
Reviews.Content: Good location for central london, service was very good, not the cheepest hotel in London but with 4* rating you get what you pay for. If I had to find any fault the only one is at Breakfast time the resturant got quite busy but we were warned of this by a sign by the lift and avoided those times

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable and great staff”
Reviews.Author: scooterMadrid
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel many times for several years now (it was called Radisson Marlborough before). They have done major renovations in the hotel (entrance, restaurant, rooms) and the result is superb. I liked it before but currently, in my opinion, it is one of the best hotels in London (and the location is wonderful!). It really has a modern style but it is very comfortable and it has a familiar atmosphere. The staff is great (especially at the restaurant) and, in the very few occasions that I had to report a problem, they have dealt with it quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated - good location but room tiny and breakfast bad.”
Reviews.Author: i-love-ayia-napa
Reviews.Content: We travel to London regularly and have stayed in many 4* hotels in the City. Our favourite is the Marylebone Hotel (Jurys Clifton Ford) and after our recent stay at the Radisson Bloomsbury st. that does not change. The Radisson hotel has some very positive points - in particular the location. Very close to Tottenham Court Road Tube Station and within walking distance of Covent Garden, Soho, Oxford Street. It is 15 seconds walk from the British Museum. The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful and I would put them top of the list for this. This is especially the case for the reception and concierge staff. Well Done. Staff in the breakfast room were the complete opposite though. Thats another story. First time I've even been shouted at in a restaurant. I asked for butter - none came with the cold toast - and was walking back to my table when I heard the girl shout an Oi Mate at me and handed me a small dish of butter. So much for table service and manners!!! The rooms: TINY TINY TINY - even compared to other similar London hotels. I know we had a good deal through superbreak that included breakfast, but it was only 15stg of a saving and that does not permit putting a 6ft 2 person into a room where the roof was almost hitting his head and legs off the end of the tiny double bed. Ok - they did change us when I explained the situation. Was told it was an upgrade. What a load of rubbish.... if it was an upgrade I would have been so angry to have paid more for it. Almost no room to walk around the bed. Obviously close to a bar/nightclub playing techno music until 1.30am. When I lied down in bed I could see the ripples in my bedside water glass from the thumping music. I would say it was one of the most noise afflicted hotels I have stayed in. Doors banging all night, front of house powerhosing at 5.30am followed by room above having bath at 6am. They might as well have been in the room with us. The noise insulation is bad. Room was very dark. Bathroom was large, with heated towel rain and lovely fluffy towels. However, the flood that was on the slippy floor when we had a shower meant that we had to use one of the bath towels to mop up the leakage from the inadequate shower screen. I slipped getting out of the bath but managed to right myself. I mentioned this to the check-out staff but was just told it would be looked into and sorry about that. Breakfast was just OK. Typical english breakfast and some fruit, cereal and youghurt available. Q was massive and the room was full to capacity. Tables all on top of each other and only 3 staff visible. One of which was the rude butter girl. Orange juice was like acid. I know this review sounds bad and I guess it wasnt the worst experience ever - but it was just for one night and when converted to Euro it cost 200 euro. Not worth it at all. The staff and location were top notch but the room and breakfast general darkness of the place made it a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed and central location”
Reviews.Author: Shanehoustonlittle
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because it is more wheelchair accessible than the other hotels we researched in London. We were travelling with my father and mother and wheelchair accessibility was a major concern. Their room was great and our room was right across the hall. The king sized bed was comfortable and the room was large enough so that the bed did not swallow the room. The decoration was more boutique than large chain. We had ample storage for our clothes and the bathroom was so large we left our suitcases in the bathroom with more than enough room for two adults. We could see the grounds for the British museum from the entrance to the hotel. The front desk staff were sensitive and attentive to any request that we had. The " English " breakfast was worth every pound and our family of non-breakfast eaters started off everyday having breakfast in the lobby. This area was close enough for us to walk (push) to Covent Gardens, SOHO and even the Tate Modern. This location was central to all of the train statinos that we needed for our side trips. We usually stay in boutique / small hotels but we did not feel lost in this hotel thanks to the recent renovation and staff attentiveness.

Reviews.Title: “Another endorsement for this lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ally,UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 2 night leisure break after finding a great "Friday night free" deal on the hotel web site. The recently renovated rooms and public areas are tasteful and modern with touches of luxury throughout and the courteous staff thoroughly deserve all their positive reviews. The buffet breakfast was not included in our rate so we paid for the continental breakfast and were very satisfied with the range of cereals/fruit/pastries/cold meats served in the chic restaurant area. The hotel is in a great location for the West End shops and theatre district and is also a short walk from the bustle of Covent Garden and Leicester Square. Will definitely put the Bloomsbury Street at the top of our list for the next trip to London!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zen1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in august and found it to be superb. The entrance/reception area is very impressive. The room we had was large and very plush with a huge 40inch tv and big comfy bed. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The only downside was the bar prices. The hotel has a stunning bar area with huge plush sofas and lots of black marble and it would be a lovely place to have a drink before going up to bed but the prices were stupid. We had two brandies and one coffee and the brandies, which were just one pub measure of brandy, were £10 each!! this is way overpriced and just annoyed us. Hence this lovely bar was always empty!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent stay, for a city hotel providing a theatre break really relaxing and made to feel very welcome”
Reviews.Author: JeffWoods
Reviews.Content: this hotel provided my wife and I, a perfect theatre weekend, an hotel which is close to all the theatres. Rooms were very modern with all amenities. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and will definately return again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snicksb
Reviews.Content: We staid in the Radisson for 1 night as we went to the theatre. We could not fault the hotel and the staff were great as well, very friendly and helpful. It is in an excellent location for the theatre and very close to a tube station. We would recommend a stay there. A++++

Reviews.Title: “beautifull hotel, small room!”
Reviews.Author: JOJO97
Reviews.Content: We stopped for one night and the service was excellent, the hotel was beautifull and plush and always smelt like flowers ( i think they pumped air freshener through air con) its recently be renovated and you can tell as everything is brand new and spotless, the security is very good, if you want to get to the bedrooms via lift or stairs you need to have room key to activate. The area is lovely its very close to the attractions and the theatre but in a very safe neighbourhood. The buffet breakfast is a real treat and well stocked, the restaurant is great and the staff are very friendly. The only thing I didnt like about the whole hotel was the smallness of the room for the price but it is London and it did have the benifit of air con so I maybe being picky lol!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: FrancineMerseyside
Reviews.Content: From entering the hotel, to checking-out, the whole experience was FABULOUS! Recently renovated, contemporary in design and minimalstic in appearance, the hotel was spotlessly clean! The breakfast room was air conditioned and spacious. My bedroom was large, tastefully decorated, with plasma TV, iron board and iron. The bathroom was amazing!! The hotel staff are very pleasant, courteous and helpful. And.... its location is brilliant -close to Covent Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Just a perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyCheltenham
Reviews.Content: We were orginally booked into a double but to our delight up graded free,the room was large clean and modern with all the usual things tea coffee etc, the bathroom was the same large clean and modern with bathrobes. The buffet breakfast was great all you can eat with a wide choice of food from fresh fruit ,pastries, cerals and bacon, eggs etc. All the staff were very polite, helpful and friendly. It made our weekend to see the Jersey Boys perfect,I would stay again no problem and would recomend this hotel to any one

Reviews.Title: “The most convenient, comfortable and out of the way hotel you'll find in Central London”
Reviews.Author: kenwenStAlbans
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Radisson Edwardian for a long weekend and had the most comfortable nights sleep ever. In fact, it was so comfortable we just called the hotel to find out what the bed was! As courteous as ever, we got a reply in a day :) Anyway, the hotel is in a fantastic location that is within walking distance of virtually everything you'll want to do in central, central London and if you don't mind the walk you can get to Waterloo and Knightsbridge on foot. Super comfortable beds, courteous staff - maybe the only niggle is the rather average buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for galleries, museums and theatres in London”
Reviews.Author: Rob_from_Salisbury
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Street. ALL the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The complimentary anniversary sweet they gave us at dinner was a very nice touch and much appreciated. The room was lovely. Absolutely brilliant and, of course, the location was perfect for the theatre, galleries and the British Museum. 10 out of 10! We will DEFINITELY be back and have already recommended you to friends and family planning to go to London.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bokshi
Reviews.Content: the hotel was beutifull, always smelling good, the service was excellent, i came here for medical reasons and was taken care of by staff including house manager...the location of the hotel is perfect, i was in a fragile state but the comfortness of the room exceeded my expectations... surely i recomend this hotel and the next time i come here for my surgery ill be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a theatre break”
Reviews.Author: CatWomanSP
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel having been transferred from the Kenilworth ( sister hotel) which did not have room for us. The hotel reception staff at both hotels were efficient, helpful and pleasant. The hotel booking was made as part of a theatre break package and it was certainly very convenient for the Dominion theatre and also the British Museum. Breakfast was good, with varied choices available from fruit to cooked buffet.. Our room was a quiet and comfortable twin but rather small and dark although, as we did not spend much time in the room, this was not an issue. The quiet air conditioning was much appreciated. The only suggestion I would make would be to clear the rubbish, including black bags and wooden palettes that we could see from the small window that looked out onto the internal service area. The fact that this was at the head of fire escape stairs was concerning.

Reviews.Title: “Ok- very small beds!”
Reviews.Author: luce_loo_1987
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location walking distance of Oxford st and the theatres. We had booked a double room and when we got to our room we were just shocked by the size of the bed, it was so small! We called reception and they said they didn't have any other rooms, so on our way out I spoke to a guy- can't remember his name but began with a V I think! He said he could move us 2 another hotel- which we didn't want, he said to go out and come back see him later, which we did... He took us to the new room which was a corner room with 2 single beds- we took this room as it was bigger and decided we would get a better sleep with our own beds- would of preferred a big bed but was told they were full! Other than that everything was good. Breakfast was nice and lots of choice, staff were friendly and hotel was very modern. Only 2 things that I would say is, there are no plugs near the mirrors for dryers and straightners, and the hair dryer in room you have 2 hold a button down the whole time you want to use it. Would recommend this hotel with these things in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to come back”
Reviews.Author: DnJDundee
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have stayed at a Radisson Edwardian Hotel and I would definitely return. Having stayed at a number of Hilton hotels before with a view to being loyal to one particular chain, I had noticed an inconsistency in the quality of their hotels and the appalling maintenance and housekeeping of the rooms and grounds in a couple we stayed in recently in Scotland, so we decided to try somewhere different. The online booking process was straightforward and provided a good room rate. The reception staff were friendly and efficient. The hotel exterior and communal areas were very well maintained and appeared immaculately clean and orderly. The room was immaculate and the housekeeping staff were polite and friendly when we spoke to them. The room was in an almost perfect state of repair and the air conditioning was quiet and kept our room comfortable during our stay which was during warm weather. My only minor negative comments would be that the shaving mirror in the bathroom was loose and the large towel rail wasn't working (turned off due to warm weather perhaps?). The reception on the large plasma screen in the room was quite poor however holidays aren't about watching television so this was no problem although if I'd been staying there alone on business this might have been an issue. The room was luxurious and quiet and the bed was very comfortable - almost too comfortable. The ice/water dispenser in the corridor was a nice touch too. The breakfasts were of a high quality with a varied range of foods (buffet/continental/fruits/yoghurts etc.) and the serving and bar staff were courteous and efficient. I hope that these high standards are maintaned as the hotel matures as I realise that it was recently refurbished. I will definitely be choosing one of their hotels over any Hilton when I stay away and hope that the the standards of the other hotels in this range are consistent with those in Bloomsbury Street.
