The nearest tube station was Tottenham Court Road (5 mins walk) and there are a few restaurants and takeaways around the hotel. The hotel is a short walk to Oxford Street and Russell Square. I would recommend the King Deluxe Room which we upgraded to on arrival. It had his/hers sinks and a glass partitioned wetroom which was huge and had a deluge showerhead as well as a regular showerhead. I'll definitely be back if I get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but customer service lacking.”
Reviews.Author: bluecarmg
Reviews.Content: Great ambience at this hotel and ideal location for Covent Garden,Oxford Street and Theatreland.Unfortunately some elements of the stay were disappointing. 1.A bedside light was not working and despite 2 promises to rectify it nothing was done. 2.The promised vouchers were not received until I returned home 3. I did not receive the morning paper(Telegraph) I ordered the night before.The reason given was none were available to the hotel that day!!!No alternative was offered. 4.Despite lots of staff being on duty at breakfast attention to detail was missing eg no butter /jams/marmalade...no replenishment of milk/coffee unless one got up from table to ask.Ordering from the menu was also difficult with noone coming to take orders...had to leave table to order. 5.Although this was a more expensive hotel(chosen as a special occasion)I've had far better quality/choice /service at breakfast at the Holiday Inn!!! 6.Ice machine in corridor did not work. However room was nice and comfortable and the evening meal and service were good.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the refurb, some of the rooms are tiny and dark.”
Reviews.Author: Brittania09
Reviews.Content: I stayed in thus hotel a few years ago before the refurb and it was so bad I never came back. I only decided to try it again because of a recommendation from a friend. I wish I hadn't bothered. I was offered three rooms all supposed to be doubles. All of them were small and dark and and one had a window that opened out onto a roof section that was covered with cigarette butts. After almost half an hour I have ended up with a room that looks onto a building site. There is no chest of drawers to put anything in, the wardrobe is tiny the safe deposit box too high and awkward to get to and - my pet hate- I cannot sit down in front of a mirror to dry my hair. The mirror is a thin strip above the desk and the chair is too low to let you se yourself in it. Were any women involved in designing the rooms? The lobby and public areas are flash, but other than being a bit cleaner and recently decorated, the rooms are still not up to much. I've cancelled my room for tomorrow night. The staff did their best and were courteous despite me being unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Fab Location, Super Front of House Team”
Reviews.Author: Panna
Reviews.Content: Location great, front desk very welcoming, excellent parking service, room small typical London - but had ever thing we needed and tastefully decorated. Breakfast buffet very good selection shame breakfast staff seemed a bit disorganised. Room service didn’t sort out our super hot room air didn’t appear to be working they fobbed us off, wish now I’d gone down to front desk to sort but it was 2:00am. We had an early evening meal in the restaurant okish but not wow, not everything available on the menu. Would stay at the hotel again definitely due to location and very helpful friendly front desk, parking service and concierge. Added bonus free wireless internet access

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Sophisticated yet affordable”
Reviews.Author: morteee
Reviews.Content: Dear traveler, The newly renovated Radisson Edwardian Bloomsbury Hotel, formerly the Marlborough, is located close to Covent Garden, Oxford Street and the British Museum. A Perfect Location! The moment I stepped into the lobby, I knew that I had made the right choice in choosing the Bloomsbury Street Hotel. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. The lobby is very spacious and simply decorated yet very sophisticated and tasteful. I had booked a king deluxe room and was shown several rooms from which to choose. When I saw the rooms, I was impressed at the size of the rooms, but I was also impressed with the size of the bathrooms. Each room had a flat screen TV, a mini bar and complimentary high-speed wireless internet access. The hotel and the rooms are immaculate and well-looked after. I would definitely, without reservation, recommend this hotel to all my friends and colleagues. I can hardly wait to revisit London this spring and stay at the Bloomsbury Street Hotel. Curt Mortenson Los Angeles, CA.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service and location.”
Reviews.Author: jsandberg
Reviews.Content: Travelled from Sweden to London on vacation. We stayed four of us in two rooms. All areas including the rooms were modern and recently refurbished. The air-conditioning worked fine. The hotel staff was very professional and helpful. Free wireless internet was a definite plus. It was very easy to get to and from the hotel with its convenient location close the British Museum and Subway stations. Walking distance to anywhere in Soho. I can definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hi quality rooms in the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: RalfGras
Reviews.Content: The Edwardian Bloomsbury hotel is completely renovated, the rooms are fresh, very clean, modern and especally the bathrooms design is superior for this kind of price level. The hotel is value for money plus top location. We have not tried the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location for theatres”
Reviews.Author: happy_vegemite_too
Reviews.Content: On arriving my 18 year old daughter and I were upgraded by Kumar to a deluxe room with king size bed as no twin beds were available as pre-booked on-line. Kumar was very welcoming and mentioned a note about theatre tickets. ( I had asked the hotel if they could book theatre tickets, I received an e-mail reply in the affirmative about a fortnight later by which time I had purchased the required tickets on-line). Our room was on the 4th floor. A long passage led to a separate wardrobe and desk area beyond which was the bedroom and en-suite bathroom. The bed was very comfortable, the room extremely spacious. There were many windows, all of which opened easily and the room was light and airy, air conditioning was also an option. The decor was subtle and added to the quietness of the room. The bathroom was large with a long bath and modern shower heads. The two way switch at each end of the passage didn’t work. The safe was on the top shelf of a tall wardrobe, I am tall and found it cumbersome to access. The buffet breakfasts were fantastic: fresh fruit, nuts pastries, cooked items, one felt spoilt for choice. The breakfast room had a lovely buzz to it and felt warm and welcoming, the staff were very attentive. The hotel is very conveniently located to the West End theatres, all of which are an easy stroll away and to the British Museum. Tottenham Court Road tube station is a few minutes walk away. Wi-fi wasn’t working when we arrived, we were told we could use the cable connection at a charge. The next morning wi-fi still wasn’t working, we were told we could use the computers in the business centre, a very small room, and both computers were in use. I then asked if we could use the cable connection for free and was told we could do this whilst the wi-fi was down. When we came to check out we were charged for our cable connection time (one hour) whilst wi-fi was down. We were also charged for two bottles of water from the mini bar which we hadn’t taken. The person checking us out was cold and aloof and seemed disinclined to believe us, even asking us to name the person who had given us permission to use cable connection for free. (She didn’t dispute the non availability of wi-fi). Fortunately Kumar happened to be strolling by and quickly reversed these charges. It did leave a sour taste in the mouth.

Reviews.Title: “A smart comfortable hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Hopeful2
Reviews.Content: I travel to London regularly for both business and pleasure and I always try to stay in Radisson Edwardians so I have stayed in several of them now. After a multi million pound refurb, the Bloomsbury St hotel (formally the Marlborough) is now very smart, comfortable and tranquil. The furnishings and linen are sumptuous and everything is very clean indeed. An acid test for me is always whether a hotel feels clean enough for me to walk on the carpet with bare feet and I certainly can here. The staff are extremely efficient and very friendly both at reception, in the restaurant and housekeeping. Would stay here anytime with my family and have recommended it to business colloeagues. A special thank you to Mr Mehra for sorting out my room booking problem on my last visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JBrown64
Reviews.Content: Spend 4-5 weeks in London a year and have stayed at every hotel possible. The "new" Bloomsbury Hotel is the best of the best. Newly refurbished with stunnning rooms. Great location and best staff I've encountered. Though all the Radisson hotels are generally superior, this is their crown jewel.... The siutes are the most glamourous rooms I've ever seen in London.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal central location for theatreland”
Reviews.Author: RicardoWestbury
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not too large to be impersonal, staff are friendly and polite. Whilst some rooms can be described as cosy (Small) they are all clean, comfortable and stylish. Some rooms can be noisy if the window is opened onto the one busy street adjacent to the side of the hotel. Very wide range of food for breakfast with fresh cooked egg dishes. The location is perfect for the British Museum, about 200yards (230 metres) and has good access to many of the Theatres by foot. Loads of small restaurants about and public transport is easily accessed.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for another lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: Barnaby41
Reviews.Content: Another overnight stay at this great hotel while visiting my mum and brother. Checkin quick and soon settled into room before seeing family. I stayed in a deluxe room which was of a good size but I do agree with comments that rooms do differ as I have experienced this for my self but was moved to a larger room when asked....I assume that would not have been impossible if their hadn't been one available so perhaps my views of this hotel could have been different. But I have to say that all rooms I have stayed in have always been well maintained and beautifully clean. TV has a wide choice of channels with good signal and the choice of movies fantastic......never had such a wide choice. The staff I have always found extremely friendly and helpful and nothing seems to much trouble. The position of the hotel is fantastic and if you were sightseeing everything is on your doorstep......something that you should be willing to pay for and compared to most central london hotels I feel the Bloomsbury is good value for money. I have eaten in the resturant once and it was great. I always have my breakfast sent to my room and I cannot fault this......a little added luxury that makes you feel even more special and the gentleman greets me like a long lost friend which is lovely. My brother and mum move from Gower Street soon but I will continue to stay at the hotel when visiting London. As a solo woman traveller I like to feel safe and secure and that is how I feel at the Bloomsbury

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great”
Reviews.Author: Erastel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice one. Rooms are quite big, people very kind. It has a nice bar just behind (hopefully because no much pub or restaurant around). Internet is free of charge and breakfast are quite ok. No much to say : nice place to stay for business!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AusNews
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Radisson Bloomsbury for 7 nights,outstanding location, staff fantastic, bar open till late, Internet free & wickedly fast. 5 minute walk to Soho & Covent Gardens. several restaurants within within 3 mins walk, Laundry across the road, Museum 200m up the road. highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel for !st Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugs08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend for our 1st Wedding Anniversay. The room was a fair size for London, clean and well priced. Breakfast was fantastic. Lots of varied choice but rather pricey at £17 per person. The location is superb and perfect for us. Literally a stones throw from the british museam. Can see it from the enterence of the hotel! Also about a three minute walk to Tottenham Court Road Station. Overall this was a great hotel. We are both in our 20's and would thoroughly reccomend this hotel to all and will be returning when we next stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler35Zurich
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay in this hotel and choose it because of the the very good location as well as for London it has got quiet spacious rooms (not to be compared with US-standards). The staff is professional and friendly and after the renovation of the hotel last year you feel like home. I surely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Shandylincs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to go to Take That Concert Breakfast was fantastic Room was really lovely but I did book a Double and we Ended up with a twin the hotel was fully booked so we had to stick with it, but saying that we have had an offer from them that we can not refuse I will certainly be going back ;-)

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in the heart of London with a friendly team”
Reviews.Author: fashiongem
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is set in the centre of London and a stones throw away from the Shaftesbury Theatre and Oxford street. The hotel team were extremely friendly and helpful through out our stay. The food in the hotel restaurant was stunning.

Reviews.Title: “This beautiful hotel is a stones throw from londons famous oxford street.”
Reviews.Author: adrian1975
Reviews.Content: Having arrived at this hotel we were greeted very warmly with a special welcome from Kumar the hotels public relations manager, who could not have done enough for us. As is was our first wedding aniversary Kumar had arranged for chocolates and strawberrys for our room which was very beautifully decorated and modern with all the mod cons you would expect from a radisson hotel ie. plazma tv mini bar and in room internet access. The food in this hotel is amazing and well priced, if your not sure what to have try a combination of the cooked meat and seafood platter that arrives in a lovely wooden box. Breakfast was also amazing. This hotel is located five minutes from the main shopping district of London which is the famous oxford street and the hotel is also very near the london underground subway, which will get you anywhere in london high speed rapid. The only downfall with this hotel is that the bar closes way to early, try throwing an irish man out of a pub at one o clock in the morning it doesnt go down well. Well done to all the staff here that made our visit so magical.

Reviews.Title: “I could not have picked a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: HaveCaseWillTravel_9
Reviews.Content: The reception / lounge area was refreshingly cool during a hot spell outside. Staff are well mannered and pleasant and attentive. The room that I was in was very comfortable and there is a hearty breakfast in the morning. I didn't eat in the restaurant simply because there is excellent choice within minutes to the hotel. Also Covent garden is less then 10 minutes walk. The only downside was the morning paper that I ordered didn't arrive, but I made do with a complimentary daily.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: alexaks
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted by very efficient and professional staff. The hotel looks new and the decor is tasteful and modern. The room we were assigned was on the second floor and was a decent size. The bed was comfortable, and even though the room had three windows, it was very well insulated from the street noise. The location of the hotel is convenient to the center of London. We had breakfast included in our rate, and it was GREAT. Very good service and excellent food selection. Overall we were very satisfied with our stay

Reviews.Title: “Good Days”
Reviews.Author: tun10273336
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time and would most definatly do it again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in great location”
Reviews.Author: PushingTheSenses
Reviews.Content: i have stayed there twice this year and will stay again next time i am in london for leisure. the location is great, only a short walk from tottenham court road/ oxford street and covent garden/ leicester square - all of the rest can be easily reached by bus and tube. hotel and rooms are newly refurbished in a modern and trendy style. the first time i got upgraded without noticing it and got a spacious, quiet room. the second time the room was significantly smaller, but still not too bad for london standards and certainly large enough for a city hotel stay. the great thing about radisson is they offer free wifi service - a thing that most other hotel chains lag behind and makes their rates great value in comparison to other hotels where you have to pay extra for it. another plus: staff are very friendly and go out of their way to assist customers.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome and a very comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Petriburg
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Radisson hotels in the USA, I was interested to see how a London hotel would compare. My wife and I were not disappointed! Our room was immaculately clean, comfortable and well provided with refreshments and entertainment facilities (including some late-night "street theatre" courtesy of the Met Police and an agressive scooter rider!). The air conditioning guaranteed a comfortable sleep on a very humid night. The hotel restaurant menu looked very impressive, if not a little pricey, but there are a number of good restaurants and bars within a few minutes' walk of the front door. For those reliant on public transport, the hotel is a very short walk from two London Underground stations and the area is well served by cabs and buses. A short walk also takes you right into the heart of Covent Garden and the British Museum is also very close by.

Reviews.Title: “An efficient and relaxing experience'”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsLizzie
Reviews.Content: I travel to London on business at least once a month and often more and discovered this Radisson when it was th venue for a meeting I attended. Sine then, it has been substantially refurbished and it shws! I now stay there every time I come to London and I combine business and pleasure by staying tehre either before or after a business appointment. I have stayed in a veriety of rooms all of which have all been excelently appointed, some with great views of London with the starting point being the British Museum across the road. Significantly, weather permitting, it is a pleasant walk to Euston from the hotel and only round the corner from Oxford Street with easy access to shops and theatres. If I had a gripe it would be that room service could be better in terms of the food being kept hot but the staff do their best to help in this regard and are fast and efficient at delivering fod and drinks. I am always made welcome and staff on reception treat me s a regular customer and actualy appea to remember me rom last time! This is a luxury hotel wher I feel 'special' with staff ready to respond to any request fro service. I am always disappointed if I am unable to get a room there so I book early to avoid disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SCS
Reviews.Content: Helpful and attentive staff; good location and impressive decor. Our room was a good size (king deluxe) and the bathroom was very modern & had a great rainfall shower. It's central to oxford st & the british museum. Just round the corner there's a great french restaurant "Savoir Faire" and the food is fantastic. It's a little quirky decor wise but great food and very competitively priced. Could not recommend it high enough.

Reviews.Title: “Oh yes, this is more like it!!!”
Reviews.Author: tartanfraggle
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems opulent and boutique-y when you enter, and you may think it's a bit too clinical looking because of the black marble foyer - but trust me, this place ROCKS! I was booked into this hotel as my original choice was unavailable and I am SOOO glad! The staff were brilliant - welcoming and professionally friendly. My room was compact without being poky, beautifully decorated, fresh and comfortable with an excellent bathroom. I had my breakfast delivered up to my room for a very reasonable charge - and when I left the next morning the helpful staff and the charming concierge gave me a map to find where my meeting was taking place, and directions for the quickest, safest route. Such warmth and helpfulness was a surprise, and I am very glad I was booked in there instead of my original choice! I want to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully and completely remodeled, modern, ideally located.”
Reviews.Author: SpuddBrother
Reviews.Content: This is a very, very nice property that appears to be completely refurbished (not simply remodeled!) Our room was really perfect for our needs. The bathrooms, with their rain-style shower heads and marble or granite construction was definately a highlight. The British Museum is less than a block away. There is a small convenience store across the street. There is a bus stop 1/2 block away and the Tottenham Court Road subway station is about 2 blocks away. There are theaters within walking distance, a major YMCA health club, many restaurants, shopping, and other retail stores. The St. Pancras international rail station is nearby. If you are in London for business or pleasure, you really can't go wrong by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “cramped”
Reviews.Author: ronan19m
Reviews.Content: room was very small, can get better hotels for the same price ..very avg

Reviews.Title: “One of the best london hotels I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: JAMESY417
Reviews.Content: Our fantastic experience at the Radisson began as soon as we arrived .After a very early flight from Belfast we were allowed our room from arrival at 1100 am. The staff were friendly , hotel was immaculate , room was very well appointed with superior views and an excellent bathroom. Right in the centre of all the theatres , an underground station a short walk away our only regret is not staying longer. Highly recommended we would certainly stay here again when visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: STA8
Reviews.Content: Centrally located and modern. Good service. Food average.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and service, reliable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: leela2002
Reviews.Content: Hi I like to try and stay here when i am in london. I am a lady and i travel on my own - this place is safe, friendly and cool. Rooms lovely and nice smellies - the bathrooms do not disappoint. Clean bedding and great room service. I arrived on a late sunday evening and needed to print some bits for an event the next day. The two chaps on reception were brilliant - they sorted it all out for me and I emailed them the docs and even thought the format was wrong - they sorted it all out for me and did me lots of copies. Breakfast coffee is great also and I got porridge on request. I will be staying again soon. L

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a Boutique Hotel......no sterile chains here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PowerPopLondon
Reviews.Content: When you walk in it feels different from the normal chain hotels immediately. Very chique but not overly so. The bar area greats you and the check in staff and concierge were particularly helpful and polite. My room was one of the best I have stayed in and the room was enormous with lovely furnishings and wonderful bathroom......all you need PLUS a massive flatscreen TV!!!!! Down in the bar the staff were really attentive and the atmosphere relaxed. Didnt experience the restaurant but if it was like the rest of the experience it would be worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, well located”
Reviews.Author: TabascoStHelens
Reviews.Content: I have used this hotel many times over several years which will tell you that I have a high regard for it and the service that I have consistently received. With the disruption of a major refurbishment now long passed, I can confirm that all concerned have sought not only to maintain service quality to the previous high levels but have managed to exceed them. I find the front-of-house reception always welcoming and helpful, without becoming overbearingly obsequious, while any query or request has without fail received the necessary attention. Rooms are spacious and well equipped (including air conditioning), with suitable sound-proofing to keep the traffic noise to a minimum. The hotel is ideally situated to allow walking access to the varied delights of Theatreland, Oxford Street, Covent Garden and Soho while the proximity (5 mins) of Tottenham Court Road station allows easy entry to the underground system. Finally, given the general excellence of service, I must nevertheless make special mention of Kumar, the Guest Relations Manager, and Aaron in the breakfast room, for their helpfulness and willingness to engage with guests, thereby setting an exceptional standard of customer care for their colleagues to match.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely upgraded hotel !”
Reviews.Author: HongKongSalee
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on the way back from St. Petersburg - prepaid internet rate was 345 pounds for 2 nights inclusive of taxes, complimentary newspaper but excluded breakfast but included complimentary internet in the rooms. Hotel has just recently undergone major refurbishment and was really nice and very well furnished with a separate walk in closet area. Room was not spacious but was very adequate. Location was excellent for access to Covent Garden and the West End. We love West End shows and the restaurants at Covent Garden and Chinatown - all within a 10 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Bob123456789
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a superior room, which although a little small, was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was spacious, clean with an excellent shower. The breakfast was reasonable enough, and included in our room rate. The cooked English breakfast could have been a little warmer, and I would have been disappointed if I had paid the £17 menu price. However, tried the pancake option the next morning, which was very nice. However, there were a good choice of additional breakfast options, and service was quick and attentive. As has been mentioned, very convenient for both the British Museum and Covent Garden, and short taxi drive to St Pancras station for Train and Euro Tunnel links. We found the staff to be very pleasant indeed, and credit to the barstaff who whipped up a mean Mojito. Didn't try the restaurant but the bar meals were very agreeable. Will be our London hotel of choice for future visits

Reviews.Title: “Great service, in ideal spot”
Reviews.Author: suzandgoats
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from a friendly and knowledgable team. Will definately use again if up again

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location with exellent help from the Hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Eborwolf
Reviews.Content: We came with freinds for a Westend show and arrived very early but our rooms where vacant so checked in the where Staff so very helpful , the rooms very modern with all we needed ( very quiet hard to find in hotels these days ) We had all our meals at the hotel very good choice both breakfast & dinner and on departure we left out luggage for the whole day until train time home an excellent experience all round we will stay again .

Reviews.Title: “The perfect weekend!”
Reviews.Author: TheatregirlHereford
Reviews.Content: Our trip to London was to see We Will Rock You (a brilliant show and one I would definitely recommend) and to meet friends. On our arrival at the hotel our room wasn't quite ready and immediately tea and coffee appeared with compliments of the hotel. I absolutely loved the little cast iron teapot. The staff were very helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Our room, an upgrade, was very spacious and extremely comfortable and our walk in rain shower was huge. Bliss! As someone with MS, space to move around easily is essential and I later realised we'd been moved to a much nicer room so I owe the reception manager (I think that's his title) a huge thank you. I appreciate all the extra effort he went to. The breakfast was exceptionally good and the breakfast manager (I think that was his title) who had served us the tea and coffee the previous day had obviously remembered our conversation because porridge appeared almost without me having to order it. Scrumptious. The cooked buffet was hot, very fresh and had an excellent selection. My husband said it was the best breakfast he'd had in a hotel in a long time. The cold buffet was just as good and there was plenty of different freshly cut fruit to choose from. An excellent start to the day. The hotel is walking distance, even for someone with MS, to Covent Garden and the West End so the location is brilliant and there is lots to see and do nearby. If you can't walk that far there are lots of bikes that could be hired and take you wherever you need to go and they're more fun than a taxi. The British Museum is just across the road and the garden is a really nice place to sit and people watch or just experience the beautiful building and artefacts. It was the perfect weekend and we are already planning another theatre trip. We will definitely go back to the hotel again and hopefully very soon. Thank you to all the staff who made our stay perfect!

Reviews.Title: “good service rooms really only for 2”
Reviews.Author: statmanie
Reviews.Content: great service rooms suitable for 2 only clean great location

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: CypryHunter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel as part of a two day meeting and i was very impressed at the level of service, the standards set and the fantastic facilties the hotel had to offer. The staff was very polite and helpful and put themselves out to help in anyway they could. Rooms was superb, clean, spacious and had all the mod cons (Internet, Wireless Access, Large LCD TV etc) One of the best parts is the meals served in the restaurant, which had been prepared to the highest standards and food that caterred for everyones taste. Overall top marks, and i will certainly use the hotel again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, comfortable, friendly efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: Leedshead
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situatred in the heart of theatre land. It is clean and stylish. The staff are very helpful, friendly and efficient. I enjoyed my stay in this hotel and would definitely advise others to go.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, new hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Holly16
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights in March. The hotel is very newly refurbished and has modern decor. The room was quite small, but not sure how this compares in London. The bathroom was enormous and fantastic (except for the hairdryer which - bizarrely - is powered into a draw in the wardrobe in the bedroom!). The hotel is walking distance to British Museum, Covent Garden, Oxford Street etc. It's a good base for exploring on foot. The internet didn't work when we were there, but we could use the internet at the sister hotel just across the street. When we checked out they charged the wrong rate - saying the rate fluctuates daily! After a few minutes and after they checked the rate on the check-in form and my booking confirmation it was fixed and the overcharging refunded - so no major dramas - but suggest guests keep an eye on it when checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: X20
Reviews.Content: Shopping or theatre land ? This is the hotel. Just a few minutes easy walk to shops/ theatres./museums. In fact from here you could walk to almost any London attraction but buses and underground are on hand. Totally renovated to a very high standard, staff really helpfull. Full Breakfast has everything you could want. Very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - much better than anticipated”
Reviews.Author: LotusOxfordshire_UK
Reviews.Content: We originally booked at the Radisson Edwardian Kenilworth but, on arrival, were redirected to the Bloomsbury Street hotel which was just across the road. The hotel has been refurbished recently and is in first class condition in the rooms and in the public areas. The rooms are of a reasonable size for a short stay (slightly larger than many I have stayed in) and are very modern, clean and well equipped. Reception staff were efficient and helpful and all other staff were very friendly. The hotel is conveniently located for Covent Garden and the West End theatres.

Reviews.Title: “They've got it absolutely right”
Reviews.Author: Nik_Davy
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for a romantic birthday treat for my wife. I paid a bit more for a deluxe room, but boy was it worth it. The room was a reasonable size, much larger than I'm use to in London. The decor was modern and fresh and the room spotlessly clean. My wife is always fussy about the bathroom and even she couldn't find anything to complain about!!! There were no cups in the room to make tea/coffee, mentioned it to reception and it was rectified by the time we got back, so really not a problem. We were going out for afternoon tea and the theatre so didn't get a chance to sample the restaurant and was gutted when we saw the menu as I think we missed a great opportunity, the menu sounded great and very reasonable, the head chef, Redmond Hayward has an excellent reputation and I would urge you to try the menu as I think it would be worth it. If you haven't booked yet, why not?????

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Broadsword1959
Reviews.Content: having arrived after an overnight flight from the US into Heathrow and heading into central London was pleasantly surprised that at 9.30am the front desk team had a room ready for me. The receptionist was helpful and gracious and check in was speedily completed. 2nd pleasant surprise was the room - newly refurbished, well laid out and clean. After a quick unpack and shower in the well appointed bathroom i hit the mattress for a sound 3 hour sleep. Room facilities were excellent and the in-room directory informative. The quiet ambiance of the lounge bar was the perfect way to have a pre- sleep tipple Checking out the following day, I was able to leave my luggage securely as I did around 4 hours of shopping. Can not praise the staff highly enough - made me feel welcome and I will hopefully be back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay in London I have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: Beautyspot
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a dream, I stayed for a long weekend with 3 girlfriends and it was made very memorable by the quality of the rooms we had and the friendly efficient service we received. The location was ideal, within easy walking distance of top London attractions and hot shopping spots. We enjoyed days out aided by the concierge who gave us loads of tips on where to go and how to get there, and knew we would end our day in the comfort of the beautifully decorated and comfortable lounges, bar and bedrooms of the hotel. Thank you to everyone there for making it the best trip to London I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel within walking distance of Covent Garden”
Reviews.Author: bellamacBirmingham
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this very modern hotel which has been totally refurbished from last year and the standard of rooms and service is first class. A large selection at breakfast and very tasty fresh food. The staff were very friendly and courteous. It is in a superb location as it only takes about 10 -15 minutes to walk to Covent Garden and Leicester Square. Overall I thoroughily enjoyed my stay and will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Jersey boys trip”
Reviews.Author: 1963my
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel because of is proximity to the Prince Edwards theatre. Hotel was excellent, staff lovely and location great. Would recommend it. Jersey Boys was also amazing. Woudl use Hotel again ,and go to the show again. Also if you want the British Museum, couldn't be closer - just cross the road, and about 200yards along, you're there.
